The liquid had a tendency to settle into pores and hair follicles leaving little brown dots.<br />It wasn't the worst self tanner I ever used but it was way trickier to get it just right.   43. I was VERY skeptical when it came to self-tan products. I did a little research and decided to try this product. I have read some reviews that stated the gloves that came with it were very flimsy but I must say that after using it about 5 times, my gloves have not ripped. This product does come with a mitt that you put the product on with. I recommend that you wash the mitt in the washer not by hand. by doing this it will decrease the amount of shedding from the mitt. This product does not turn me orange and I have fair skin. I am a nice golden brown and im so happy that I decided to try this product. I LOVE IT and will NOT go without it from here on out.   48. Bought this for my daughter. Seems to work great. We generally only do one application per week because she is so pale. She doesn't want it to look like she obviously used a fake tanner.   49. I ordered this product in early spring before prom and all of the other senior activities that I wanted to look great for. This is so easy to apply, and I am a self tanner newbie. It goes on so flawlessly and easily. My tan looked a lot better than some of my friend's professional spray tans (which cost so much more!).<br /><br />Applying this correctly is key. Apply before bed so that the tanner has time to soak in. Make sure not to have any lotions/moisturizers on the skin before applying. I prepped my skin by taking a shower and using dove's sensitive skin bar of soap. I think the more basic, plain CLEAN you get your skin the better. Then exfoliate with shower gloves/mitts. I shave after cleaning and exfoliating my skin, in order to get the closest shave possible. You basically want to get your skin as bare and clean as possible in order for the product to go on smoothly with out blotches or streaks, this also helps to allow the product to really soak in, giving it more staying power. After doing all of the above I apply the tanning liquid with the mitt provided. I recommend wearing dark pajamas, long sleeve shirt and pants. Some of the product will rub off and this way it won't noticeably stain your pajamas and minimally stains your sheets. I like to moisturize my skin the next day so to lock in the tan.<br /><br />A good tip that I found if you don't have someone to help you get your back is to spray some of the tanning liquid onto a dark rag/towel and as if you were drying your back off, with one hand hold the top of the towel and one hand hold the bottom, wiping the towel across your back.<br /><br />Overall this product gave me a beautiful, even tan that lasted for about a week. I highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a high quality, affordable, and easy to use self tanner. Although it's not the fastest, I think properly prepping your skin and applying this right makes a world of difference. I plan on using this throughout the summer to maintain a beautiful tan, without the damage from the sun.<br /><br />PS: One bottle of this has lasted me 6 applications so far, and I have probably 3/4 more left.

There is no bending in odd angles naked in the shower while a very very good friend spray paints your butt.<br /><br />(We're still friends BTW)<br /><br />This product broke my tanning habit. I'd quit because I really didn't think it was good for my skin and had been pale for about 6 months, plus it really was time consuming and a little expensive. Professional spray tanning wasn't an option for everyday as it was way to expensive and apparently some of the chemicals in it aren't that great….<br /><br />This product dries quickly and you can get dressed within 10 minutes - not 2 hours (did I mention my last self-tanning adventure involved sitting naked in the tub watching Golden Girls for 2 hours?). I haven't had any issue with it staining clothes except in VERY hot weather.<br /><br />CONS:<br /><br />The mit is a little flimsy and cheap and it's starting to fray a bit after two weeks of use. I splashed a bit of water on my legs on accident walking through a puddle and it left streak marks. They came off that night when I got home and it wasn't permanent but that happening was not ideal.<br /><br />OVERALL:<br /><br />I can't say enough. I've been converted. No more money on spray tans. I figure that saves me $60 amonth. I've gotten so many compliments on this and use it daily.
  72. I give this product 4 stars because:<br />PROS:<br />-Amazing, natural looking tan. I have naturally fair skin that tans easily. Gave me the bronzed look I would get normally by laying out after several weeks. Multiple people complimented me on my skin tone/tan when I was wearing this product.<br />-Relatively easy to apply. gloves and mitt are a must. Once i took off the gloves midway through applying, still using the mitt, and the next day, woke up with one hand bronzed.<br />-Lasts several days.. I apply 3 times a week.<br />-Doesn't smell as awful as some of the other self tanners i have tried.<br />-Doesn't streak (as long as you rub in well) or look orange at all.<br /><br />CONS:<br />-I apply this 3 times a week, but after reaching a certain level of darkness, I'm finding it hard to get any darker.<br />-If you get wet AT ALL after applying, splotches and looks like you have a skin disease. After applying, I wash my hands immediately after. Several times even the smallest droplet of water from the faucet would hit my skin, leaving a weird spot.<br />-it fades poorly. I find that the crease between my forearm and upper arm (where your elbows are but facing you) started to peel/fade unevenly, which also made me look like i had a skin disease. Once this happens, it only gets worse if you try to reapply more self tanner after exfoliating like crazy. Only solution for this issue was waiting for like a week for the entire tan to come off, and starting from scratch. I also got some of this weird peeling effect on my chest area, and on the top of my feet. And i exfoliated every few days to try and make the tan fade more evenly, but it still looks bad.<br />-Since it's not a moisturizer, and i apply after getting out of the shower, made my skin dry since i couldn't apply moisturizer after getting out of the shower like normal.<br /><br />Overall:<br />I like this self tanner, because of how tan it gets me. However, every so often, because of the weird and uneven peeling of the self tanner, I have to wait for a week, scrub it all off like crazy, and start over again. So i'm constantly alternating between being super bronzed looking and looking like i have a serious skin condition. I'm still going to continue to purchase it, but I definitely don't think it's as amazing as all of the other reviewers are saying.

  91. I was intrigued on trying this out, I happened to find this product out on amazon, by accident really, I have not seen any youtube videos or other reviews about this on blogs or anything. While I am aware that there is a big hype for this product, I really don't think it's all that great. When I read the and reviews, my gut instinct felt it would turn out like a similar product I own, St. Moriz. and let me say, they are almost identical minus the formula which this is a spray and St. Moriz is a foam.<br /><br />The biggest deduct a star for me, is the fading. This stuff fades really fast. It's been two days, and I have moisturized pretty well and my tan is way lighter than it was in the beginning. Don't let the color guide decieve you, it's there for a reason, so you can see where you apply the product. The bronze in the color guide is what makes you look dark initially, and then some gets washed off in the shower, making it slighly lighter looking. In comparison to different tanning formulas, specifically lotions, I find that they develop better on my skin and my golden tan stays that way for at least 5 days before I need to reaaply.<br /><br />The smell is okay, I was hoping for a burst of fruitness or something really tropical but it smelled pretty blah to me, slightly of coconut but definatley smelled like self tanner, the developing odor wasn't that bad and it was tolerable.<br /><br />Given the ingredients and the way it wears on my skin, it is just like St. Moriz. It dries out my skin really bad and fades way too fast. I don't have the patchiness or lizard skin yet, cause I have been moisturizing but I know it's gonna break apart here soon and I will not be happy. I think this tanner mostly \\"stains\\" your skin rather than developing it with the DHA, which is weird because DHA is high on the list of the ingredients, which is what develops your tan...<br /><br />Oh and the bottle leaks like crazy. THAT in itself is extremley irritating. I read reviews that you need to cut the tube and it will stop. I don't get what that means because the leaking is coming from the base where it screws off and also the nozzle.<br /><br />Anyways, will continue to use lotion based self-tanners. No more sprays or foams for me!

It is not greasy and dries a lot faster. It doesn't have any funky smell. You can SEE where you are putting it to avoid streaks. It comes with gloves and a mitt so your hands don't get all stained. The only downside......BEFORE you insert the sprayer into the bottle, cut about an inch off the bottom of the sprayer tube. It is a little long and can cause oozing out of the top of the bottle. Once I cut down the tube, this problem was solved. I love this product. It is easy and it looks great! I recommend buying a balm to put on knees and elbows before using this, but it is not necessary. I highly recommend!<br /><br />UPDATED JUNE 2014:<br /><br />I used this product twice this year and it was great. The third time I used this it turned GREEN! I had a big green stripe down my leg. I thought maybe it was the mitt, but I opened the bottle and dumped some of the solution into the sink. THE SOLUTION TURNED GREEN! I don't have any idea what would have caused this. I used this product all last year, and had no problems at all. I don't know what the chemicals are, but something is definitely not right! I will not be purchasing this again.

  113. I'm fair skinned and definitely not the most skilled person out there at applying tanners. I love that this one came with the mitt and gloves. With this you're supposed to apply it and leave it for 5(ish) hours then rinse off (in the mean time be prepared for a STRONG sunless tanner smell and a weird brown color). Aferw rinsing, you're left with a golden tan. I have dry skin and no matter how much or how little I exfoliate, this seems to apply and wear a little patchily. Even after trimming the &#34;straw&#34; it leaks down around the nozzle and gets everywhere. I feel like if you enjoy liquid tanners, you will enjoy this but there are easier ways to fake tan (I think I prefer lotion-based ones).

Each video suggested just two squirts on the upper arm, two squirts into the mitt for the lower arm, etc. I thought, \\"Wow! This must be a really intense product if you need that minimal amount during the application!\\" Also, this scared me into being very, very careful as I applied. I applied at night before bed and showered in the morning.<br /><br />After TWO separate applications (two days apart), I was ready to give up. The product only went on semi-tan and then all washed off in the morning (no loofa, just soap on my hand). I just couldn't believe that SO many people were raving about the amazing tan this product was giving them. Maybe I'm too pale? Maybe I messed something up?<br /><br />I decided to give it one more shot. This time, I doused myself in the product. Directly sprayed 6 times to my upper arm, 4 to the lower, etc. Rubbed it in nicely with the mitt. I looked nice and tan! That was the first time I felt hope for this product. I went to bed that night with a tan smile on my face. When I woke up in the morning I was even tanner. I'm talking professional airbrush tan. Yay! I took a shower and yes, some of the color washed off which is to be expected. But this time there was plenty of color left. I'm not a Hawaiian looking goddess, but I look summer sun kissed.<br /><br />I will probably reapply again in two or three days as I have a wedding to attend this weekend, but I'm really happy with the color.   150. I've tried quite a few self-tanner products and this one is probably the best one yet. Not only is the application easy but it doesn't leave you looking like a cheeto (orange). It dries so quickly and doesn't leave you feeling sticky nor did it stain my clothes afterwards. The smell at first is like coconut scent instead of that nasty self-tanner smell. However follow the directions and apply this after you shower/exfoliate/shave and at night so you can sleep on it. I applied this immediately after I exfoliated/shaved/showered/dried off and the next morning I barely saw any brown in the water during my shower. Don't apply this during the day (or night) if you're planning to go out. The smell is no longer like coconuts and it does start to smell SLIGHTLY like the typical self-tanner smell, especially if you sweat. The smell does go away after you wash it off though. After I washed it off the first morning, I actually reapplied it because I had plans to go out that night. But throughout the day it started to smell a little (it was hot too) so I washed it off before I went out that night. It was on my body for 6+ hours but when I washed it off there was a lot more brown in the water. So applying it before you sleep really does help the product seep into your skin and thus last longer! I reapplied this for three nights in a row and now I'm a nice tan shade. I'm going to be re-applying this every week (only once) to maintain it. So far so good! I only applied it from neck to toe. I'm not going to risk it on my face in case it accentuates any large pores. You can always use a darker foundation/bronzer on your face to even it out. Oh and it did not streak/accentuate hair follicles/pores on the rest of my body though so that's another plus. I think this product was worth it! Cosmetic Solutions was actually out of stock when I ordered it even though it said it was in stock. So I had to wait a week longer to receive the product. I wasn't too upset about it because they replied telling me when they would restock and shipped it immediately so I appreciate their service. Try this product out! It's almost $30 in stores. I really like it so far.d telling me when they would restock and shipped it immediately so I appreciate their service. Try this product out! It's almost $30 in stores. I really like it so far.

  178. Best fake tanner I've ever used! Super natural and subtle, and no streaks whatsoever. And it is so easy to apply. I've been recommending it to everyone. I even use it on my face with no problems with clogged pores or streaks - just use the brown side of the mitt and one or two sprays. It's a little unclear what side of the mitt you're supposed to use for what, but I just use the dark (soft) side for everything. I also apply a body butter to my wrists, elbows, knees and ankles before applying the tanner. Finally, when I'm all done, I apply the body butter to my hands, spray the tanner onto the mitt, and rub it into the tops of my hands. A lot of the color will come off in the shower (you will probably be about half as tan after showering), so you might want to apply two coats if you want a darker tan and don't be afraid of the color you develop because it will fade a lot in the first shower. However, this is just the color guard and the actual tan does not fade quickly in subsequent showers. I think my tan lasts about a week. I've been reapplying every 1 or 1.5 weeks.

This is by far the easiest of them all to apply with the mitt. The color is the most natural and the mitt helps you get the most even application you can ask for from a self tanner. Remember, some color will wash down the drain when you next shower, but if you're not as dark as you'd like, reapply the next night. A couple hours before bed, shower and shave and use a rough exfoliating glove to remove surface dead skin. I also lightly apply an \\"in shower\\" body lotion or oil such as Alph Keri and gently rinse off. This keeps the product from collecting on any rough patches, elbows and knees. Dry off and air dry a couple minutes. Apply the product using the mitt with circular motions. I cover up in a light lose sarong for an hour or two so that I'm sure it's dry. I put on silky pj's and go to bed. Next morning, shower, apply body lotion and go to work. Not perfect, but as good as it gets.

The first time I did it very lightly since I was new to it. It's only been 5 days and it looks like I've been tanning for a while.   222. I am 29 years old and have recently quit going to the tanning beds to save my skin. Even the high pressure beds with only UV-A rays are still damaging. And I live in the LA area so we have many options!<br /><br />The foam mitt makes application a cinch. No staining on my hands or fingers. I also wear latex gloves each time I apply. I have them for other purposes since I tint & highlight my own hair. You can get a box of gloves for under $10 here or at a beauty supply. My husband helps me with my shoulder blades, center of my back plus my lower-middle back. He doesn't use any rubber gloves under the mit and doesn't ever have a problem with staining. Also his part takes less than 60 seconds. The dark side of the application mit kind of holds the product and it doesn't come through onto your hands.<br />Wash the app. mitt each time you tan to save the life of it, also seems like it could get crusty if you didn't wash it<br />Bend elbows and knees, tan over them quickly and smoothly -careful not to have a full mit of product when you touch these areas.<br /><br />Application takes less than 5 minutes and it dries really fast. The color actually improved a bit as it started washing away 2 and 3 days after application, but I still appeared spotted. The only good note I have about the color is that there were no streaks, and it was even. Application was certainly much easier than any other self-tanners I've tried, so that's a plus. I allowed the color to sit for a couple hours before going to bed, but it still stained my bedsheets; it washed out fine, but I'd suggest putting something over your sheets just in case.   286. I was so thrilled to try this product from all the rave reviews and the inexpensive price. As a novice to self tanner, I was trying to prepare myself by watching tutorials on youtube for this product and the people made it look so effortless but let me just say it's incredibly difficult to apply this product. The 'professional' mitt that it comes with starts flaking/shedding within a couple uses. This is probably because of how hard I'm pressing this over my skin and you really have to apply pressure because if you don't, you'll end up streaky because this product dries incredibly fast. Fast, I mean like in 15 seconds fast. I've applied this on my face too by just mixing three squirts of the tanner into a sufficient amount of facial moisturizer to cover my face and it comes out with an even color. The color isn't orangey, but it does come out patchy in a lot of places due to the contours of your body and the fast drying time. But it is worth what you pay for.
  287. I am 40 years old and fair skinned. Over the years I have use many many different brands of self tanners on the quest not to look orange or have the product sink into my pores after shaving my legs! I have also found that most self tanners cause me to break out if used on my face. For the past several years I have been using Clarins Self Tanning Gel which had been my gold standard. I must say, Fake Bake gave me better color and I was even able to apply it to my feet and still look like a natural tan. It is true, as others have said, that when you shower after application (I apply before bed and shower in the morning) you do lose some of the color initially, but once you have achieved your desired shade that is no longer a problem because the tan lasts for several days. It is only after application that you see that initial tinge going down the shower drain but you are still left with beautiful color. I have even used it on my face with no problems breaking out. In my opinion the key to the even look of the tan is to use the mitt that is included. Although, I am sure I am losing some of the product to absorbtion into the mitt. The results make it totally worth it. I will buy this product again and again this summer! This is surely my new \\"gold standard!\\"

And yes, I know all the things you are to avoid once you've applied it - no skin oil, no lotion that contains lanolin or oil. After getting out of the shower, don't rub dry...etc., etc. Even so, I feel like the color lasted only 24-48 hours. Will I keep buying this - yes because I feel like the ease of application and the natural color I get outweighs the short staying power. I will continue to seek out ways to keep this from fading so quickly.

  349. I'm a guy that recently went on vacation to Miami and Vegas, and didn't want to blind all the beautiful people with my winter paleness. So I bought this on recommendation from my girlfriend, and it works really really good. The mit does a great job at applying the solution evenly without streaks.<br />A few notes for those trying this for the first time from my trial and error:<br />- Take a shower first and exfoliate if you want the tan to last longer.<br />- Don't apply too much at once. Similar to painting, if you get too eager and apply too much at once, you'll develop streaks.<br />- Do several light coats over a few days.<br />- Do not sweat when after you apply it to your body, or let water touch your skin.<br />- Put lotion on drier parts like elbows and knees before applying tan.<br />- After the tan has had several hours to do its magic, take a shower to rinse the residue off. Water will run brownish, and is normal. This is the residue running off. If you don't shower, you will ruin your clothes.<br />- I had to do 3 applications before achieving a beautiful, natural looking radiant tan.

  373. I have been an avid tanner for years. I have tried every UV bed, spray tan, and tanning lotion on the market. I have olive skin when I'm tan, so I try to go for the natural brown and not orange look. UV beds were addictive until at age 26 I had to have a tumor removed from my skin. Seriously, if you use conventional UV tanning, I guarantee you'll care when you get tumors/cancer and your skin will seriously age by 30. I now have a scar on my chest, less than cute! Spare yourself the scarring if all you care about is looks.<br />I had a membership for sunless tanning that seemed to be the only way to get a regular tan somewhat conveniently. At home tanners never got me as dark and were all streaky when applied.<br />THIS TANNING SPRAY AND MIT SET IS AMAZING!! This stuff is sooo easy to use and gives me an instant dark tan with the bronzer, and develops to a very natural colored dark tan over a few hours, so that by the time you shower and rinse off the bronzer, you are tan underneath. This DOES NOT rub off on clothes and goes on so easily. I spray the mit about four or five times and rub it onto my skin. The fantastic thing about this spray is that you can add more or continue to blend it into skin and it doesn't get all dry and streaky like other sunless tanners. I've never had to leave streaks due to too many layers of tanner or too many attempts to blend it. The combination of the gloves and mit completely prevents my hands from staining. The mit makes application incredibly fast and smooth, streak free. This stuff dries amazingly fast (you can still add more to the dry parts to add more color or even out a streak) and doesn't get on clothes. Where I used to have to carefully apply lotion, wash my hands a million times, and stand around naked waiting to dry, now I quickly apply this and immediately go get dressed. My skin always looks tan now. It takes only about five minutes to apply over the whole body. There is literally no inconvenient aspect to this spray. Itis as easy as drying your skin off with a towel, only you're applying tan. It lasts for about three days and then when it starts to fade it does so evenly and without patchy spots. You can even add contouring to your body (think extra cleavage and instant abs). I am so excited to find this product. I am canceling my spray tan membership, which will save my hundreds a year, I don't have to worry about skin damage AND I can easily look great every day. Amazing.<br /><br />Update: This is still my favorite tanner months after my original purchase, and after trying several others including mousses and sprays. I just ordered my second Fake Bake kit. My mitt wore out around the time that I ran out of tanner. It was still usable, but had little pills on it that caused streaking. I had also been using it with other tanning products, so if I had used it alone, it would have out-lasted the Fake Bake spray. So you get a new mitt every time you buy this product and the mitt lasts through the use of the entire 6 ounces. I washed it after every tan application with warm water and whatever hand soap I had on hand. I then let it air dry. I did cut the plastic pump bottle tube so that it was not longer than the bottle is tall. I will do that again with my new one. This product smells so good that I actually get complimented on what scent I'm wearing, as if I'm wearing perfume. It's a tropical coconut smell. The reason this is hands down my favorite tanner, even though I've found one that is darker (St. Moriz Dark Mousse), is that it is so easy to apply and dries so fast that as soon as I set down the bottle and wash the mitt, I can go get dressed. It always looks really even, not splotchy, even when I'm being lazy and apply it without much attention. Even my most hard-core tanning friends don't like tanning every day because their products are a hassle and they have to wait an hour to put on clothes. You could easily use this every day. Takes me 10 minutes tops and always looks better than being pale!
  374. I am always pleased with Fake Bake self-tanning spray. Some of them turn me orange, some are streaky, and some have barely any color payoff. This product however, is amazing. The box comes with everything you need. Included in the box is: instructions, the application mitt, plastic gloves (to put on your hands under the mitt), the self-tanner, and the sprayer. Make sure you exfoliate before using this product, because your tan will be a lot more even and look nicer. You spray the self-tanning solution on the mitt, and blend it by rubbing the mitt in circular motions on the area you want to tan. I use this everywhere, my whole body, hands, feet, and my face as well. The solution is very dark when you put it on, so you can see what areas you have already done. Don't worry, most of it will come off in the shower. I like to use this at night so it has plenty of time to set in before I shower in the morning. It dries almost instantly, and doesn't have that disgusting self-tanner smell that most similar products have. It has great color payoff, but if you want to be darker you can use it a few days in a row until you achieve the color you want. In my opinion, Fake Bake Flawless gives me better color than a spray tan in a salon. I'm extremely impressed with this product and would recommend it to anyone that wants a nice, even looking tan without using a tanning bed.
  452. This product is truly amazing. Everyone comments on my \\"tan\\". It does not look like a \\"fake tan\\". One bottle goes a long way.
  453. Works well ~ great product!!
  454. Fake Bake goes on easily and personally I will only use self-tanners that contain bronzers so that you are clearly able to see exactly where you are applying it. You can easily see this product when applying which makes for an easy and even application. I feel that this product gives a nice, natural color tan. The only reasons that I would not give it 5 stars is because it rubs off very easily on clothing, sheets and towels long after it has dried. The other reason is that I don't feel that the color lasts very long. In order to maintain a decent level of tan, I find myself applying this product daily.
  455. The only tanning product I have found that looks natural, doesn't smell horrible, and fades evenly. Whether you are new or experienced with fake tanning, I would highly recommend this product. One of my favorite things about this product is how fast that it dries on your skin. They recommend that you don't sleep on white sheets without your body being covered so that it doesn't transfer, however I have done this quite a few times and there has never been much transfer onto my sheets. I get when I use this tanner I get compliments on how healthy and glowy I look. Give it a try!
  456. I discovered this product through a beauty guru on YouTube and immediately bought it off Amazon. Ultimately, I'm very pleased. I've just noticed I'm running low and came back here to repurchase. This stuff is awesome, DOESN'T SMELL, doesn't stain clothing, dries quickly, and most important the tan is very long lasting and looks REAL. I'm quite pale and this didn't turn me orange in the slightest bit. Be wary of using it around elbows, knuckles, and knees though. Make sure to use a good moisturizer before tanning those areas. I'm also really pleased with how quickly I can apply this product. After showering, it takes 10 minutes max to apply. I would recommend spraying directly on your skin and rubbing in with the mitt, as I've found spraying it on the mitt wastes a lot of product. All around, 5 stars.

  494. This is the only tanning product I use.<br /><br />I am very fair, so in the spring and summer if I want to wear spring clothes this product is a must!<br /><br />Notes/Tips:<br />You must cut the plastic tube to fit properly in the bottle, measure before cutting. It is always better to have it too long than too short.<br />Whenever using a self tanning product (or before a spray tan) it is best to exfoliate your skin (and shave the areas you want shaved) BEFORE you put on the product. I shower and use a scrub and pat dry with the towel.<br /><br />Next put on the gloves and shake the bottle very well.<br />Put on the mitt provided in the box (whichever hand you prefer) then spray the mist directly onto your SKIN, then rub it in gently with the mitt.<br />You do not want to rub it too hard because it may irritate your skin.<br />The mitt is very soft, I think that the brown side works best for rubbing in the product.<br />The Fake Bake formula does blend very nicely, it does not appear &#34;fake&#34; (isn't orange, at least on my skin) and it is even (not splotchy).<br />You can see where you have sprayed the product on your body but it does darken after 6 hours.<br />With any tanning product you want to do it before bed.<br />DO NOT SHOWER OR PUT ON LOTION AFTER PUTTING IT ON (don't put lotion before putting it on either) This is wash the tan right off and you will have to do the whole process all over again! (that may seem obvious but I read stuff all the time about people complaining that it doesn't work, but they were at fault not the product.)<br /><br />Allow the product to dry, I normally just hang out, clean up the news paper, and put everything away.<br />It is very important to wash the mitt as well, the tanning product may cause it to dry weird (with the fibers standing up) and it isn't a smooth application, plus a lot of the product remains in the mitt. Remember while rinsing the mitt you are not supposed to get yourself wet!<br />Right after that just go to bed, wake up happy and tan then go shower! You will see some of the color wash off of you, this is normal.<br /><br />WARNING: the spray is used to tan/stain your skin so it will also stain what it comes into contact with! I cover the floor with newspaper so that the mist does not stain anything.<br />The product does have a nice smell in my opinion.<br /><br />Maintenance tips: Refrain from exfoliating your skin where the tanner is applied, it may become splotchy since you are tearing up your skin.<br />When drying with a towel you must pat yourself dry, rubbing excessively will make the tan fade (this goes for all unnatural tanning)<br /><br />I also really enjoyed this particular seller, the processing of the order/shipment was VERY fast, and the woman that I spoke to was very kind. Good customer service, I will be purchasing again in the future.

  542. This stuff is the best self tanner available hands down! Due to turning 39 and the effects of tanning becoming more noticeable on my face and chest at an ever increasing speed, every year I spend a few hundred dollars buying all the number one, two and three top brands on the review lists. It seems like I have tried this brand before but it wasn't a spray, maybe a lotion? I always just end up with a cabinet full of useless, smelly lotions, mousse and sprays and end up back in the tanning bed. That will not be the case this year. This product gave me a better looking, darker color than tanning everyday. I have my own tanning bed at home and I'm afraid I'll just be using it to flat dry my sweaters from now on. After reading some more reviews I find out I can even make it better with blending balm I ordered it right away. I didn't buy anything extra (ie...blending balm, shimmer something, body polish for exfoliating) just what comes with the kit. I put regular Gold Bond Ultimate lotion on my hands, feet, elbows and knees and I wasn't stingy with it. I just used regular soap in the shower with a loofa. For sure use the gloves under the mitt because it dries fast and you won't be able to wash it off in time. It was easy to put on thanks to the guide color. It does not smell bad like every other one I've tried. I put 3 or 4 sprays on the mitt at first and then of course thought if 3-4 looks that good then 4-5 will be great. Nope....I have one tiny area that is a little darker where I first pit the mitt down but it is totally my fault. Everything else looks 100 times better. It is a nice golden brown, even coverage and super easy and fast. I did not think about the spot on my back that I can't reach before hand so I had to improvize a little and even with the delay of trying to rig something up it came out even. Without a tan my skin is pretty fair, kinda blotchy red for the most part and now I look like I have tanned for at least a month and I only used this one time. I can't wait to get a second application on and see how it looks. I can't imagine it being any better than it is right now. If anything changes with the wear and tear of day to day living I will be back with an update. Sorry this is so long I just want everyone to be as happy and relieved to finally find something worth the time and money.

I then pat dry with a towel.<br /><br />The color doesn't go on as dark as I thought it would based on reviews, but you can see where it's going. To make it darker I just spray a lot on the mitt. I use this one on my face too, I spray a light amount on a foundation spounge and rub it on in circular motions making sure I get my hair line and under my chin evenly. I do have to wash my face a couple times a day because I have oily skin and so the face only lasts a day. I also have to use a good face wash or my face will break out.<br /><br />Once the tanner is dry on my whole body I get dressed in my pjs and go to sleep. It doesn't transfer to my sheets or clothes and I find it to be a pleasent smell. My main issue with it though was that it stunk- badly!<br /><br />This product, [[ASIN:B0046VGPHQ Fake Bake Flawless, 6-Ounce]] has been by far the best of the bunch I've tried! I get compliments on my tan, not asked if I used a tanner...<br /><br />For reference, I'm of Southeastern descent with naturally light medium beige skin. I have a bit of an olive undertone when I get sun and this tanner mimicks my natural color after some sun. It is not fake looking!<br /><br />Nicely buildable; this can be used daily to build color. Even just one use gave me nice results! Just enough to cover light flaws. If you have any veins that are visible and just want to wear less foundation or concealer, this is helpful!<br /><br />Smells fantastic! No more stinky faces from my husband, lol (asking me not to use the prior product)!<br /><br />Not streaky! Following the instructions by using long circling strokes, it applies evenly and does not look like it is something that has been applied!<br /><br />Fades nicely! If you don't use it for a week or two, it doesn't blotch or look like its cracking or flaking away in areas where you bend... Like your crelbows or neck, as spray tan often does!<br /><br />No more funky palms! I've used dishwasher gloves to apply other products but still somehow ended up with the dreaded orangey hands. This goes on with included gloves and a mitt. Works great and no complaints!!<br /><br />I use a blend of my own essential oils, before applying this to my feet, hands, knees, and elbows. (The product info does recommend another product the manufacturer makes for this but my oils work fine.) I do not use any lotions beforehand or find that this product is drying to my skin.<br /><br />It takes me more than the ten minutes (other reviewers stated) but I'm pretty thorough about blending it well to avoid any streakiness. (Maybe more than needed.) Dries quickly and I get dressed as soon as I'm done applying it, with no issues of clothes wiping it off.<br /><br />I'll be buying the version made for face next, although so far I'm happy with this product overall. It is recommended because it is said to not show pores like this one does. (Having years of experience in the beauty field, I know facial products work best for the face because our pores are smaller on the face than the body, so this makes sense to me.) It should absorb better on the face. I will update this review after trying that one out!<br /><br />A little goes a long ways! I've used this product several times over about two months and haven't made much of a dent in what I received. Excellent value!<br /><br />Highly recommended! Smile. Buy with confidence. HOWEVER, and this is THE BEST PART ABOUT THIS PRODUCT:<br /><br />You can mix this solution with a lotion that you use regularly as a moisturizer. This mixture can be applied daily to maintain the initial dark tan you apply. The benefit to this is you can make it as dark or as light as you want, you can mix it with any fragrance lotion and it doesn't make you smell like you are wearing self-tanner, it is good for those times where you just need a quick instant glow, and your product will last longer!<br /><br />I also want to note, that this is a professional product and you cannot beat the price. I am a licensed Esthetician and Cosmetologist, and this product sells on Amazon for the same price I can get it at a professional beauty supply store.

  669. There are some things about this product that are great, so I'm giving it two stars. Unfortunately, the most important thing we're looking for in a self tanner (the color) is not so great. When I began to apply it that night, the first thing I noticed was the awesome coconut smell that it has that just smells like summer. The guide color is very dark, which was great because you really can't mess up. You can see very clearly where you are applying, and while this is a liquid, it spread and blended incredibly well, dried amazingly fast, and actually left my skin soft. I did not expect that. When morning came, there were no stains on my clothes or bedding, surprising because of the dark color guide. The pleasant coconut smell had been replaced by that signature I've been using self tanner smell, but not the strongest I've smelled compared to others I've used. Plus, no big deal because I was headed for the shower to wash the guide color off. Once that color was all rinsed down the drain and left as a yucky brown ring around my tub, all of the color was gone. It literally hadn't done a thing. So the next night, because it dries so quickly, I applied it twice before bed. Again, post shower the following morning, I'm left with no color. I applied it three times the next night, still pale. Come on. By that point something should have happened. I am a very pale natural redhead and I have had the problem of getting no color or very little from self tanning products before, but not this bad and some do work. I also took someones advice of leaving the guide color on, but while running errands it began to sprinkle and I ended up in the grocery store with weird looking splotches where the color began to run. Not a good look. I don't know if the people who posted pictures are wearing the guide color or it doesn't work well on very pale skin or if the bottle I boughtwas old (bought on another site), but it just did nothing for me besides leaving me with a dirty bathtub.

I was very skeptical, since Alcohol SD is the second ingredient, and it advises against any lotion. I was seriously concerned that my skin might feel so tight by the time morning rolled around that it wouldn't be worth it for me...however! Once I exfoliated (since i live in Utah where it's extremely dry AND have very dry skin, this step is always frustrating, since i cannot ever seem to get every piece of dry skin off of my legs, but I digress. Point being: I scrubbed as much as I possibly could), I rubbed lotion into my elbows, knees, feet and hands, then sprayed this onto the mitt and applied it onto my legs, working upwards. I was a bit worried first because the tanner really stuck to any pieces of dry skin still stuck on my body, so my legs looked weirdly blotchy where I wasn't able to get the dry skin off completely (and believe me, I really tried - again, i have crazy dry skin). I got dressed in a long sleeved black shirt and darker colored leggings and went to bed. The next day, I didn't have time to shower off but I wasn't bothered whatsoever, since NONE of it had transferred to my sheets during the night OR the clothes I had slept in. Also, once I woke up, my skin did not hurt like it usually does if i don't use mass amounts of lotion; i still put lotion on, which seemed to even the bronzer out that would've been washed off if i had chosen to shower, and the blotchy pieces of dry skin blended in more. During the day I was in 100+ temperature, so of course a lot of the tanner transferred to my clothes (I choose a black dress, so i wasn't too concerned) but that night I threw everyting in the washer and it ALL washed off - no problem. Once I showered, my legs became totally even and I was still left with a nicely tanned naked bod. After a few days it did start to rub off - but it was more when my skin was dry and got flaky, or if I exfoliated. No big deal, I just repeated the process, and was beautifully tan again!<br /><br />I would definitely recommend washing the mitt after every application - I throw mine in the washer and dryer, and no problems yet!<br />Don't worry about staining clothes, it washes out of any clothes you may get this on if you aren't able to shower (or choose not to if you want to keep the bronzer on for a stronger tanned look, which I recommend as long as it's within controlled temperatures).<br />Unlike St. Tropez, this stuff doesn't rub onto your sheets - I sleep in white sheets and there was never a problem, although the next night you definitely can smell the self-tanner where you slept (although it's much less than other self tanners, like St. Tropez, leave you with).<br />Be careful when you apply the color onto your wrists, since you want to blend it into your hands...it can get a little tricky to create that blended effect.<br />I do love the color this gives my skin, although i prefer the results of St. Tropez more (note: I do not prefer the smell, annoying transfer to all clothes and anything you touch, etc, of St. Tropez - the color was the only thing I liked a bit more).<br />Obviously if you have dry skin, expect to look a bit blotchy after showering or exfoliating, but I've been able to remedy that by popping a bit tanner into my lotion that I use post-shower when that happens.<br />Keep in mind - this is self tanner! Not magic! There will always be drawbacks, but so far, Fake Bake has been a surprisingly great product and I am even more happy that it's so cheap!

I wish I had bought this a long time ago.

  712. Ok so I have been using self-tanners since I was in the 6th grade, which is um 10 years ago. Needless to say I've tried quite a few. From high end like Clarins to Neutrogena and random overseas ones like Sienna Sol. And my god. Never ever have I gotten such amazing brown natural color! Never! I think it even looks more brown and natural than when I use tanning beds, (I think that means I'm a naturally orange-tan person?). The product is sooo easy to apply, virtually impossible to get streaks. Of course I've noticed the more you put on the easier it is to spread around and blend like as in spraying your whole arm, not just your forearm. There is definitely a smell, not immediately but afterwards. But its not as strong as other tanners and comes off once you shower, and honestly for the color I don't care how bad it smells. It dries super fast and doesn't stain anything. And I don't know what I like most, the color or the fact that it doesn't sit in your pores on your legs like so many other tanners do, or the other fact that it doesn't fade like if you have some sort of disease. I've been using it for 2 weeks, gently exfoliating twice a week and putting more product on, and it looks just as good as the first time. The color fades like a natural tan would, no scales or patches. The only thing I've noticed is that putting lotion on your knees and elbows beforehand so they don't become darker doesn't let the color sink in at all, so it's better to not put anything and just lightly pass the mitt over these areas. I also haven't tried it on my face -.- I have very sensitive skin that results in breakouts with any slight change to my facial routine, so I'm scared to put it on. It's not oily at all so I don't think it should be a problem but still I've yet to try it. But trust me, give this tanner a chance. I do believe that people's skin PH has to do with tanning results, but honestly it is soo worth the try. I will never ever go to another tanning bed or use another tanning brand again.

  727. I bought this product last summer and never had the chance to use it. This spring, I thought to myself, instead of looking so pasty for the all of spring and most of summer, maybe I should give this a go. First off, you want to make sure you exfoliate with a product that does not leave an oily residue because if you use this after that, it dries in an odd mottled coloring, almost like you have a rash or something. I know Fake Bake makes their own exfoliant, but I have never tried it. I normally just use those scrubbing gloves and it all works pretty well. You definitely want to do this at night. Even though it was fast drying (which means you need to work relatively fast) a lot of the color comes off in the shower. Not so much that you get no color, but enough that I need to use it three days in a row before I get the color I like.<br />It is very easy to apply, especially with the mit that comes with it. To get an even coverage, I put some Vaseline on my knees, ankles, a little bit of my hands and feet and my elbows. I also use this on my face, but I just use the leftover on the mit from doing my body and dab it on my face for a little bit of color. Overall Fake Bake Flawless has even coverage, is easy to use and has decent color payoff.

  738. As a female in my late 20s, I am really looking at all options to provide me with great skin as I age. Over all I do have young looking skin and I would like to maintain it! Recently I gave up tanning beds, for obvious reasons, but I have very, very pale skin. Although, I do love my fair skin, I personally think I look best with a bronze glow. One of my friends, an esthetician, referred me to Fake Bake Flawless! She swore by it and said it is nearly error free every time. Now, the idea of sunless tanner scared me. I remembered in high school the awful sunless tanners that I tried that left me looking like a walking orange. Fake Bake Flawless really is error proof. Here are some perks I found with using this product!<br /><br />1. Color guard: The color guard in this product is pretty good. I saw exactly where it was being applied. The color guard is dark but it does not look fake.<br />2. Mitt: Easy, easy, easy application! I really liked this mitt! It's very soft. In the picture Amazon shows, it is a brown mitt. The mitt I received was a pink, velvet-like material, on one side, and a spongy side (that I never used) on the other. Fake Bake provides the gloves as a protective barrier because they recommend spraying directly onto the mitt to apply (I used this technique), but I found the gloves to be unnecessary. The solution, no mater how many times I sprayed onto the mitt for each limb, never soaked through the mitt onto my hands. It really works well. Also, it is very easy to wash! Warm water and some liquid body wash is what I used and it cleaned up perfectly every time I cleaned it.<br />3. Scent: The scent was nice! It wasn't over powering and it didn't smell like tanning solution for me. On the other hand, I feel that at the end of my bottle, the scent was a little more condensed, I'm not sure why, but it still wasn't awful.<br />4. RESULTS! I love the results I got from this. Golden glow, never orange, and it faded really well! Just make sure you do the commonsense prep work before applying it (shower, dry off really well, lotion elbows, sides of feet, palms, and exfoliate).

  773. I've tried a lot of sunless tanning products and this one definitely wins first prize. Most products take a few hours to develop. The mitt included to apply the product works great. It's soft and glides over the skin easily, distributing the product evenly. I applied the product by myself and was able to reach most areas, but you may want to have a friend or loved one help you do your back if you plan on wearing something that exposes it.   774. I purchased the Fake Bake Flawless about 1 year ago and have been using it as my &#34;go-to&#34; and ordering it ever since. I am a self tanner junkie, so after I saw a lot of positive reviews of the Fake Bake on YouTube I decided to give it a try. First of all, how can you ask for a better price on a self tanner!? This is the most affordable self tanner (glove included) that I have ever used! Secondly, the application goes on very smoothly and it doesn't dry before I am done applying it yet it doesn't smudge all over my bedsheets or clothes once I'm finished. The smell is amazing, it reminds me of a tropical tanning lotion I used years ago. Before applying this, be sure to rub some lotion on any dry areas..the most common are your elbows, toes/ankles, wrists, fingers, etc. This will allow your dry skin to soak up some of the lotion before it has a chance to soak up too much self tanner (which would have resulted in an uneven tan). I also spray directly on my skin instead of on the mitt and I will usually apply this after I have taken a shower and right before bed..then I'll wake up and BAM I am now a bronze beauty! Or something like that. But, seriously, this is a very good self tanner. It will usually stay on my skin for about 4-5 days maybe a week depending on if I exfoliated beforehand. I have tried some of the popular: St.Tropez, St.Moriz, as well as almost all drug store brands and a few other more expensive brands and none of them 1. last this long 2. smell amazing 3. are this cheap and 4. aren't a huge mess. Well worth every little penny that this bottle costs!
  775. Smells good, beautiful color, easy to apply, natural look, good price, all around great product and best i ever tried.
  776. I absolutely love how the fake bake looks on my skin, and when i tried the flawless finish i was happy with the product.<br />My complaint was the bottle!! It leaks, even when NOT in use all over the box, i had to put toilet paper on the top so that it doesnt bleed out when not in use.<br />I believed it was a one time thing, so when i ran out of the flawless finish, i purchased it again (thinking this time a better bottle will arrive)<br />Same thing with the second bottle....i opened it, used it for one application, closed everything off and by the morning the bottom of the box, and the top of the cap was soaked through, leaking down the bottle itself.<br />I keep it in a cool shelf away from heat and light, where i keep all my other liquid products and lotions without a problem for years.<br />Im sticking to fake bake but im done with the flawless finish spray!
  777. I love this stuff! Easy to apply and it does not look fake. The smell is not as bad as the others either. I will be buying more!
  778. I am in my late 20's and I spent my late teens and early 20's managing a tanning salon and tanning daily. I gave that up years ago but I missed that beautiful brown glow but hated the idea of damaging my skin any further. I spent way too much money on airbrush tanning and spray tan booths which yeilded mediocre results. I tried all different kinds of \\"self\\" tanners out there. This is by far the best. I will never ever use any other product. What drew me to this in the first place was the mitt and the fact that it was a liquid and not a lotion. The application (for me) is flawless every single time. It is dry within seconds of applying. The smell is fantastic and it stays fantastic as the hours go by. Ive used other products that develop a horrible smell after a while. This does not. I get a lot of compliments on my tan and I love telling other women \\"it's fake!!\\" I've recommended this product to every one of my girlfriends and even family.<br />My favorite application tip I picked up from a girlfriend is this: Apply the product to your entire body (even the face!) avoiding the hands and feet. Without applying any new product to the mitt go ahead and do the tops and sides of your feet and toes, backs of hands, fingers and wrists avoiding the cuticles. After about 10 minutes rub some lotion on to your feet and hands. This will soften the dry areas and dilute the tanner enough that it will develop a natural look.<br />It really works!!
  779. It is easy to see why this product has such rave reviews. It smells heavenly! It had been years since I have tried a sunless tanner because I hated the smell they would leave on my skin. However, this tanner smells like the Hawaiian tropic tanning oil we all know and love, well at least the smell of it any way. I will say this product was very different from the creams I used in the past because it is a liquid brown spray you buff into your skin using the mitt provided and best of all, you see immediate results. The coverage is nice and the color is natural looking on my light skin. This spray absorbs into the skin nicely, even areas I may have \\"over sprayed\\" in my quest for the perfect color didn't start to cake. That's impressive.<br /><br />One thing to note, my sister was at my house the first time I used this and although she hadn't exfoliated her legs she begged me to do hers too. She was really excited about the results but since I did both of our legs I could tell my freshly shaven and exfoliated legs absorbed the product better. So don't skip this step if you can help it. Your tan will last longer.

What I do like very much about it is how easy and fast I can get a tan with fake bake flawless. I just exfoliate well, moisturize and just put this stuff on and in about 8 hours or so you will get a nice bronze look.<br />I just want to mention again how well this fake bake tans my chest area. It's the area that gave me the biggest problem when I spray tan, I always end up in uneven patches and streaks! Not with this product though - I like how smooth and even my chests looks.<br />The tan lasts me about 5 to 6 days and even when it starts to fade, it fades 'cleanly'<br />Love it! Worth every penny :)

  788. this stuff is awesome!! I was pale, German and Irish pale. I do not tan, not in the least. I ordered this stuff based off reviews and let me tell you, I am so glad I did! it's so easy and it looks amazing! as several have said before me, I recommend cutting the tube to the sprayer about an inch or a little more so it's the same length as the bottle. second, put a dab of baby oil on your hands, elbows, knees, and feet. that way they are not as dry. it keeps them from looking rusty. third, wash your mitt! I apply the tan all over, take my gloves off and rub what's left over on my hands, let it dry a minute, put the gloves back on, and rinse the mitt out. I don't use soap, just water.
  789. I really like how this is applied with a glove instead of just spraying directly onto the skin, or a lotion that you rub with your bare hands. My only complaint is that I am allergic to the main ingredient in all of these self tanners. This one does not cause my skin to itch quite as bad as the others I've used in the past.   791. The color is a nice golden brown, which is the only star this product is getting.<br /><br />HOWEVER - Tanner color is only good when it's even, and this my friend, is the catch with Fake Bake. The texture is VERY liquid and VERY difficult to apply. I live in New England (which, if you're not familiar with Snowpocalipse 2015, has technically turned into Alaska). I'm white as a ghost by this April and have to fly down to Miami for a bachelorette weekend. Needless to say, a self tanner is in order.<br /><br />I have used other self tanning products in the past, Kheils is still my favorite but this one looked like a nice option because of the price, 2k glowing reviews, and the fact that it came with a mit. I've used the mit from Ulta in the past and it's a game changer! This mit is TERRIBLE quality in comparison to the very affordable mit at Ulta.<br /><br />Before applying the tanner I exfoliated one time earlier in the week, and then again right before the application. I did and extra sudsing in the shower to make sure that there were no oils on my skin. I applied a little moisturizer to feet, hands, knees, and elbows to avoid any dark spots. I put the mit on and noticed right away that it was not the same quality--the foam felt less dense than the Ulta mit. I have never used a liquid self tanner before, only a cream. The liquid is a beast..you spray it on the mit and then rub it in but it's totally streaky right off the bat. It's almost like it doesn't really absorb, but that the liquid stays on the surface of your skin. The mit leaves sponge prints and nasty streaks--places where the liquid is a little thicker and therefor dries darker by morning. I was meticulous and worked in small sections, from the bottom up. I contorted myself and stood still in the oddest positions to keep any creases from drying funky--all to no avail. I woke up this am and have streaks on my arms and feet...god knows where else. I'm running to pick up some Kate Somerville self tan towelettes to try and blend out the lines. I guess I only have myself to blame--I got what I paid for!

  794. First of all, I love the Flawless, because it simply is a flawless application. I started with the Original Fake Bake Lotion and just recently bought my first bottle of Flawless. There are differences between the two.<br />Frequency:<br />-The Original seems to be more of a once-a-week application as it is darker and thicker. I'd worry about getting too dark if I used Original any more frequently than this.<br />-Flawless, on the other hand, takes a couple consecutive nights to get it to a darker color, then probably a touch-up every 4 days or so? Probably depends on where you live.<br /><br />Application:<br />-Original provides the rubber gloves, but you do have to watch to make sure you don't leave any streaks. I used it as a newbie to the self-tanning world and never had any issues. That being said, I would ALWAYS wait at least an hour before going to bed to avoid the color rubbing off on my elbows/knees/feet/hands/face.<br />-The Flawless mitt helps for a smooth application, although I can't help but wonder how much of it is wasted by soaking into the mitt itself. Places like my shoulder I've sprayed directly onto the skin then smoothed it out.<br /><br />Face:<br />-I never trusted Original on my face due to the thickness and deep color it had. I thought it'd be to drastic of a change.<br />-I've also used the Flawless on my face twice with success. Spraying on the mitt is key and focusing on forehead, nose, and cheekbones to define these areas.<br /><br />Hope this helps those of you deciding which to go with!

  816. I can't say enough positive things about this product! I don't know how in the world they did it, but this stuff does not have that offensive fake tanner smell that every other product I've tried has had. YESSS! :) Normally I don't go for bronzers, but in this case it is a beautiful, light brown, somewhat translucent and natural looking shade that's super easy to blend and it helps SO much in preventing streaks! You can clearly see a noticeable, yet subtle, layer of shading go over your skin that guides you to where you need to blend or apply more. Another plus is that using this on your face is a breeze and thus far it hasn't made my acne-prone skin break out at all. Immediately after applying it just looks like you put on a dusting of bronzing powder, not too dramatic or too light.<br /><br />When you first apply this product it has a delightful coconut sent to it, but it isn't overpowering (IMO) and fades as it dries. After that I can barely notice any sent at all, which is perfect! The mitt makes it very easy to apply all over your body more evenly than hands alone. However, my only complaint is that it tends to slide off your hand easily if you don't keep your fingers spread inside the mitt to hold it in place, but no big deal there. As another reviewer mentioned, I would also highly recommend 2 things:<br /><br />1) Wash the mitt gently with soap and water after each application. It only takes a minute and it will make each time you use it a more pleasant experience. And...<br /><br />2) The bottle does leak just a bit when you spray it, so simply trim the extra unnecessary length off of the spray tube so that the end just touches the bottom of the bottle. This should take care of that minor leak.<br /><br />Coming from someone who used to frequent tanning beds in my 20's and gave it up to avoid skin damage, I can attest to what looks like a natural golden UV tan vs. an orange monster from the tan-lagoon. This product is the most natural look I've ever come across from any gel, cream, liquid or wipe (and I've tried a lot). It also looks great on my naturally very light skin tone, which can be hard to achieve sometimes. It might seem just a tad pricy for only 6 oz, but being that it's a liquid you spray on the mitt and then lightly apply, a little goes quite a long way. It should last you awhile.<br /><br />If you're on the fence, I'd highly recommend giving this a try! You'll know right away if it's for you or not. It's also great for those last minute moments when you want some instant color right before going out. The bronzer gives you an immediate healthy glow. For an even darker instant look, you can let the first application dry a bit and then apply a second coat for a deeper result immediately. Then after several hours the more lasting color will have developed under the surface when the bronzer eventually washes off.<br /><br />Truly great stuff... my pale skin thanks you!!ross from any gel, cream, liquid or wipe (and I've tried a lot).   844. I am very fair skinned naturally, and I am cautious about how much sun exposure I get because there is a history of melanoma in my family. However, I certainly think I look healthier and more vibrant with some color on my skin! I have tried several different spray tans, with moderate success. However, the process of getting sprayed, and having to dry afterwards, and having to be super cautious not to sweat or rub on anything is just exhausting (and expensive!), not to mention having to maintain it so you don't look like a dirty, stripy freakazoid. I have tried just about every tan-in-a-bottle as well, from the gradual tanning lotions in every brand, to the $45 St. Tro-you-know-what, and there was always at least one major flaw, whether it be difficult application, unnatural coloring, stinky scent, or expensive pricetag-- nothing was perfect. Until I tried THIS product. It really has everything I have been looking for: the color is by far the most natural and long-lasting and easy to build on; the scent is very nice, and the DHA does net ever smell super strong as your color develops--and the DHA smell is completely gone once you take your shower; the product is super easy to apply and very forgiving (I'm a clutz) and this kit comes with 2 latex gloves to protect your hands and an application mitt that completely and easily gets rid of all streaks; and 2 units of this size bottle lasts me the entire bikini season (which is LONG in Georgia- at least 5 months!); it also works extremely well on my face without causing any breakouts (Just use it more sparingly on your face. I have noticed that too much on my face looks a bit ruddy or dirty instead of golden. Just go easy at first til you figure out the ideal amount! I do one light spray on to the mitt, and apply it where the sun would darken my face. Like a bronzer!). I apply it to dry skin after a good exfoliation in the shower, give it about 2-3 minutes to completely dry (it really is that fast!), and sleep on a towelovernight. In the morning I shower, rubbing my skin with just my hand, and do any light touch ups I might need. That's it! Couldn't be easier!<br /><br />All in all, best self-tanner there is. I recommend it to everyone!

  885. I love taking the sun, but every year, I've become more weary about absorbing the rays for more than a half hour for obvious reasons. Despite my Italian heritage, I get pretty pale during the winter months, so every spring I start experimenting with various types of sunless tanners.<br /><br />The last product I've used before I decided to try Fake Bake was Neutrogena's Micro Mist Dark; Yes, that spay on tan. The smell wasn't as bad as others, but it reminded me of a hair spray smell. The problem with the spray on tan was you had no way of telling how much coverage you had. There was no guide, so you had to spray and rub and spray and rub, so yeah, it kind of defeated the purpose of a quick spray on tan. Not to mention, the results were way too subtle, in fact, so subtle that under certain lighting conditions, it appeared non-existent. I also tried one of the Banana Boat products, but the smell was super perfumy; it streaked, it took forever to absorb, it was super messy and the results were very John Boehner; No thank you.<br /><br />When I first read about Fake Bake, I though the included mitt would be gimmicky, so I always ignored it in the past. This time, I decided to check all of the Amazon reviews, and I made my choice. Well, I'm happy to say the results were pretty amazing. The included mitt makes a world of a difference. It helps prevent streaking and it lets you cover huge areas very fast. It took me 1/10th the time to do a full body tan, compared my previous experiences. It dries super fast, so you've got to keep moving, but it's worth it, as you can put on clothes without worrying about staining, or if applied before bed, your sheets won't become intimate with your faux color. Speaking of color, It gave me nice medium bronze with a hint of that redness, similar to the tone you get when coming home from a long beach day. In the early evening, I took a shower so the guide did wash out, which resulted in a lighter version of the above mentioned, but still, very noticeable.<br /><br />The mitt washes out very easily, and the smell reminds me of the old Hawaiian Tropic sun tan lotion from my wreckless tanning days. It's that familiar, cocunut smell -- very pleasant and not overpowering. As a middle aged man, the combo looks great with my salt and pepper hair. Very pleased with this product.able. The mitt washes out very easily, and the smell reminds me of the old Hawaiian Tropic sun tan lotion from my wreckless tanning days.   906. I had an embarrassing experience with [[ASIN:B0013OJWE2 Neutrogena Micro-Mist Sunless Tanning Spray Medium - 5.3 oz]] in which I had drip marks down my calves that I didn't realize til the next day, resulting in my legs looking like a tanned zebra, and the area where the dripped tanning product pooled--in the arches of my feet and around my heels--made my feet look like I've neither worn shoes nor washed my feet for the past 12 years. VERY embarrassing...my husband had a very good laugh at my expense.<br /><br />I was about to conclude that fake tans need to be applied by professionals...but in reading around on Amazon, I read the great reviews here for Fake Bake, and decided since it was not a spray-on product, I'd give it one more try. I'm glad I did. The color is rich, and seems to last long. It's not spray-on, so there are no drips and less potential mess. The bronzer really does help you to see where you are putting it on, and how much. And the thing that I've hated most about sunless tanners--the smell--is virtually non-existent with this product. Only sign of any sunless tanner smell is when you first wash in the shower after applying...and even then, the smell is very mild.<br /><br />My first application resulted in some slight streaking on the thighs, but that was more due to uneven application. If you are sure to cover all skin area when applying (don't be afraid to repeat over an area) you'll have great results.<br /><br />I did follow all instructions on the bottle, as well as those provided in that first large, helpful review here on Amazon for Fake Bake. I'm grateful for that review, as it was very detailed and helpful to me, as it obviously was to countless others. I used the XenTan Blending Balm, and found it to be necessary for the areas where you don't want accumulation (such as knees and ankles)--it worked great.<br /><br />I did order the Baiden mitten recommended in that review also, but sent it back upon receiving it. When I saw the material of the Baiden mitten, I knew that the Korean Italy cloths that I had grown up with would do the trick every bit as well, but for a fraction of the cost (you can buy them in any Korean market, or buy one on eBay for $1.15 + free shipping, versus paying $50 for the Baiden mitten). Koreans have been using these cloths for years to exfoliate. My Korean mom used to call it \\"shining\\" her skin, and she swore it was the reason her skin was so soft. So I recommend following that first review to a tee, except replacing the Baiden mitten with a Korean Italy pocket cloth. You can find them here on Amazon, or for even cheaper on eBay.<br /><br />Some exfoliating tips, and tips for using the cloth:<br /><br />- When exfoliating, be sure to soak in a tub of hot water for at least 1/2 hr (until your fingers and toes are pruned) before exfoliating, or your skin might not slough off as much as you'd like. This is true whether you are using a Baiden mitt or a Korean Italy pocket.<br /><br />- Make sure that there are no bath salts, lotions, creams, or anything else but plain water that you soak in, or the dead skin will not peel off properly. Make the water as hot as you can tolerate comfortably.<br /><br />- The Korean Italy cloths can be found in a variety of different configurations, including a mitt, but the one I recommend also happens to be the cheapest and most ubiquitous, which is a pocket. To use it, you should fold a wet but wrung out wash cloth INTO the pocket, and then roll the cloth and hold it like a baseball or rock in the palm of your hand. Dragging the rolled cloth across your skin, scrub your skin in long strokes. Just like with the Baiden mitten, you should be able to roll strings of dead skin off of your skin surface as you do this.<br /><br />- The Korean Italy cloths are available in varying levels of coarseness, and the color of the cloth typically denotes the level of coarseness: Blue is the most coarse, green is medium, pink is mild coarseness. Occasionally you'll find a red one, which is medium coarseness, and if you find any other colors, the packaging should indicate how course it is. There are a few two-sided colors as well: Yellow comes with one side in mild coarseness, the other is medium. If you can find a plaid one, that comes with heavy coarseness on one side, and medium on the other. So if you buy a yellow and a plaid, you've got every grade of coarseness in two cloths, for about $2.30.<br /><br />- The cheapest Korean Italy cloths I've found were on eBay, for about just over $1, and that's where I ordered from, as it was cheapest. However, every one of my shipments from eBay (I ordered several different coarsenesses, from different vendors)took a couple of weeks to ship. As it turns out, they all came straight from Korea. If you are impatient to get them for the sake of getting started asap with your tan, consider ordering here on Amazon, where you can find quicker shipping times, including a few that qualify for Amazon Prime shipping.<br /><br />Hope this helps. Overall, the Fake Bake product is AWESOME. It gave me a beautiful, deep, rich tan that so far has lasted better than a week. I'm very pleased...RECOMMENDED!!!!
  907. Terrific product, easy to use. End result look very natural. Use after exfoliation in the evening. Shower in the morning and wash any residue down the drain. Will not transfer to clothing and lasts several days with natural tan look. Will use often especially since I do not suntan.

If you are prone to sweat at night, it might not be advisable to apply before bed, as the box directions suggest.   942. I have tried self tanners and been to get a professional spray tan done in salons but never found any that I truly loved until purchasing Fake Bake Flawless. I have light skin and therefore am a little nervous about putting something on that screams self tan. That is not the case with this product. It goes on easily, dries fast and doesn't have the bad odor associated with most self tans. I put this on at night before bed so it could process during sleeping hours as it does get a little of that smell after a few hours of wearing it but if you are asleep, who cares!? I woke up and showered leaving a completely natural looking tan. I only applied once and it has just gradually faded throughout the week. It has not streaked at all and has faded very naturally. I wasn't going to be wearing a bikini or anything so I only applied it to all places that would be exposed with a strapless one piece. In the buff, it looked just like I had been out on the beach in a once piece bathing suit and you can see a huge difference with just one application as my stomach was snow white and where I had applied the tanner was the most amazing, natural bronze tan. I will be using the product again this Friday and probably once a week throughout summer and into fall as it makes me feel much more comfortable in sleeveless tanks or shorts. I highly recommend Fake Bake Flawless. I got a bowl of sugar and took it to the shower prior to applying, mixing it with my soap and a wash cloth to exfoliate as you don't want anything that contains oils to exfoliate because it will block the tanner from absorbing. I put a tad of lotion on my elbows, knees and ankles/feet right before applying and I am completely happy. Not to mention, the price is FANTASTIC. The only thing I'd like is the option to purchase a few mitts at a time because it will wear out fast. Hint: to keep mitt from slipping around while applying just take a rubber band and put it on your wrist over the mitt and it will stay put while applying. ;)

  949. My love for fake bake products started with the original lotion. It by far had the best color I had ever used, but was somewhat difficult and time consuming to get right.   950. This was easy to use, and the initial smell isn't bad. The following day I noticed that familiar self Tanner smell. The glove gave me no problem with shedding and I washed it every so many uses. I will say this faded very quickly for me, and I had to reapply every other day. It's also not beach or water friendly, and tended to run and spot, which led to daily applications at one point. Perhaps that's not the case if you are avoiding salt water, but it didn't hold up well, in my experience. It's one if the better self tanners out there in terms of ease and color. But lacking in durability, fading substantially with each wash. If I were simply just hanging out on the beach, it's fantastic for giving that tan without the sun damage. With as much as you'll spend on other tanners, give it a try.

  994. I have been an avid tanning bed addict since I was young (about 14, and I'm now 21) but I recently was diagnosed with skin cancer and had to stop tanning in the UV light. I started looking for self tanners because I just can't handle being pale! It looks good on some, but not on me! I tried Million Dollar Tan because it was so hyped up on YouTube and I hated it and I also tried SunLabs because I also heard some good things but it wasn't my favorite. Next I tried Fake Bake Flawless and I love it. I get the best brown tan like I used to get when I tanned in the tanning bed but without the damage to my skin and fear of cancer recurrence. I do recommend moisturizing your skin with your daily lotion BEFORE applying Fake Bake Flawless, but that generally goes for any self tanning product. If you moisturize beforehand, the product just goes on so much more nicely and stops it from clinging to any areas. I would definitely repurchase this product, I've actually already got some more on the way!<br /><br />Pros:<br />1. Only takes me about 10 minutes to apply with the mitt. Super easy.<br />2. The color guard is not overwhelming, looks natural. You can tan and then go about your day. (although I like to tan before I go to bed).<br />3. The color begins developing after about 10 minutes on me and gets darker for the next few hours. I'm not sure how long you are supposed to wait to show because the packaging does not say but I usually wait several hours just in case.<br />4. The color lasts longer than any other product I've tried. I've seen several reviews saying the color doesn't last very long but it does for me. I also moisturize my skin very well though.<br />5. Fades sooooo nicely!! This is the only product I've used that does not cling to my dry areas (knees, elbows, ankles, and hands). I can actually put this on my hands without it looking fake.<br /><br />Cons: Can't think of any!
  995. Very good product it did everything nicely didn't have orange tint three girls at work tried it we were all pleasantly surprised
  996. streaks when i sweat at the gym (or wherever), but i sweat a lot. it's nice as a bronzer on the face if you're going out or something! nice color. only thing I'm cautious about are all the chemical ingredients.
