  1036. My first experience with a self tanner was a St. Tropez gradual tanning lotion that I didn't really care for. But I like the way I look with a tan, so I got online and did some research. Flawless got great reviews across the board and I even found a video of a girl showing how easy it was to use it (a real person, not someone who worked for FB).<br /><br />Went to Boots and grabbed a bottle. I love this this stuff. It's SO easy to do, dries in a flash and smells nice (like sun tan lotion). Don't be intimidated by the dark color when you first spray it on, you WON'T be that dark at all as it gets lighter as you rub it in. I would do mine in the afternoon or evening and take a shower the next morning (the longer you wait to wash it off, the better..at least 6-8 hrs). You will get a fair amount of color washing off, but you will still be tan. I used it for 3-4 days, until I got to the color I wanted, and then once or twice a week after that.<br /><br />I'm currently done w/my tanning for the year and have allowed this to wash off completely and there's no issues with looking stripy or patchy as it goes away.<br /><br />This is a great product for anyone, but especially for those new to self tanning, as I was. They give you everything you need in the box (gloves and mitt). The color guide in the product makes it beyond simple to make sure you've gotten everywhere. The best way to apply it, and to save on how much product you use, is to spray it directly onto the skin and blend it in with the mitt....otherwise the mitt tends to absorb it and you have to use more. One bottle lasted me about a month and a half, applying regularly as I said above.

It works well this way for me. It dries quickly and I haven't had any issues with it staining clothes after it has dried. I understand it uses a color guard which is part of the color upon application but it was a huge difference for me. I also experienced the bottle leaking like some other reviewers. Basically, you cannot use this during the day because if you wash your hands and water runs down your arm, you have horrible splotches. If the tanner comes in contact with any water, it leaves ghastly runs and streaks. Not good! I wanted to warn anyone who thinks they will put a coat of this on and head to the beach or pool. You will have a unsightly red residue that comes off. Unfortunately, I can't tan overnight because self tanners or even lotions make me too hot to sleep comfortably. So, I think I will continue to use on my legs and go ahead and switch back to Sun Systems for my face and the rest of my body.

I found that after 1 application for 3 consecutive days, I achieved a tan that I would only hope to get after a summer's worth of tanning. Only downside is that after you shave, the color can sit in the spot where the hair were cut (shows up like razor burn). To avoid this, take a shower at night, a few hours before bed, apply the product, then when you get up in the morning take another shower. Depending on at what point you are in the application process (day 2 of the first 3 applications) some color may come off, but after the 3 applications you won't notice anything coming off anymore. I would suggest keeping up with the applications every 4-6 days. But this is by far the best product I have every tried and I will never use another self tanner.

You spray the product on the brown suede side of the mitt and then rub it on your skin. It bronzes as you tan, but the tan you get will not be quite as dark as the bronze, which rinses off the next morning. I had almost no streaks or weird spots and it lasted quite well. My only complaint is the mitt slips around too much on my hands, but I have tiny hands. I'm really glad I found this. You can use it on your face too.
  1171. It's really not that much better than other self tanners I have tried. The color is nice and the smell is tolerable, but when it started to fade, it looked like dirt on my skin, especially around my feet and inner part of my arms. I can't say I love this product, but it's okay for the money.
  1172. I've doing this for awhile and I have a yellow hint to my skin naturally that everything turned me orange. This has more of a brown color that compliments my skin. I saw a lot of complaints that the mit leaves fuzies. Those aren't from the mit. It's your skin because your didn't exfoliate well enough. Also, When you first put it on (after shaving and exfoliating) wait about 4-6 hours and take a light shower. Rub soap on with just your hands. No scrubbing. The color will come out even and beautiful. When you first put it on you'll notice your pours are darker than normal. The shower takes care of that too.
  1173. best tanner ever, easy to apply, and looks great. It's so simple even a man can do it. Good Stuff.

  1177. This is an excellent product for creating a truly natural looking sunless tan. The color is deep and bronze vs. orange and there is no self-tanner smell. I would say there are two things to be aware of however - the liquid and the mitt require a little more effort in blending than a lotion self-tanner would. Also, the bronzer which allows you to see where you've applied does come off on clothing/sheets and in water, so I wouldn't apply this and go to the beach or pool without showering first or you'll see the brown streaks running down your legs when the bronzer rinses off. I followed the advice of other purchasers and cut the stem of the spray bottle, which has prevented it from leaking as others experienced. I would definitely recommend doing this as mine works perfectly now! Will definitely buy again.

  1206. So far this seems like a pretty good product. I have a slightly brown complexion and it makes my tan a little bit yellow, nothing unattractive, but not the true brown my skin would be if I went out in the sun. I'm able to get a wonderful tan naturally, but I'm trying to protect my skin these days, so this is a nice alternative. A couple things to note: when you are applying the product make sure to spray it evenly on the mitt, and apply in circles at a decent rate of speed to avoid streaks. The directions explain how to do it, so make sure to actually follow them. Another thing, my mitt started to pill up on the first use and little pieces come off at each use - hopefully this won't happen too much more. When you're spraying and applying do so over a non-porous surface because it will spray past the mitt and get on the surrounding area. If you wipe it up quickly you may avoid staining said surfaces. Overall I'm pretty satisfied with this product, but I don't know if it is much better than the Banana Boat Summer Color self tanning lotion that you can find for half the price at Walmart. Until the first time you shower, Fake Bake can transfer onto your light colored clothes or sheets. During your first shower you will notice some of the tanning spray wash off, but definitely not completely. In summary, it's better than spending too much time in the sun or tanning bed.

  1214. Why are so many fake tanners so ridiculously expensive? Fake Bake makes high quality, affordable tanning products that are just as good as the other high-end tanners on the market. I've been using this one for years and have always had great results. It doesn't stain your clothes or sheets, smells decent, and lasts for a few days. It's best if you exfoliate first but the product will still work well--and won't be streaky--no matter what. The glove isn't very good quality and gets dirty so fast, and you have to be gentle when washing the glove so it dosen't fall apart or get too matted. To tan my entire body it takes about ten minutes including set-time (make sure you let the product dry a bit before putting on your clothes). As with any tanner, wash your hands and fingers. The product's dark brown color makes it easy to see whre you're applying it, and you can see results almost immediately. I even put it on my face without any breakout issues. You can also layer it, one application right after another one, to achieve quicker and darker results. The Flawless shade works best with fair-light medium skin tones. I prefer to put it on before bed so I wake up with a natural, bronze glow. One bottle will last you a couple months with consistent use.

  1221. I have been a loyal Fake Baker for two years now, which means I've used probably 20 bottles of this magic stuff. It really is the most reliable self-tanner out there, so if you're new or or nervous or just looking for a great deal, you have my recommendation.<br /><br />I love that this stuff is easy to put on (using the mitt - I just spritz about 5 times directly onto the mitt for each arm, e.g.) It's also the only self-tanner I've used that errs on the brown rather than orange side, and that's a plus. Final accolade: it smells phenom, like I would buy a lotion that smells like this just to be wistfully transported to Tahiti (never been, but seems like it would smell like coconuts and Coppertone).<br /><br />Like any good pessimist, however, I've found a couple of flaws, and offer them here as a buyer beware.<br />- Staining: this stuff rubs off on clothing / sheets like none other. I think all self-tanners do to a certain extent, but this will straight turn your sheets Thousand Island-colored after one restless night. It seems to wash out (although over time, the stain residue builds up), but embarrassing nonetheless.<br />- Build-up: admittedly I am not the best exfoliator, but if you don't scrub this off completely before reapplying, you run the risk of serious build-up / brown flakiness (I tend to get it most in my inner elbows and neck).<br />- Bad for faces: this is one of less-good self-tanners for your face, possibly because the mitt applicator doesn't rub in as deeply as your hands might, so you can look a little speckled. I use Tanwise for my face now (anyone have a better recommendation?)<br />- Mitt dependency: you 100% need the mitt for this. I've tried hands, a washcloth, and a sponge as backups, and they were all hilarious jokes. The reason this is an issue is that even with careful oversight and the occasional machine wash, your mitt will eventually get pilled and rough and will therefore make your application uneven. I wish the mitt lasted as longas the bottle did, because I do not wish to spend even more money on a backup applicator method.

  1255. I'm a first time fake tanner with fair to light skin. The process was easy to follow. It does turn areas like hands, knuckles, feet, elbows, etc. a little bit orange-y, so keep that in mind when applying. When I wake up after a night of letting this develop I am easily...five shades darker. After a shower I'm knocked back to three shades darker rather than five. I actually prefer that though, because too much of a tan on me looks a little weird. The color that develops before shower is a little brown, but washes off into a golden undertone tan.

In fact, I actually much prefer the type of tan I get from this product over the occasional spray tans I get at a local spa/salon. Apply it consecutive days to deepen color, moisturize between applications and be sure to exfoliate well prior to applying to ensure a smooth, long-lasting tan. Any dry patches of skin (ex: knees, elbows, feet, etc.) will tend to absorb excess product and effect the smoothness of the tan.

  1303. This self tanner - seriously. It's awesome. I have always had SUCH a hard time with self tanners. It gives off a color similar to Loreal's original Sublime Glow, which was a different formula than the one they use now. Just perfectly warm and olive, very natural looking. The smell is not too bad. Other than the shade, the main reason this tanner works so well is the mitt - definitely use the mitt! It goes on very smooth and left no streaks for me. As always, make sure you are careful with hands, knees, elbows, and feet, but the mitt definitely helps this issue. It tends to work best if you rinse the mitt after each time. Also, the color guide helps a lot for you to know where you have already placed the color, but please note that the color of the color guide is NOT the color of your actual tan. This rinses off in the shower (make sure you wait a few hours) and leaves a nice glow. The color is beautiful,very natural and this stuff is so easy to apply. I would recommend this to everyone that wants a self tanner that actually does what it says.

  1341. I have been using this product for about two years. I believe it is, hands down, the best product on the market for a tan from a bottle. It is a little tricky though. You have to be committed to do it right. If you don't follow the directions exactly, you will have a hot mess! Do not put it on before going outside to sweat. Also do not wear it under light or white clothes. I usually put it on in the afternoon when I get home from work and wear it until bedtime. I then jump in the shower and lightly wash it off. The color stays on, but there is no run off. COMBINE THIS PRODUCT WITH XEN TAN BLENDING BALM! Use the balm for elbows, knees, ankles, and around the edges of your feet where sunless tanning products tend to change color. It gives you a very dark but natural looking tan.

  1345. I luv, luv this stuff!! Just bought my second bottle and I can't rave enough about this product, especially for the price! I read the reviews before I purchased this and the best tip was to snip the spray tube that goes into the bottle. That way there is no dripping. I am fair skinned and Fake Bake gives me a nice golden color, with no streaks as long as you apply it correctly. You can clearly see where the product is going when you rub it on so just make sure to get even coverage and you'll get a nice tan, usually after 2 applications. Always exfoliate before using so you don't get any dark splotches and moisturize after showering off the color-guard. Love the tropical smell. Will definitely continue to buy this so I can look sun-kissed all year long!!

  1354. First of all, this product smells amazingly tropical. Over time the scent fades and it doesn't leave an unpleasant self-tanner smell. The product is fairly easy to apply. Since the tanning liquid is dark, it is easy to see where you have applied it. The color pay-off of this product is not the best, though it says you can reapply multiple times to deepen the color. I was maybe 1-2 shades darker after one application. The tan begins to fade after the first shower, but I only noticed the fading after about 5 days from patches of color on my inner arm. These patches were subtle enough that I don't think anyone would have noticed. Overall, I did like this product - especially for the price. I really enjoy the smell, which is not something you can say about many self-tanners. I do wish the initial application lasted a bit longer, but it was easy enough to apply and I don't mind doing a couple of applications to get a good base tan. From there, they say you only have to apply it once a week to maintain the color. http://alexisraye.weebly.com/beauty/first-impressions-fake-bake-flawless-self-tanner

  1357. I tan well, but I have very fair skin, blue eyes, and I am older, over 50 yrs. I can control how dark I get as well, by reapplying product. It dries fairly quickly, and if it is dry, it doesn't stain clothing. I have gone to have a pedicure after applying product 12 hrs earlier, and even with the jet tub, soaking and exfoliating scrub, the tan stayed. The smell isn't noticeable, it is nice. This product works as well as the spray tans, honestly, and it looks like natural tan.<br />I love the product, and I definitely recommend it.<br />It can go bad once it has been opened however, the product should be used up within 6 mos or refrigerated to keep longer. I found the spray bottle can also open up and leak in airplanes, it has happened about 3 times. I always double bag my liquid items, so not too much mess, but it was a shame to lose the product.<br />Try it out, great product.
  1358. Best self-tanner ever. There's a ton to stay, but everyone else has already said it. My favorite things about this product: 1) This dries incredibly fast. I let it dry for about 5 minutes, but probably don't even need to. I haven't noticed it rubbing off on anything as if it's still wet on my skin. My skin absorbs it as I apply it, but it still applies smoothly and distributes evenly. 2) The mitt makes applying this soo fast and easy, especially once you've already done it before. I did both of my entire legs in about 5 minutes, TOPS. 3) No streaks. I have used the Banana Boat Deep Dark self-tanning lotion, which gives a nice tan, but I always had to wipe the excess off my toes, ankles, and heels, and no matter what time I applied it, I found that it would wear off unevenly while I slept through the night just from being in contact with the sheets and tossing and turning throughout the night, it would also collect in one area on my shin, which looked really patchy and orange. With this stuff, I put it on my knees and feet sparingly, but there are no streaks at all, and it dries so quickly, it blows my mind. It looks very natural as well.<br /><br />I am so impressed with this product. And it doesn't have that fake tan smell. It smells more like a coconut/tropical scented lotion, and I don't find it to be overwhelming at all. Makes me think of the beach when I open the package. :)<br /><br />Wish I had bought this a long time ago. If you're on the fence with this, just buy it. You'll be very happy you did. It's likely the least time-consuming product you can buy, and it comes with everything you need. People ask all these questions, which is understandable, but I'm here to tell you that it's basically idiot-proof, and extremely easy. Apply at night, shower in the morning. Don't rub or wash it off, just rinse underneath the water. You don't need to wash all of your skin anyway, only the areas that actually need it. Any excess will come off, and I've found that I don'tnotice any color rinsing off when I shower, but the color improves after a shower, though I would definitely not hesitate to go anywhere after applying it (before showering), as it still looks pretty natural in my opinion.
  1359. I'm light skinned and I have more complaints than praises when it comes to this product.<br />Pros- I doesn't look too fake. Only 1 person straight up looked me in the eye's and said &#34;Fake Bake?&#34;<br /><br />Cons- The product washes right off. I can put enough spray on to make myself look pretty tan, and even keep it on for 12 hours before taking a shower. After a non exfoliating shower I can't tell there is any left on me. So to maintain a consistent look you must put this on every single day, and if your not naturally tan at all, it's a lot.<br /><br />CON- I have a very good sense of smell and every product like this has a smell to it. Having to put this product on every day and having to smell it on you all the time is not worth it to me; it's a &#34;deal breaker&#34;. The first time I smelled it, it didn't seem that strong, in fact it smelled pleasant. After 3 days of smelling nothing but that on my skin just made things worse. Right before I stopped using the product it was like smelling gas fumes. I know it's really not that strong but over time your nose doesn't want anything to do with it, and on top of that you can't shower because it washes completely off.<br /><br />How this product would be better? If it actually stayed on your skin after a shower. This would cut down on applications from once a day to maybe twice per week.<br /><br />I actually gave my 1/4 full bottle to somebody who was interested in trying it, they didn't even use a quarter of it before they stopped using it.

  1401. Easy to apply and really lovely results. I go between this and St. Tropez dark mousse...both give natural looking results. Always get compliments when I take the time to self tan!
  1402. I don't want to tan anymore, worried about the effects. I bought this product after reading many great reviews and it did not disappoint. I do not have a lot of experience with self tanners, but I still know what looks good and what doesn't. With the help of the mitt this product goes on evenly and easily. I never have a problem with steaks, just be careful with your hands and wrists. I also don't put it on my face. I did a couple times and each time it just made my face look dirty. The color settled in my pores and didn't look even. So I just rely in my makeup to match my body, and that works great. I marked off one star for the mitt. As far as the mitt goes, it's not a very good mitt. It starts to fall apart leaving little pieces all over your body when u rub it in. And seems to not work as well over time. It's not a big deal, just takes a little bit longer to apply with the mitt trying to fall apart. I think id like to try a different mitt, but haven't. The whole process is very quick, maybe takes me 15 minutes, including shower. Do this at night before you go to bed. Shower, shave, exfoliate. Dry off completely. I will use a blowdryer on my body to make sure I'm thoroughly dry. I put a little lotion on knees, elbows, ankles, wrists. Apply gloves (not included). Mitt in one hand, then spray on mitt and rub systematically all over your body. I lastly lightly rub mitt on the top only of my hands without any extra spray. I wait for it to dry, then hop in bed naked. You can wear light loose cloths if wanted. Next morning shower it off, then lotion. The color is great. And the part I love most is it doesn't stain my sheets or clothes. I have even not showered the morning after and it never stained my cloths, even with sweating. I reapply every so many days, or nightly for a darker tan. But one application is dark enough. I usually only use this every few months when I care about how white I am. Which is very white! I live in a very cold place year round, so my beingwhite is only a concern when I travel out of where I live. But I have used this product often. The point of this is, I still an on my first bottle. It is getting hard to spray out of and I will need to get another one soon. But this has lasted a long time. Great product, great price, maybe get a different mitt.

Other than that you can get dressed almost immediately after application.<br />Finally, they have a similar product for the face, but it doesn't work as well. I would stick to this, but it requires a little more upkeep if you wash your face twice a day like me. I use an exfoliating face wash, then apply toner, then Fake Bake. Wait at least ten minutes before applying moisturizer or make up so that you don't smudge the product. I have to do this every day, but if you wash your face less, you can probably get away with less frequent applications.

I know it says not to put anything on prior, but i did put on baby lotion and let it dry before doing the tanner. Everything turned out fine. I love the price of this product and i will defintely buy it again. i highly recommend it. First product i have found that is orange and streak FREE.

  1490. First, let me say this is absolutely the best tanning product I've ever used. Next, let me (not that you asked) advise you to not over-do it. DHA, the tanning agent in products like this is in and of itself NOT HARMFUL really if your not bringing it into your lungs. So the general advice is keep it away from the eyes and don't inhale it. Which is why the mitt is so great.<br /><br />Having said that, the second ingredient, Dimethyl Isosorbide, is an extremely great ingredient used in the cosmetics industry because it breaks down surface fat molecules and &#34;hitches a ride&#34; into the living layers of the skin, carrying with it whatever molecule the manufacturer has bound to it.<br /><br />In this case, that would be the DHA. Following so far? DHA has been found to be deposited in the lung and other tissue thanks to this great vehicle. This is why Fake Bakke gives an amazing tan, it goes pretty deep!<br /><br />This is in fact NOT a negative review. I use the product, I love the product. I'm just adding a little sanity to the love festival to say it's great to use once in a while, and be careful around the eyes, don't spray it etc... Health First. Liver problems, cancer... it's all in the research on these chemicals. Educate yourself, being brown isn't worth your life.
  1491. I have tried A LOT of self tanners and this one is by far the best. The best thing about fake bake flawless is that it dries very, very fast. It also does not leave a nasty smell after it dries and has a very light coconut smell going on. In the end you never look orange, ever. It's really amazing and I love it. I get about 7-8 uses out of the bottle and use it about every 4-5 days and I stay pretty dark. It's actually cheaper then the tanning bed in the end and no wrinkles or risk of skin cancer!

  1493. So I was in the market for a good self-tanner, and I decided to buy this one based on all the great reviews. I have fair skin, and red hair, so I don't tan very well in the sun and the tanning bed gets expensive and is not healthy. I was very excited to get this self-tanner and try it. I ordered it from Amazon, which was the cheapest I could find, and I like how my items always ship very quick, I have it like two days later. So I took a shower that night, and exfoliated very well, like you are supposed to and I applied it after I got out of the shower. When I opened the bottle, I could smell the scent, which is tropical/coconut, like the description says. So I applied it and was instantly amazed at the results. No orange, it was a deep rich brown color on me, it was perfect....but there are some problems I have with it. First of all, once this stuff settles on you, the tropical smell leaves and you smell like...chemicals. If you ever got a spray tan (I've had a few), you should know what DHA smells like, and it stinks, and that's the after smell of this stuff. Second of all, my \\"tan\\" came off in the shower the next morning. That's when I learned that the deep rich brown color, is the color guard, pretty much an instant bronzer that guides you in applying the stuff evenly on your body. I did apply the stuff all over my body, including my face, yes, for the most part, it does go on very nice and even. I did notice like two small spots on my face that were darker than the rest of my face, but my skin could be really dry in that area and I can cover it with makeup so that was not a big deal to me. Also, if you use this stuff on your hands/feet, do so very sparingly.<br /><br />So overall, the bottle says to reapply for darker results, which I plan on doing the next couple nights to see if I notice a significant difference or not. If I do, that's great, if I don't, then I will save this stuff for special occasions. As of right now, I believe the stuff isreally great if you have something special that you want to look nice and tan for (wedding, date, party, etc). It does dry very quickly, and I have not had a problem with it coming off on my clothes. Despite many other reviews saying to shower at night, apply, let settle/go to sleep, and shower again in the morning...instead you could shower in the morning, apply this stuff, and you would have a deep rich tan that lasts all day. But if you are looking for something more long-term, I would look somewhere else.

  1504. I have used a lot of self tanners over the past 3 years. I don't want to tan anymore but I want some color in the summer months. This is the best I have tried and I have tried a lot.<br />It goes on very well. Even in those hard to color areas like knees, ankles, elbows and feet. I put this on at night before bed.   1505. Not terrible but not on my short list of favorites either. I prefer Neutrogena micro-mist because it doesn't have a messy guide color. Pros: * Color came out fairly evenly. * Dries very fast and not sticky. * Good medium darkness after one application. * Mitt is interesting and can be helpful to apply evenly. * Gloves are essential, I like that they included a pair. Neutrals: * If you like having a guide color this is a good one as it doesn't transfer too much. I hate guide colors however. * While applying, the fragrance is nice but after about an hour it wears off and smells bad on the skin just like all other self-tanners, even after showering. They all have the same darkening agent I believe so they're all going to smell bad on the skin even after showering until the color has faded away. It's a musty scent that smells a bit worse than sweat (but not B.O.). I'd recommend using a warm perfume like coconut, magnolia, or vanilla to help cover it. Cons: * Can't spray directly to the body (as it will color your floors) so applying takes longer because it must be rubbed in. Neutrogena Micro-mist can easily be sprayed to the middle of my back without rubbing or staining floors. * As I said earlier, I hate guide colors. If you get a splash of water it'll run onto your clothes or furniture. When you spray it from the bottle it will make a mess even if you're spraying directly to the mitt. Also, it sticks to dry or damaged skin, including the hair follicles where I shaved before applying - this made me look like I had a 5 o'clock shadow on my legs and bikini area until I rinse the guide off. * I'm olive toned and this color came out slightly too orange for my liking. If you're pinker toned, I think this will look even more orange. * Self-tanners usually dry my skin but also help clear my face, this one gave me some clogged pores/breakouts - I don't recommend on the face. Recommendations: * Shower your body (not hair, don't want water dripping) using exfoliating showergloves and scrub your dry parts hard. Shave your legs, etc. * Turn on your AC or make sure the room is cool enough that you don't sweat - I don't recommend pointing a fan directly at yourself or it may dry too quickly. Stand on a DRY floor or towel as tanner may mix with water on the floor and stain your soles. * Use a heavy moisturizer (Nivea cream, CeraVe cream, or Cetaphil Cream) on your bum and lady bits (trust me, don't skip your bum crack), knees, entire foot/ankle, elbows, wrists, hands, and face (especially eyes, lips, and upper lip). * Put gloves on both hands then put on mitt. * Spray directly on mitt IN THE SINK so you don't get it on your floors. * Start with legs: at your feet then work your way up each leg (I sprayed the mitt about 20x per calf and 60x per thigh+bum cheek). * Continue to back: if you can't reach well, spray the mitt and remove from your hand. With your right hand hold at the corner and reach over your back then with your left hand reach under your back and grab the other corner then drag it back and forth behind you to wipe the color in. Or, if you have a one of those back washing brushes, you can try slipping the mitt over it. * Continue to chest and belly. * Continue to arms: when you do your back and chest it'll get on your arms so do arms last so that you can even them out. Avoid wrists. * Continue to face: Take off the mitt, spray 1 or 2x directly to gloved palms, rub hands together and apply to face and ears. It's ok to apply to lips and eyelids just make sure they are heavily moisturized. * Take off your gloves and rinse your hands and wrists (in case any tanner leaked in). * Apply heavy moisturizer to your hands and wrists. * Gently pat the mitt on the back of hands and wrists then rub back of hands together. * Put some heavy moisturizer or petroleum jelly on a cotton pad and wipe on edges of feet, between toes and fingers, and wrists (to blend color where it will usually get over saturated). * Avoid showering for six hours andrinse the mitt. PRO TIP: wear full coverage cotton panties and give your self a wedgie immediately after applying the tanner and for a couple hours so that the color won't run even from minor sweating and concentrate on your bum crack edges. You don't want a football shaped outline on your cheeks when you bend over :) Same for large breasts, use a cotton bra that fits all the way in under the breast to absorb any sweating. Exhibit A: Incorrect tan lines: (__(*)__) Correct: (__*__) Exhibit Breast: Incorrect tan lines: (( o )( o )) Correct: ( o )( o )
  1506. First time I bought this i loved it, but then i purchased again and it seems like a totally different product.
  1507. Meh. Not really impressed. I don't get what all the hype is about. Nice color if it would only last more than a day. It stinks a little less than other brands but still stinks. I don't think there's a way around the smell.
  1508. LOVE this stuff. I am a super novice self tanner and I get so many complements on my tan. I am outside kind of a lot and so I have a good base tan but this stuff evens out my skin tone and helps blend tan lines...it's so great. It goes on super quick, dries fast and is not sticky at all. Contrary to what other reviewers have said this stuff totally DOES have the self tanner smell after a couple hours but it's not as bad as some brands. I have not experienced any permanent staining of fabrics in fact I wipe up the sink and bathroom countertops with a white towel afterwards and toss it in the wash....comes out no problem. I will say that if you are going to be sweating heavily the next day after using this product you will want to shower...with soap...to get all the color guard off otherwise you will sweat the tanner off onto you clothing...not cute..trust me. I followed the advice of one reviewer and got the Xen Tan Blending Balm and after I swipe on this tanner I rub the blending balm around the edges of my feet, my knees, my elbows, my inner elbows, the webs of my hands,my knuckles and the edges of my hands and wrists. Because of this I have not noted any weird hyper dark discolorations. I took off one star because I just wish the color lasted longer....it lasts about 2-3 days and is pretty faded by the 3rd day.
  1509. LOVE this stuff! I usually do 2 thin layers, and it covers evenly and perfectly! Gives my skin just enough color so I'm not pale, but doesn't make me look dark/fake either. Smells nice too. I would notice some color come off in the bottom of the shower, even the next day, so I avoided using it in high humidity or if there was a chance I would get wet or be out in the rain....I didn't want to end up with streaks.

  1515. I bought the small 6-ounce size of Fake Bake to test it out. Having used other topical tanning agents I can say the best use of this product is for the BODY. These are the reasons I indicate the body as the best use of this product. I am fair skinned and have not noticed any orange tones. For the face, chest and arms I recommend 'Norvell Prime Bronze 4-FACES'. It leaves a very nice tone on the face and chest. Fake Bake left streaks on my chest so as I've said above - use a bronzer specifically for the face.
  1516. so i am as fair skinned as it gets, first try gave me a believable golden tan. no streaking, not alot of mess, no smell. put this stuff on waited 5 minutes to dry and threw on pj's. washed off color guide in the morning. looks great! i will be using this all summer i think!
  1517. Pretty great tan! I have fair skin and it is so difficult for me to get a tan. I tried the tanning beds but it would take me 10 sessions just to get a slight color. This gives you a very natural tan and it keeps me out of those tanning beds. You can build up your tan to how dark you want to be. It is not sticky at all and the smell is amazing. I would use it in the morning and walk out of the house and people loved the smell. It dries in a few seconds and doesn't stain anything. I used this tanner 5 times in a row to get a darker tan and I didn't look orange at all.<br /><br />Another amazing thing about this is that it made a difference in my skin. I'm not sure if anyone else experienced this but it made my skin so soft. I sprayed my face with this and it didn't cause any irritation or breakouts.   1518. This is probably one of the better tanners I've ran into. It doesn't leave me orange and they provide a mitt which is great and helps prevent a streaking effect that can happen without a mitt or sponge. The amount of product is descent as well. I got between 8-10 full body uses. The only thing I didn't really like about this product was how light it was. For a comparison, I changed my makeup 2 shades darker than I would usually wear (I'm fair skinned). I was hopping for something slightly more drastic. It also appears that you might be able to layer this product on after the previous layer has dried but I didn't personally try this all over, I just happened to notice on a few spots that happened to overlap. I definitely like the brand though and will be repurchasing the product, just in the darker version.
  1519. This is the best sunless tanner I have found, and I have tried dozens. The instant color it gives is natural enough to go out in during the day, and the color that stays after you shower is really natural as well. This also has the most pleasant smell. Yes, it still has an odor, but it is more tropical than the tell tale sunless tanner smell most give off. Also, my skin is so fair it is pretty much see through, and it makes me look like I have spent time in the sun. I really like the mitt that comes with it as well. Highly recommend.
  1520. Love this tanner. It really provides a flawless tan and smells good too. This is my second purchase.
  1521. I really love this product already, I have been using it for a little over a week now, almost everyday, my problem with it is that the color doesn't seem to stay very long. I have to apply it every day or every other day for my skin to keep the tan. It is great for an instant tan and it doesn't have that gross fake tan smell. All in all, I will keep using it, until I can get some real sun.
  1522. Finally! An at-home product that does not smell, lasts well, and doesn't look orange, dirty, smudgy, streaky, etc. No self-tanning nightmares, and it costs less than half a spray tan! (Half a spray tan would be ridiculous, anyhow). I have told my sister and tons of friends to buy this already.<br /><br />I have tanned my whole body four times, and the bottle is still fairly full (1/2?).<br /><br />My ONLY problem, was that the mitt got hard/streaky after a few uses (looked like I was applying a faux Mahogany wood finish onto my thighs!!!). However, I washed it in warm water and used a teasing brush to fluff it back up (eyelash or bristle brush would have the same effect). Works perfectly again!

  1525. I'm amazed at how well this works!! I'm pale-skinned, Caucasian & burn like crazy. I had previously been using Banana Boat Summer Color Self-Tanning Lotion/Deep Dark Color & it was OK but the smell on my skin after awhile was terrible & it would turn orangey-yellowy-brown on my skin but it still looked semi-normal & gave my pasty white skin a little bit of color, so I kept using it. THIS product is amazing--it doesn't smell bad even after a couple of hours or the next morning when I wake up, it doesn't get on my sheets at night, it turns my skin an immediate actual believable golden tan color & then after I shower the next day the color is lighter but still present. I've used it 3 nights so far & it's building color gradually & totally believably. I love the buffing mitt idea, I don't need to use the rubber gloves that come with it & I may be spraying too lightly each time onto the mitt but it works really well for me & goes on sheer & the more I buff, the more it goes on evenly & beautifully. It is hard for me to buff the middle of my back, but that's just me & my arms & my anatomy. This is the most realistic, easiest to use, best-smelling fake tanning lotion I've ever experienced. This is absolutely going to be a staple in my medicine cabinet!

  1540. When reviewing a self-tan product, I believe it's extremely important to introduce certain characteristics of the author in order for readers to determine whether the product should apply to them. Before I begin, I am 21 years old and extremely fair. As a child, I was decidedly ginger/strawberry blonde, so my skin WILL NOT tan - not then, not now. I've tried a lot of sunless tanners throughout my middle school/high school/collegiate struggle to be tan (or at least a normal, non-ghost shade). This ranges from L'Oreals Sublime Bronze lotions/sprays, to Model Co. products, to Xen Tan, and lots of other brands.<br /><br />As of now, this Fake Bake Flawless is my favorite self-tan product I've ever used. I'd argue that, when used properly, this is the best sunless tanner. The color guard in combination with the mitt makes sure I get every single square inch of my body, no streaks. It dried in minutes, and I was able to dress quickly. The liquid develops into a wonderful brown (not orange!) color, and it was even and believable. HOWEVER... it must be used properly :)<br /><br />There are a few reviews on here that have complaints about this product that I'm going to address here (mostly noting why they're silly complaints). The first major complaint is \\"bottle leakage\\" - the spray bottle that comes with the product is too long for the bottle. The natural solution I came up with was cutting down the straw to make it short enough to fit in the bottle and prevent leaks. CUT THE STRAW before you use and your Fake Bake won't leak! The second major complaint is about the application mitt. Some people say it leaves fuzzy stuff on them, some people say it should have velour on both sides, and some people think it won't last until the tanning product runs out. All of these are wrong. If you've shaved and don't press too hard, your mitt should NOT be leaving fuzzes on you. You're supposed to lightly buff the product on. If the mitt had velour on both sides, there would be risk for rubbing extra tanning solution in random places, most notably on your body where it can leave a streak. One of my biggest tips in using this product is WASH the mitt of all leftover tanning solution after each use. This will keep it in MUCH better shape.<br /><br />To get the brown, amazing results that most reviewers gush about for this product... it's not hard. Here are some steps to follow.<br />Step 1: Shave and exfoliate with a Baiden mitten or a similar Turkish bath mitt. If you don't know what it is, promptly go purchase it and use it and be amazed. UPDATE 4/28/2014: Dry brushing thoroughly prior to entering the shower is also adequate exfoliation.<br />Step 2: Take some scissors and snip off a bit more than an inch of the spray bottle attachment that came with the product, and put the modified attachment onto the bottle. This WILL prevent all leaking.<br />Step 3: Rub body cream (I use Bliss Lemon & Sage body butter, the BEST cream EVER) into your elbows, knees, ankles, and knuckles. Let it dry.<br />Step 4: Apply sunless solution as per the directions, using the gloves and the mitt, spraying on the mitt and then LIGHTLY buffing the color all over (it's probably best to put a tiny dab of body lotion on your knees and elbows and ankles).<br />Step 5: This is my personal step that really helps me as an extremely pale person get a beautiful, even, brown tan. Everyone hates the tell-tale splotching on hands/feet that give away the fact that you're wearing a store bought tan. I highly recommend that every pale someone purchase a product called Xen Tan Blending Balm. Once you're done applying the tanner all over, including hands and feet, take your blending balm and go over your elbows, ankles, knuckles, sides of feet/hands, and wrists. I usually don't need Blending Balm on my knees when I use body butter. This will prevent the tan from developing into too-dark territory. UPDATE 7/25/2014: Xen Tan Blending Balm is almost impossible to find these days, but its first ingredient is petrolatum. Use some Vaseline instead if you can't find the Blending Balm. I also recommend using Smith's rosebud salve or any Badger balm.<br /><br />OVERALL... The Fake Bake Flawless system is fantastic. It's well-priced and delivers beautiful results (even for gingers), and beats the inconvenience associated with going to the spray tan place. When the correct measures are taken, it looks great for a long time. If you're looking for a deep, dark tropical tan, you'll need to apply it a few nights in a row. My advice is BUY THIS NOW. And then order some Xen Tan Blending Balm and a Baiden mitten (both very important!) OR as per update 7/25/2014 you can also use a dry brush pre-shower instead of a bath mitt and Vaseline/Smith's rosebud salve/Badger balm instead of blending balm.<br /><br />UPDATE: September 27, 2012<br />After finishing a whole bottle of Fake Bake, I'm happy to report that the velour mitten is still in tact. I'm adding this edit to emphasize how important it is to wash your mitten between uses. Washing the mitten also prevents leftover solution from becoming reactivated and leaving darker splotches in random places during application. Seriously yall, WASH YOUR MITTEN.<br /><br />UPDATE: December 13, 2013<br />Something I never mentioned in this review which I should have... The color guard is GREAT. It's gorgeous and brown. But... It will streak when it rains, and wash off in the shower, and rub off on your sheets. Which, to me, is whatever. It's fine. But it's just good to know and plan around! For instance... I opted to use Jergens the night before Carolina Cup a couple years back because I knew it would be rainy and I didn't want everyone and their momma noting how streaky my tan seemed to get in the drizzle. Anyways, just wanted to give this little update. Happy tanning :)<br /><br />UPDATE: April 28, 2014<br />Years later, I'm still obsessed with this tanning product :) However, like many people in the comments note, the product doesn't last as long as other sunless tanners without maintenence. Personally, I've found that this is a wonderful option when you need a light tan the day before a big event, such as a wedding or a horse race or a tailgate, and you don't have much time to devote to getting it perfect and you don't want to smell like you've been tanning. Fake Bake Flawless is also an ideal option for people who have never applied their own sunless tanner before, as it is basically idiot-proof.<br /><br />UPDATE: July 25, 2014<br />A whole 3 years later, after 2 Fake Bake Flawless kits, I still have both velour mitts. I always use them when I tan. I don't always use the Flawless system anymore, as it doesn't develop dark enough to my liking. My top two tanning products are Tanwise mousse via Sally Beauty and St. Moriz self tanning spray in dark, which you can find at Ulta. Both always applied with gloves and mitt, after exfoliation, with the Xen Tan blending balm. Keep in mind that these are MY favorites, but I've been self tanning for more than a decade. If you've never had success with a self tan product, buy the Fake Bake Flawless.<br /><br />Because of so many comments about how this product doesn't last, I'm going to recommend another option that I really love. For those of you who want a longer lasting tan, with a more difficult application, I recommend Tanwise Lotion or Mousse. The lotion stays on FOREVER. Tanwise is not a product for the faint of heart - it goes on VERY dark and stains your skin in streaks unless you blend QUICKLY. The other issue with the Tanwise is the bronzers WILL stain your hands, and the only way to get it off is with baking soda. I went to Charleston recently and applied this the morning of a very long day of bar crawling, and my arms were still tan at work a whole week later. You can find Tanwise products here on Amazon or at a Sally Beauty supply near you - but remember, they are NOT easy to apply correctly. The Fake Bake Flawless is still my absolute favorite product for a quick, easy, pretty, coconut-scented tan. I like to apply the Tanwise mousse with the gloves and mitt from my Fake Bake kit and it always works perfectly.doesn't last as long as other sunless tanners without maintenence. Personally, I've found that this is a wonderful option when you need a light tan the day before a big event, such as a wedding or a horse race or a tailgate, and you don't have much time to devote to getting it perfect and you don't want to smell like you've been tanning. Fake Bake Flawless is also an ideal option for people who have never applied their own sunless tanner before, as it is basically idiot-proof.<br /><br />UPDATE: July 25, 2014<br />A whole 3 years later, after 2 Fake Bake Flawless kits, I still have both velour mitts. I always use them when I tan. I don't always use the Flawless system anymore, as it doesn't develop dark enough to my liking. My top two tanning products are Tanwise mousse via Sally Beauty and St. Moriz self tanning spray in dark, which you can find at Ulta. Both always applied with gloves and mitt, after exfoliation, with the Xen Tan blending balm. Keep in mind that these are MY favorites, but I've been self tanning for more than a decade. If you've never had success with a self tan product, buy the Fake Bake Flawless.<br /><br />Because of so many comments about how this product doesn't last, I'm going to recommend another option that I really love. For those of you who want a longer lasting tan, with a more difficult application, I recommend Tanwise Lotion or Mousse. The lotion stays on FOREVER. Tanwise is not a product for the faint of heart - it goes on VERY dark and stains your skin in streaks unless you blend QUICKLY. The other issue with the Tanwise is the bronzers WILL stain your hands, and the only way to get it off is with baking soda. I went to Charleston recently and applied this the morning of a very long day of bar crawling, and my arms were still tan at work a whole week later. You can find Tanwise products here on Amazon or at a Sally Beauty supply near you - but remember, they are NOT easy to apply correctly. The Fake Bake Flawless is still my absolute favorite product for a quick, easy, pretty, coconut-scented tan. I like to apply the Tanwise mousse with the gloves and mitt from my Fake Bake kit and it always works perfectly.
  1541. After using banana boat self tanner all last year and not knowing that there was a self tanner out there for less then 30 bucks that wouldnt turn you that fake orangey color i continued to use it all throughout the year even though i knew how gross it looked but i have a weird issue with being tan so i just couldnt stop because i didnt want to look pale. The girl made it look sooooo easy and the color she turned was a gorgeous tan!! ANd not only that it also is way cheaper. I am already quite tan and turn very very tan in the summer, so i got this for the winter times when im not as tan as usual. So we'll see how it works on paler skin because with banana boat i had boughten it last summer and it looked great over an already tan body but on pale skin it turns orangey especially in natural lighting so i really hope fake bake doesnt do that. The girl that demonstrated it on youtube was quite pale and she turned a gorgeous tan so im not too worried about it. Also a lot of people said that you need to shower the morning after applying because of the color guard, well i dont shower after and it works great and doesnt rub off so i dont think its necessary to shower after, all showering does is wipe away the tan. I only use this product on my face and neck right now because i dont want to wear foundation and i want my face as tan as my body without having to color in my whole face and neck with makeup and look all cakey. it works really well and looks like my natural tan and if you use the mit thoroughly it wont streak!

  1546. UPDATE: I have gotten my Mom to get this, who is even more pale than I am and she LOVES it and swears by it. She gets a very natural color as well.<br />***<br />Let me just start off by saying that I am Polish, Finnish, and Irish. We are a pale, stout people meant to live in cold, dark places. Thusly, no matter what I do I cannot get a tan; I burn, or turn a sort of odd orangish color. It's really quite terrible. I digress.<br /><br />I decided to test drive this product this summer, before I go to Hawaii in the winter, to give myself time to find a good fake tan. I have found it!!!!<br /><br />I started by using it on my legs only, just in case it went badly. I followed directions and exfoliated quite well, shaved etc. I just used a rough washcloth and rubbed the heck out of my legs, knees and feet until I was smooth and clean. After making sure my skin was completely dry, I rubbed a small dab on Vitamin E Oil on my knee area and rubbed it in well, just to make sure they weren't too dry. Then, I applied the product. I followed the directions of going lightly over knees and ankles, making sure they were extended so it wasn't wrinkley, etc. The rest of it is pretty much self explanatory. The mitt worked well for me and was a nice touch. Also, I'm pretty sure this bottle will last me a LONG time. At least a few months of solid use, but perhaps even more!<br /><br />Pros:<br />1. It smells nice in the bottle. Sort of floral/tropical.<br />2. It has NO fake tan smell on your skin. I was expecting it and was ok with it if I tanned well, but I am both tan and NOT SMELLY!<br />3. The color guide really does help you see where it went, and also looks passable as a tan until your tan develops.<br />4. It dries quickly after you apply it so you don't have to stand around nekkid forever.<br />5. My tan looks nice. I went to bed, woke up and rinsed off my legs in the shower and that was it. So easy!<br /><br />Cons:<br />1. The spray part of my bottle was a little drippy so Ihad to keep wiping up little drips from my floor.<br /><br />Really, that was it!<br /><br />So anyways, I wholeheartedly recommend this product.   1547. This is the best self tanner I've ever used. I've tried pretty much anything out there. This stuff applies easily, does not over power me with \\"fake tan\\" smell and dries almost instantly. The price is great too. Try it!
  1548. This is, hands down, one of the best (if not THE best) sunless tanners I have ever tried. The only thing that could possibly come close on the believability scale is Christian Dior. I will admit though that I was intimidated by some of the other reviews & the product information concerning the prep & how dark it might be. I wanted believable color but not to go from fair to Snooki in one day. I almost returned it before I tried it. So glad I didn't! Yes there's a bit more prep than you would have with the average drugstore product but nothing over the top. I was pleased to see this go on so sheer & light while quickly drying. Most unbelievably of all? Absolutely no telltale tanner smell. You know the one. Usually even if you don't smell it that night, you will by morning. This had none of that. There also wasn't that drastic of a difference between the guide & what your final color is. The next morning, I was believably bronzed with nary a hint of chemical odor to give me away. The only small downside to this particular product would be reaching your back by yourself. Still not enough to deter me from being a fan. This is one of those products that I will add to my long term routine for sure.
  1549. It arrived quickly and I tried it right away. I have used the original Fake Bake lotion and was satisfied with the results, just not the gawd awful smell. This stuff is divine! It doesn't stink & takes half the time to apply as any other self tanning product. I saw results after the first use, but used continuously for about 4 days and then every couple days I would reapply. As long as you exfoliate once a week and reapply to get the desired skin tone, you will never have any problems with streaks or splotches. It lasted me about a month of use and took about a week to 10 days to completely fade after I ran out. I cannot wait to purchase more and I will never purchase any other product ever again!

  1551. I stopped tanning a couple of years ago for the sake of my future skin. But, I could no longer take being so very pale. After reading many positive reviews on Amazon and watching many positive reviews on YouTube, I decided to give Fake Bake Flawless a try.<br /><br />It's absolutely amazing. No streaking, no spotting, and no orange color. It blends wonderfully, it wears well, and the color builds with daily applications. Also, six ounces didn't seem like it would last long. But, I have barely made a dent in that six ounces. Love that!!<br /><br />My pale skin now has that beachy, beautiful, golden brown color that I absolutely love.<br /><br />I was at the grocery and a woman I know asked me if I had been on vacation because of my tan. That says a lot about the product. She was so surprised the tan was from a self-tanner. The gloves and the mitt really make a difference in the application.<br /><br />Fake Bake Flawless is fantastic!!
  1552. I am extremely fair, to the point where even the lightest shade of foundation in most makeup is too dark for me. I tried Fake Bake after trying numerous self tanners for years! They never did their job as good as this product. I highly recommend it. It drys in seconds. I use a thin layer of oil on my skin before I spay on the tanner, which helps me from any splotches which would be very visible on me. I love this product. It's a super fast application and for once I feel it looks totally naturally and I actually have a real tan. My husband says it's perfect and he's seen me go through MANY self tanners!
  1553. I love this product. I've used other tanning products and none has been as easy to use as this one. The included plastic gloves and soft mitt makes application a breeze. I usually use this in the tub or shower and spray the mitt 8-10 times per application. It takes 2-3 applications per body part (ie: right leg, left leg, chest, etc.)<br /><br />I have read other reviews complaining that the color washes off. I've never had this issue, but I apply it as recommended in the instructions - after exfoliation and before bed. I can apply color to my entire body in 5-10 minutes. I wait a minute for it to dry before dressing for bed. I've never had my clothing or my sheets discolor.<br /><br />My only complaint is I dislike the coconut scent. Why is it all suntan lotion manufacturers think we want to smell like a coconut? Unscented would be just fine with me. So other than the scent, this is a great product that I will buy again.

  1567. I've used tons of self tanning products over the years, and this one is my favorite. I'm one of the unlucky few with body chemistry that exacerbates the scent of every single self tanner I've tried EXCEPT for this one. With other products, the smell was so strong that it lingered even after showering- not in a powerful way but it was enough to make me reluctant to use it if I were going out and about anytime in the next 12 hours. With Fake Bake, I can apply it before going out and never notice the smell. As an added bonus, it goes on dark, so you can actually see where it has been applied AND it gives you an instant tan, which I find preferable to products that are initially clear.<br /><br />I've developed a quick, simple application method for those of you who are interested. After showering/exfoliating, but before drying off, I spray a little Avon skin so soft oil on my skin and rub it in like you would with moisturizer. Then I dry off with a towel, and apply Fake Bake with the handy dandy included mitten. The skin so soft helps with even application and absorption. It's especially great for my feet and knees. I suspect this method reduces the amount of product absorbed into my skin, which in turn shortens the life of my fake tan, but it makes application so fast and easy that I don't mind having to do it more often.<br /><br />Another helpful hint: always wash the mitten thoroughly after each use, with soap, until you've rinsed out all of the fake bake. The mitten will last longer, and this is an easy way to also wash the product off your hands.

PLUS, this literally drys right away, and you can put your clothes on as soon as you are done.(if it does get on clothes or towels it will easily come off in the wash so dont panic, I actually always get it on my towels because I stand on one while applying this and it always comes out in the wash) The smell if the best I have ever experienced. Smells more like a lotion used for getting in the tanner bed, rather then those smelly gradual tanners like Jergens e[...] Be careful if you do this in the morning fresh out of the shower, because wearing the color guard all day can get messed up when doing things like dishes, hanging wet laundry, or if you end up getting rained on lol. Other then that if you can avoid getting it wet then there is no reason not to wear the color guard all day. HOWEVER, if you do not like wearing a self tanner with a dark color guard you can definately apply this after a good exfoliating shower at night, and then rinse if off in the morning for a fresh tanned glow.   1611. I was hooked on the very expensive Guerlain Terracotta Self Tan Spray that you could only get out of the U.S. Why it wasn't available in the US, I don't know.<br />All I know is now I never have to order this type of product from out of the US ever again - as long as the formula of this specific Fake Bake remains the same.<br />I thought the Guerlain product gave me a natural healthy look without looking overdone, but they have nothing on Fake Bake at one half the price.<br />It's extremely easy to apply. The muddy colored guide rubs in, making sure you apply completely. Don't freak about the color. It's a good thing it's the color it is, because you want to rub it in and get rid of it!<br />Be sure and use the mitt and gloves included. There are those that say the mitt uses up too much of the product. I didn't find that. I found spraying the mitt then applying gave me beautiful complete smooth coverage.<br />Don't wash the gloves or the mitt. Just put the mitt upright to dry. I put mine on the top of a lotion bottle. When you use the mitt again, you'll find what product remained on the mitt reactivates!<br />I am fair skinned and have light colored hair. This product left me a beautiful \\"tan\\" that only looks on the browner side (NO orange or other funky color) as though I've had a great time out in the sun over the weekend.<br />If you're lookin' for a \\"Jershey Shore\\" type of color, I believe you could achieve it with this product but it would take about 5 or 6 days to get that - awful - color.<br /><br />THE VERY BEST PART I liked about this product is the smell. I didn't smell like I was cooking from the inside like the other self tanners smell to me. Fake Bake has a VERY light coconut smell - don't worry, it's not a heavy Bath and Body Works coconut smell. The smell goes away in no time. Put it on before bed, wake up to a very beautiful golden, not a freakish<br />dark, St Tropez tan.<br />I will ALWAYS buy this product as long as the formula remains the same.<br /><br />FOR THE RECORD.   1643. I've used this for 4 years now. Never have had a streak my tan always looks natural and everyone wonders how I keep up my flawless color. I only do one single application because I'm so naturally pale I tend to look sick. This product gives me a healthy glow. Obviously you can keep applying layers until you're as dark as you want to be.<br /><br />In response to basically every negative review: ANY self tanner will sweat off after application, FakeBake is just smart enough to inform you that you should apply it at night so that doesn't happen to you. For anyone afraid to buy this product due to a negative review, please don't be. I have used it and then went swimming the next day and the worst that happened was the color faded from my body, and I reapplied it that night. It lasts a long time and I can honestly say it has never EVER EVER turned me orange. In fact, they don't even use yellows and oranges in this product. They use reds and browns. So unless you apply 3 or 4 applications on top of each other which I'm assuming this reviewer may have done, it will NOT turn you orange. It wouldn't be the best selling tanning product on Amazon if it did. BUY BUY BUY!<br /><br /> Awesome especially in winter. I wear it in the summer too. Water resistant but obviously not waterproof, stays on through sweat and at the pool. Would I apply this product and then go to the water park or amusement park? NO! Sweat causes any self tanner to dissipate. Be smart with what will cause sweat WITH FRICTION. Friction? That's okay. Sweat? You're tan won't run. Sweat WITH friction? Just DON'T!! If you're drying off from anything, pat your akin don't rub. I went to the ocean with this stuff on and nothing came off all day in the heat and sand. When applying it I usually spray it on my skin THEN rub. Unless I am doing my face then I spray the mitt and rub. You cAn use this product over and over until you are as dark as you want to be. Shave FIRST 24 hours in advance of application. Because if you shave and them immediately apply the product, it will seep into your pores leaving you tiny dark specs. Also let your body COMPLETELY DRY hair and all before you apply. It's even smart to blow dry your body with COOL AIR before application even if you haven't just gotten out of the shower. I wait hours after my shower just to be sure. If you don't you will regret it because your tan will NOT be even; mark my words. If you wait until you're dry though everything will be perfect.<br /><br />Don't wear white until you've rinsed off after 24 hours of having it on ! Rinsing off won't get rid of your tan unless you scrub and even then it probably won't come off. If you leave it on for 48 hours you can scrub and your tan will not be affected which is why I love this product. Definitely worth the buy. Be careful around your arms if you're like me and tend to have tanner arms on the top of your forearm and paler skin on the bottom part of your arm/the inside crease of your elbow. I have my roommate do my back and the back of my shoulders and legs just to make sure it's perfect :)<br /><br />Make sure you apply it more generously to paler areas (the bottom of my forearms are super pale so I do them twice). If you're reading these reviews to try to find out if you should buy it-buy it. Totally worth it. Like I said, it wouldn't be the best selling tanning product on Amazon if it wasn't awesome.
  1644. I purchased this item for my granddaughter and The product was nothing like it was advertised. It was a cheap immitation of a liquid/spray tanning solution. Don't waste you time and money on this garbage.
  1645. Like it a lot but fond that sun labs tanner actually works better and lasts longer and is only a few dollars more.
  1646. This product is great! The box is very pretty to me I don't know why. The color is a good natural one. It smells ok but after awhile it can become annoying and starts to smell like normal fake tans do.<br /><br /> A Few Tips:<br />-When it arrives be sure your skin is scrubbed clean and their isn't any dry flakes.<br />-Use the included spraying tip! But be sure to just snip about a inch off it so it will fit in the bottle smoothly<br />-After every use of the buffing pad clean it off and hang it to dry in the shower.<br />-Don't apply this if you have not bathed recently.<br />-Take it slow with your face, don't continuously re-spray your face after it has been sprayed before. (and by spray I mean spraying the buffing pad and applying it to the skin) Respraying your arms and legs is fine however.<br />-Try to apply it at night and sleep with it. This is better so you aren't active during the six hour curing period.<br />-Using this twice in a day is fine but don't use to much, a little goes a long way.<br />-If the tan looks uneven then use a light lotion to go over the troubled area.<br />-If you can try to get a light sun tan. This will dramatically help deepen your overall color. Even if you just get red it will really make a difference.<br /><br />This whole thing of spraying a fake tanner on a pad and rubbing it on your skin seemed so far fetched to me. But the soft pad and light misty tan spray made the operation quite smooth and very easy. Its so much better then self tanning lotion!! Make no mistake this is a great product if you want a great tan!

Other than that, product is amazing!!

  1663. I am a very fair skinned girl. I was looking for something that didn't look orange and wasn't greasy. This is the perfect solution. The bottle is a spray that goes onto a mitt. The little glove helps you apply evenly all over your body.<br />On my first application, I missed a few places on my legs, so it did look a little splotchy. But after about one use, you get it down! It does create naturally beautiful color and tan.<br />The smell is a light tropical scent, which is actually a welcome change from most of the tan in a bottle solutions. This is a light smell that is easily masked if you want to tan in the morning instead of night. The box suggest applying at night and washing off residue in the shower. When I did so, I didn't notice any color washing off.<br />I am thrilled at the purchase and happy with the results. I will continue using this while I build up a summer base tan.
  1664. The good:<br /><br />Using the mitt really makes this an easy and quick self tanner to use. I think it takes me about ten minutes to apply this to my entire body.<br /><br />The color looks very real. You can even use this in the morning, before work or school, although most would recommend applying at night. I like to use it in the morning because the color guard gives you an awesome, dark tan right away and it really does dry quickly enough so that you can get dressed in about ten minutes.<br /><br />It doesn't smell! Not when you put it on, and not even after you've had it on for hours.<br /><br />You can use it on your face, just make sure you use one spray on the mitt and rub it in, don't forget your ears and hairline!<br /><br />I think the price is not bad at all for this product!<br /><br />The bad:<br /><br />If you are very pale, it may take up to four or five uses to get the color you desire, but this is ok for me, because I apply it in the morning until I get the color I want. Until you shower, the color guard will give you a real, dark looking tan.<br /><br />You may very well need to use this self tanner daily. I do, or at least every other day, but I'm as pale as it gets.<br /><br />I'm not sure how long a bottle would last using it daily, but I will update this to let you all know.<br /><br />I've used Other self tanners that had much longer lasting color and that have also given me my desirable color after one use, but those tend to be the orangey ones. Yet I still stick to this self tanner because I've never made embarrassing mistakes with it, it's such a better color, it's sooo much easier to apply. I feel HOT with the color it gives me :)<br /><br />Tips:<br />Exfoliate skin before using! Self tanners concentrate more in dry areas with dead skin. You can use a scrub, or an exfoliating glove.<br /><br />Moisturizer often, but never before or within four hours after applying fake bake. You want to keep your skin moisturized for this same reason!<br/><br />If you don't have anybody to do your back for you, purchase a back brush and slip the glove onto it. I've found this makes it simple to get your back .<br /><br />You can spray the tanner directly onto most parts of your body, but for parts such as your face, hands, feet, elbows, knees, neck and back, you will want to spray the tanner onto your mitt.<br /><br />Always rub in circular motions.<br /><br />Wash your mitt after every two uses. You can do this in the washing machine with cold water on a delicate cycle and hang to dry.<br /><br />Do not apply too much pressure when rubbing it in the the mitt. This might leave fuzzier on you! A delicate touch with do the job!<br /><br />Before using, you will want to cut about an inch off of the spray tube. You will notice that its much too long for the bottle. It comes separately.<br /><br />Use sparingly on your face.<br /><br />You can spray a lot on your body, or a little. I am still experimenting with that: maybe I would get a longer lasting tan if I sprayed a lot onto my skin versus the amount I use now, which isn't much.

  1708. some tips for this product:<br />1: If you are allergic to latex gloves, buy the senstive kind. You'll want good gloves.<br />2: Test a small area ( some skin is senstive to the ingredients in this bottle)<br />3: Exfoliate!! yes, Exfoliate and moisturize before applying. I did it three hours before applying the spray. It did wonders for the eveness.Exfoliate twice a week<br />4: The VELVET side ( NOT the foam side!!!) is what you use to Polish the skin. And yes, rinse the mitt after use to keep it clean and in shape. I used a ponytail holder to keep the Mitt on my hand from sliding.<br />5: For Lighter skin, it may take two applications before a set tan is achieved. Do not be dettered, its like most things...it takes a few applications to get to the level you would like for it to sustain. I Had to do two Base applications before I was satisfied.<br />6: Moisturizers are your best friend!<br />7: For face application I suggest using a small talfa pad, Spray a wee bit on the pad and blot on face, followed by a circular motion to even it out. (Yes you should exfoliate your facial skin before use too!!)<br />8: For your hands ....Scrub scrub scrub your knuckle areas or else it gets blotchy. Mine were raw red for two hours and then when I applied the spray (using a talfa pad) it didnt look like bright orange marbles ! Which was my mistake the very first time I applied it.<br />9: Coconut moisturizers around the knee and joint areas alleviates the blotchiness too. I did this two minutes before applying and it worked!! Also toned down the areas that absorbed dry patch areas by using the moisturizer, it made things even.<br />10: Overall I find this product to be worth every cent! (As others said) It gets Messy, Try to find a spray nozzle that is less spritzy and more guided. One that mists perhaps. I used one from my old hairpump bottles, its got a better stream.<br />11: This product will no doubt last me one-two months! That is better then spa's that charge way more for a single fake tan application.
  1709. this product is great in terms of it does not streak or become blotchy. It gives a awesome golden tan, did not irritate my skin (which can be sensitive) and has a great smell to it. Also after applying this and you let it dry for a few seconds you can put on your clothes with out worrying about it getting on your clothing. It is very messy in terms of when spraying it on your body alot of product lands up on the floor. So either spray onto mit or stand in shower to spray yourself down. Only downside it it will wash off in a few days...I think it took 2 washes and it was gone. But use it for a nite out or to go to an event ...its perfect for just that.
  1710. Love this product! Works perfectly and shipping is really fast!
  1711. this is by far the best tanning spray you will ever use aloge with xen tan blending balm looks like a natural tan without the damage of the sun
  1712. Normally I don't write reviews for products but I felt it was necessary for Fake Bake. As a naturally fair person I've always been trying to find the perfect product to give me a good/natural looking tan (including tanning beds). Most of the tanners i've used either didn't leave enough color, turned out orange, had that terribly unattractive smell, or came out splotchy/streaky. I saw the review for this product on youtube and after seeing the ratings here I decided to purchase it, and im SO GLAD I did!<br /><br />Pros:<br />-Instant NATURAL looking color (not even a tint of orange) that just gets better as the hours go on, and it's build-able depending on how dark you wanna go (I find two days in a row of application is a medium-dark tan)<br />-Smells amazing for a self tanner, very similar to coconut tanning oil (My boyfriend actually LIKES how I smell after using it)<br />-Doesn't rub off on clothing or sheets, dries extremely quickly and goes on smoothly<br />-The mitt gets rid of any possibility of streaking or splotches as long as you blend, and you don't have to worry about washing your hands afterwards<br /><br />Cons:<br />-Fades a little quicker than I'd like, I'd say you couldn't go for more than a few days/a week without re-applying<br />-Excess spray can make a slight mess in your bathroom (but it takes 5 seconds to wipe away with a wipe or papertowel)<br />-A decent amount of product comes off if you apply at night in shower in the morning like recommended, I prefer to apply in the morning/afternoon<br /><br />Tips:<br />Make sure not to get any water or lotion on yourself after applying for at least 4 hours, but right after I put it on my hands I find putting a tiny bit of lotion of my knuckles smooths out any lines and makes it look perfect! Also make sure to moisturize on days you arent using fake bake, it really makes a difference.<br /><br />Overall I'd give this product 4.5 stars, only reason I didn't give it a 5 is because of the fade factor! Fake Bake gave me a tan in three days that would of taken me one/two weeks using the tanning bed, Definitely recommend!

  1724. I've tried quite a few self tanners and this is by far the best. I was torn between this product and SunLabs, but this one was cheaper. I'm so glad I went with this one! I tan really easy in the summer but I wanted a quick fix to last me until I can physically go outside and lay out, and this was perfect. I bought some exfoliating body scrub from Ulta and used that in the shower, then towel dried off and put a little cocoa butter lotion all over my body (I have super dry skin). I put extra lotion on elbows, knees, and wrists because the instructions suggest putting lotion on these spots no matter what. I wiped off any excess lotion and used the spray. it dried so quickly! I would suggest only doing one arm at a time and doing your legs in two sections (top and bottom) because the product dries so quickly. Also, spray the product directly on your skin because if you spray on the mitt, it absorbs most of the product. the only time i sprayed on the mitt instead of my skin directly is when I used it on my face, the backs of my hands, and my feet. This is by-far the best tanning product that I've ever used, even my boyfriend approves, and he HATES self tanners because im generally smelly and orange. This product smells great and gives instant bronzers so you can literally apply it and then walk out the door. it doesnt stain your clothes or bed sheets either. I slept in the same bed as my boyfriend about an hour after applying, and we were both afraid that some of the product would rub off onto him throughout the night, but it didnt! it dries quickly and is perfect. Definitely worth buying! And buy from this seller! Item was delivered a day before expected, which is always a nice surprise (:
