  1770. I am about as experienced with sunless tanners as a consumer could be. I've been using them for years and I know all the techniques -- and this one threw me for a loop. The color is nice, the smell is nice, but Fake Bake &#34;Flawless,&#34; it seems, is inherently flawed:<br />A) If you have even a hint of any sort of other product on your skin -- lotion, makeup, deodorant, deodorant that wasn't scoured off with a freakin' loofah -- then it will turn that area green and it will stain the pad and turn anything else it touches green, too. And for those of you who are accustomed to applying lotion to your rough spots (knees, elbows, feet, etc.) prior to applying tanner...DON'T. It will turn those spots green too.<br />B) You are supposed to apply it at night. Why? Because it turns you the color of a sunburned Oompa Loompa.<br />C) Another reason you are supposed to apply it at night: Because if you sweat, the &#34;color guide&#34; will run and you will end up with a patch of white, untanned skin wherever you sweat or wherever skin touches skin. And herein lies the rub – no pun intended: for anyone who's body is not perfectly made for this product (i.e. if you have anything but A-cup boobs and tiny thighs), you will likely sweat -- even just a tad -- at night while you sleep and you will likely have skin-on-skin contacts in different spots. You will therefore awake with white patches between and under your boobs, between your thighs and around your bikini line. I weigh 107 lbs so I'm thinking you must have to be anorexic or something for this stuff to work and even then you must have to sleep splayed out, on your back all night so as to keep your legs from touching each other, etc.<br />......Upon using this a few times and assuming I was doing it wrong, I called the company and had the misfortune I've been speaking to an irreverent, unapologetic little snot who verified that sweat, lotion, and skin-on-skin contact would, indeed, cause this product not to work and sheoffered no tips, tricks, or hints that might help me, otherwise.

  1773. Fake Bake Flawless leaks ... ALOT. After 3-4 pumps, the liquid leaked large, brown splotches everywhere - it's a good thing I was spraying the mitt over the sink. It continued to leak every time I pumped, and made a gawd-awful mess. I snipped the end off the pump tube, as another reviewer recommended, so that's not the issue. It seems to be leaking right out of the nozzle itself - the little hole the product comes out of. When I finished applying, I rinsed the bottle off under the faucet, to get rid of the product that was smeared all over it. I then noticed a place on the back of my leg I wanted to touch up, so I pumped onto the mitt and pale brown, highly diluted product came out of the nozzle. Wherever the leak is coming from, it's large enough for water to flow *into* it as well.<br /><br />Beyond this, all I can say is it's \\"okay.\\" As far as I'm concerned, it requires a heck of a lot of work for the color your skin turns. \\"The juice is not worth the squeeze.\\" Will not purchase again. - there are many products out there which achieve the same result with less effort - and no mess.
  1774. I love this stuff! I have no problems using the mitt with it. I'm a stay @ home mom, in my early 30's with kids. This is fantastic to use for an event, night out, wedding, etc. I don't use it all the time. But its really nice to use when I need it. I have another Fake Bake product that is in a gold can. Its a finer mist type. I think it does give you more of a brown color than this does. This for me is more brown/bronze color. But not umpa lumpa orange.I don't have the time or money to spray tan at salons. Although I have done that, id say this is about 75% comparable. I wouldn't probably do this for my own wedding, but just to go out...its great! I use it a lot in spring & fall..for in between colors. I'm Caucasian, I get ghostly in winter, but tan well in summer. I put this on after a shower around 5-6pm. I wear loose clothing afterwards, I do notice some rub off but it washes out. And I will notice it on the sheets, but no stains. I use this on say a wed night, again, thurs night, for a Friday or Saturday event. I do need about 2 rounds of it. But that's more than plenty dark for me. If you do professionally spray tan this would be nice to use to extend the tan a little longer, sort of like maintaining it. I shower before using, and I use a Cure Series Japanese Bath towel (blue) to exfoliate prior. Works great!

  1823. Great tan and is easily applied. I have used other products in the past and love this one. I did not turn orange or streak.
  1824. Let's face it, we all feel better and look better with a little color to our skin! I think I've tried every sunless tanner on the shelves through the years. I'm a firm believer in skin protection while still having a nice sunkissed glow so I'm not one to use tanning beds or go out into the sun without sunscreen on. I also have a few tattoos that I care to keep looking nice, especially because I've invested so much money into them.<br /><br />I've bought everything from cheap lotion to expensive gels and even used aerosol spray tanners and gotten Mystic Tans. I was looking for an alternative to the sticky feeling of a lotion/gel and something that *hopefully* wouldn't have that stinky sunless tanner smell that instantly screams &#34;I USE SUNLESS TANNER&#34; to everyone standing within a &#34;sniffing&#34; distance from you. I read numerous reviews for different products and decided that Fake Bake Flawless was worth trying. I read reviews that said the bottle leaked when using the spray pump and it was suggested to cut the pump tube down a little bit so it fits into the bottle. I did this as soon as I received the product and the bottle didn't leak at all during my first application last night.<br /><br />After exfoliating in the shower really well (use a shower gel that has beads or granules in it to help remove dead skin) and shaving, I got out of the shower and dried off. I then put a light coat of lotion on my knees, ankles, tops and sides of both feet, wrists (inner and outer), elbows (inner and outer) and around my armpits. I've had problems in the past with sunless tanner streaking or looking muddy in those areas. After the lotion soaked in I put on the latex gloves that come with the kit, then put on the microfiber mit. The directions say to spray the mitt with the sunless tanner and then apply but I found that the mit absorbs a lot of it before it reaches your skin, so it's easiest to spray it directly onto your skin instead and then rub it in from there.<br/><br />BE SURE TO LAY A TOWEL DOWN WHERE YOU WILL BE DOING THE SUNLESS TANNING. No matter how close to your skin you get with the bottle, some mist will get onto the floor or rug and if you don't wipe it up quick enough, it might leave a slight stain. I did this in my bathroom and just put an old bath towel down on the floor. I started with my legs and sprayed a few sprays up and down the front, back, and sides of my legs. With the microfiber mit I worked the liquid into my skin by using a circular motion and sparingly spreading it down over to the tops and sides of my feet. I used a patting/dabbing technique to apply a small amount of liquid to my hands and feet and it seemed to work great. I then did my torso, rear end, back, chest, and then finished with my shoulders/shoulder blades, neck (blending it up to under my chin), and arms (front and back). I chose not to use it on my face since I have a lotion-based sunless tanner designed specifically for faces that I use. The mit is very soft and easy to use, but beware--I had some fuzzies come off and get onto my skin. I think this is just because it's the first time I used it. As a side note: make sure to wash your mit out with warm water and soap after you use it. I threw mine in the dryer on high heat for about 10 minutes and it came out clean and fuzz-free.<br /><br />The liquid rubs on smoothly and due to its chocolate color, you can tell exactly where you've already applied it. It has a great coconut smell and dries quickly so you're not standing around waiting for it to soak in and feeling sticky. I put my pajamas on shortly after applying Fake Bake and my skin felt soft and had instant color. I went to bed and slept comfortably throughout the night and in the morning there were no stains on my sheets. My skin looks fabulous and I have a Bahamas-esque tan that isn't orange or fake looking in the least! No streaking, blotching, or uneven areas to be found. The best part? NO SUNLESS TANNER SMELL! It never oncesmelled like the typical sunless tanners (I liken it to rotten fruit), instead the pleasant coconut smell went away throughout the night and I was left with a great tan and no smell whatsoever.<br /><br />I highly recommend this product. It's easy to use (only took me about 8 minutes total to apply) and the results are like nothing I've ever gotten before from other sunless tanners. If you're hesitant about trying a non-lotion tanner like I was, this is well worth the chance. I couldn't be happier and plan on using it much more in the future, especially as the weather gets warmer :)
  1825. i have used ever tanning thing on the market, and this is the absolute best. my second favorite it the neutrogena micromist in 'dark', but it just isnt quite dark enough for me. fake bake goes on easily and smells good, and it doesn't streak easily. it's easy to see where you apply it because the colorguard is super dark.   1852. I have used Jergens tanning cream for two summers now and I had always thought it was pretty decent, even though it was the first tanning cream I used I always stuck with it. So I would constantly be buying tubes and tubes that were 8-10 each. So finally I decided to try this product just for fun, and I'm glad that I did. I was so worried about having streaks or looking orange. But I put it on once and woke up and my skin was already a few shades darker. It evened out my blotchy paleness and made my skin in general look so much better. By night two of it I was already at my desired tanness. It took two days to achieve what Jergens took about 4. Also I had no streaking or any fake looking areas around my elbows and knees. This product lasts a week without applying more before I start to see it fading in certain areas by my inner arm. It looks really patchy and bad if you let it get to that point. So it's best to keep applying so it doesn't get patchy. Lastly the smell of this product is AMAZING!!   1854. After trying several self-tanners, this is by far, the most tolerable. The application is easy, it dries really fast & it doesn't have the hideous smell afterwards. In fact, it makes for a very nice deep tan (no orange) if you are willing to devote the time. I find myself correcting areas constantly with this tanner, which makes me use more of the product; meaning it will run out soon which is also displeasing. If you want to save time and money I suggest a JWOWW spray tanner, I used it before this product. Just a shower, continuous spray, and dry. Voila nice tan. Or you could buy this and rub in bloches for an hour trying to get an even tone.

I'm glad I purchased this product and gave it a chance because the color is very nice, but it just didn't sit well on top of my skin. I followed the directions (exfoliated and whatnot) and started to apply.<br /><br />This was my first time ever using any sort of tanning (I've never gone to tanning place to get a natural or a fake tan nor have I ever used an at home tanner).<br /><br />Anyways, right away you can see the color change. I was expecting to look a bit orange, but not even a single hint of orange appeared. It went on simply and quickly (taking me about ten minutes to apply it feet to head). It dried really fast and instantly looks great. I am a bigger girl so I embarrassingly have, for lack of a better word, crevices, where I had a bit of trouble applying, but ultimately was able to deal with.<br /><br />The big con to the product for me was the mitt. Perhaps it was just mine, but it left brown fuzzes on my body occasional. It was no big deal because taking some toilet paper and gently wiping my skin seemed to get them off without affecting the color. Still, it was pretty annoying.<br /><br />Anyways, for me (as I am super pale) the first application gave me a very nice sunkissed look. But, I think I want a bit darker (especially on my legs which were naturally lighter than my arms so they still appear lighter), so I intend to follow the directions and apply it two nights in a row to see if I can get the color just how I like it.<br /><br />Another plus is it smells great. I am not usually a fan of the coconut smell, but this is so soft and subtle that it is actually quite nice.<br /><br />I probably would have given it a five out of five if it had not been for my mitt.<br /><br />Great product and I highly recommend it for first time tanners like myself since it was so easy. I also suggest having someone there to do your back because right now I have a big gap of space where I could not reach. Luckily no one ever sees that area anyways, but for people who wear backless shirts or bikinis or other clothing that shows the back it would be something that they would worry about.<br /><br />So summary;<br /><br />PROS: Quick, simple, nice smell, looks good, no orange<br /><br />CONS: Faulty mitt, hard to apply on backsomething that they would worry about.<br /><br />So summary;<br /><br />PROS: Quick, simple, nice smell, looks good, no orange<br /><br />CONS: Faulty mitt, hard to apply on back

  1931. I love fake bake. I have not found a better self tanner out there and have been using it intermittently since 2013. Other reviewers on Amazon have given great recommendations on how to use this product and I recommend you read those too. This product has never been streaky. I am very pale and I like that with one application there is a difference but it is not so dramatic that people notice right away or that it is obvious I self tanned. I love the smell of this product and so does my boyfriend. It does not smell like a self tanner, instead it is very tropical smelling. Be sure to wash your mitt in the washer every once in a while, and I try to rinse my mitt after every application. Fyi, I had an old bottle of this that I tried to use this month, and I noticed the liquid was spraying on the mitt green. While most of you might find this appalling, I was really happy about this. The bottle was about two years old, and the fact that it went bad means it has natural ingredients. Fake bake flawless is free of parabens! I'd rather have a skin product that expires on me than one that is everlasting due to parabens. I can't rave about this product enough. I was so tired of spending money trying to find a good self tanner. Thanks to fake bake I don't have to worry about that anymore.
  1932. Fake Bake Flawless is AWESOME if you want a good tan and don't want to use a tanning bed. You MUST be careful with the application, too much will make you orange. Perfect for a natural glow, just don't layer it on too much at one time. Do as the instructions recommend and apply another layer each day if you are not satisfied with the color. It DOES darken over time! So if you don't think it's dark enough at night, it will be in the morning. Also, be careful when you put it on your hands, they will be orange. I find that exfoliating with a loofa (while showering), then applying and wait for it to dry, then moisturizing is the best process for even color and locking it it. Works awesome on face and neck too. Overall, great product, just be sure to watch a youtube video before you apply the first time, there's a lot of good ones out there!

In my early years I worshipped the tanning bed just so I could look normal in the summer months (its been joked that Im so white I glow in the dark!).   1941. This self-tanner produces more of a bronze color vs the orange color I usually develop with other products. It took me about 2-3 applications to get a fairly dark tan. The color-guiding bronzer does not wash off in the shower if you do a light rinse/wash. From my experience, the color develops in about 4-5 hours and gets a shade or so deeper than the initial color-guiding bronzer. Doesn't smell too awful, but it does have a hint of the normal self-tanner odor. Feels light on the skin, dries quickly and you're not left with that sticky feeling for hours. Goes on evenly, although I have a hard time getting an even coat around my neck/collarbone area. This could be due to me being lazy and not washing the mitt (could be the residual bronzer from other applications). This product is good enough for me to recommend to my sister, since we both understand the damaging effects of the sun, but desire a believable looking tan.

I tend to apply two coats every time. It builds very well.<br /><br />If I remember to use it often, I can build up a pretty nice tan.<br /><br />Also, the mitt is fantastic. It's kind of sweet when you put it on. After it sits for a while, it gets a touch of the fake tan smell, but it's not nearly as bad as some of the others that I've used.<br /><br />It dries very quickly.   1977. I gave this product four stars, because it is better than most self-tanners. It doesn't have the bad smell that most self-tanners have and it provides a natural, non-streaky color after you shower the next day to wash off the tint. With that being said, there are a few things I don't like about the product. It has a built-in tint, so that you can see where it goes as you are applying it. The tint gives you instant color. However, it settles into your pores, highlighting them. You really need to apply this at night and wash off the tint the next morning to reveal the natural color that is underneath it. I used two days worth of coats and I wished the color could have been darker, but it was fairly natural and not streaky, so I am happy with that.

Here are a couple additions recommendations to her instructions:<br /><br />For the body exfoliation, I just used my exfoliating mitts, You can find them on Amazon or at the drugstore and should not cost more than $3.<br /><br />Buy extra plastic gloves to wear under the mitt. There are only two sets in the box.<br /><br />Do moisturize. The fake bake oil spray did not arrive in time, so I just used the new Suave spray. I suspect it does not matter as long as you apply evenly all over, and very well on knees, feet and elbows.<br /><br />Don't rub too hard. That is how some users get the bit of fluff from the mitt on their skin. Even if you do, if you do it at night, just rinse off in the morn. In fact, I would only recommend doing it at night. The stuff can rub off, and if you sweat, that may mess it up.<br /><br />Be extra light when you rub across feet, knees and elbows. You can always go back if you need to and tan more, but over tanning is annoying to remove.<br /><br />St, Tropez tanning makes a remover that when applied within 4 hrs of tanning will remove the tanner.   1985. Amazing!!! It works really well. Doesn't smell at all like that nasty chemically smell that some self tanners do. Goes on even and stays for a few days. People think it's a real tan on me.
  1986. I love this stuff!!! The mitt it comes with to apply the product really helps to make your tan flawless and not streaky. I also love the smell, it doesn't have that strong self tanner odor. Does not look orange either. It's amazing!
  1987. This is the best self-tanner I've used. It doesn't streak or look blotchy, smells great, and NO orange color at all! I'm pretty pale and had no issues with this. This is much better than Jergens. It does fade a little bit but not anything too major. I use this on my face as well. I put it on on night after showering. It does have somewhat of a typical self-tanner smell the next day, but only slightly and it doesn't bother me at all. It has a color guard as well so you can see where you put it. Definitely use this in the bathroom as it is a spray and can get on things. Overall I'd highly recommend this.
  1988. This product is good, but I'm surprised at all the wonderful reviews given by fair-skinned people saying it's bronze and not orange-y. It honestly looks very much like other tanning products, I felt, and even though I exfoliated and followed directions to lotion up around the knees and rough patches, it still grabbed there. When it started to fade away, it seemed to just grab to my pores and those rough patches -- leaving me straight up orange when I decided to wean off the product. It isn't as orange-y as other products I've tried, but nothing to scream and rant and rave about. I didn't dare put it on my face -- thank goodness (after seeing what it did to my knees.) I recommend just NOT using it on your elbows or knees, or just EVER so stinking lightly. I was SO careful just to use it super sparingly and just pass over the knees and elbows to avoid staining and it STILL did.<br /><br />It's also very difficult not to get all over -- wherever the mist landed stained my white bathroom counters if left more than a couple seconds. It's hard to be cleaning and applying this at the same time.. There are still drip marks down my bathroom sink and the bottle happened to drip on my arm, which (even wiping it away immediately) left me with a handful of dark drip stains on my arm. Yippee.....<br /><br />I just didn't think it was as jaw-dropping as everyone else made it out to be. I did like that the mitt was offered, but wash it in between uses. ABSOLUTELY use a plastic glove under the mitt. Other reviewers are right -- snip the spray tube before trying to use it because it's far too long and will make the bottle leak. I won't bash the product, but it's not impervious to the drawbacks one would experience with other products. I used it according to directions and even though other raving reviewers chalk up dissatisfaction to \\"not using it correctly,\\" I think it depends on the customer's body and skin tone. I think it is a GOOD product, but it's not worth it to me.
  1989. This is my second bottle and I seriously LOVE this self tanner. I am very pale skinned, and yet have dark brown hair, so a tan really does a lot for me. This is instant, which I love, and if you go dark enough it will last about 6 days. I usually do an all over dark on Friday evening and I am set for the weekend. It is still some color left by Thursday which is good. I have even applied this before and while at the beach with good results. I am a nurse and have learned that any dark spots instantly come off with a little alcohol. So if you ever need to reduce the color absorbed around toes or joints... just use a little rubbing alcohol on a cotton ball. I have noticed that the sensitive skin on my face can break out after using this, so I have stopped using it on my face and use loreal's sunless spray instead. I plan on ordering fake bake's face tanner soon to try it.
  1990. As a former sun worshipper and tanning bed junkie, I am now staying away from the sun - don't want skin cancer! I have tried at least 10 different self-tanners, spray tan at the tanning salon, Mystic Tan, Versa tan, and none of them come CLOSE to this product!<br /><br />It is VERY easy to apply - the applicator mitt is wonderful and ensures an even application.<br />The smell is very tropical and coconutty - like sun tan oil, and does not have that foul \\"self tanner smell\\". It does have a bronzer in it to assist with application and give you instant color. The bronzer part will wash off, but you will still have a lovely glow.<br /><br />I found that using this at night is best - shower, shave, exfoliate and make sure you are completely dry. Use the Fake Bake - I spray it directly on my skin AND on the mitt and buff it evenly into any part of your body that you want to tan. Then wear loose-fitting pajamas, and in the morning, wash off.<br />I usually do this a few (3 or 4) nights in a row, then after that, only once or twice a week for maintenence.<br /><br />I do use this on my face, but Fake Bake makes a self tanner specifically for face, and I want to try this next.
  1991. I am a regular tanner. A couple years back I was in a tanning bed probably 5 days a week for 20 minutes. I loved my tan so much. I can't seem to remember why I stopped tanning, but I did and I went back to my pasty self I was when I was a kid. Yuck! My skin started to get very dry and sensitive after I stopped tanning and I actually ended up getting really bad acne. When I did some time lining, I found out that all my acne problems started when I quit tanning. So I figured I was over the acne I'm gonna start tanning again. My acne and dry skin has gotten better but for the life of me I can't get even 2 shades darker from tanning. I have seen this product used all over YouTube, so I decided to give it a whirl. I LOVEEEEE THIS STUFF! Best thing I have ever spent my money on. I have used all sorts of lotions, creams, sprays, gels, salon spray tans and compared to this they all suck! You can't screw up applying this even if you tried. I was rushing through it and my tan is natural and flawless. I actually could do my feet, elbows and knees with no problems at all. Normally with other products I have a hard time wearing spaghetti straps or bras that fit a little tighter than normal because the pressure will take the tan off and then I have a embarrassing mark where the straps are. 14 hours later, I have a bra and tank top on and there are still no lines :) :). The only problem I have with this product was the packaging. The straw on the spray attachment is way to long for the bottle so naturally the screw top doesn't fit tight enough and the bottle will actually leak. I heard about this problem before I purchased it so i went to Sally's and picked up a generic spray bottle and poured it in there. I recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a natural looking fake tan, who doesn't wanna risk their safety with a tanning bed, who wants a long lasting tan, easy to apply and doesn't wanna fork out the cash for a salon spray tan that doesn't have the quality that thisproduct does. BEST PRODUCT EVER!!!!!!

I just walk around the house naked for awhile to make sure its 1,000 percent dry before I apply my clothes! And also like the directions say- do this before you go to bed and sleep with the tan on! As for the mit it comes with- I wash it in hot water and then lay it out to dry! (I heard washing machines & dryers mess the mitts up) Its perfect!

  2006. I have used several self-tanners. This product, with the color indicator, is an excellent self-tanner. I followed the directions on the package and recommendations of other reviewers: exfoliation, blending balm, gloves & mit (they come with FakeBake Flawless), and I use Malibu Hemp Firming Lotion with gradual tanner in it- daily(Walmart). I recommend using this product at night before bed. The color indicator (and most of the smell) will shower off in the morning. My results have been very good. I wish that I could get an even darker tan. I have even applied the product twice within 24 hours. My natural color is fair to medium. I tan easily in the sunlight. It does have a fake tan smell and the color indicator will fade onto your sheets and clothing(before showering). However, it is a small sacrifice if you want a tan without the risk of sun exposure.

  2012. I've tried a few sunless tanners and this is the best I've come across.   2015. I am VERY pale and live in the east coast so tanning is not much of an option come summer time and it takes a long time for me to get tan. If anyone has any tips please let me know!!! It is such a drag when I have already done my legs, and I am up to spraying my arms and it leaks and then drops on my already-blended legs. Help!!!

  2026. I like this product, but am not in love with it. First, being very fair skinned, I have to apply every night for 4-5 days to achieve my desired color. Second, it is messy. I would definitely recommend covering your floor with towels before using. I spray the product directly onto my skin (instead of onto the mitt), which I find to be more effective, but it gets EVERYWHERE. You won't really notice that its everywhere until you clean your bathroom...lol...but seriously, stained linoleum and toilet seats aren't funny, especially when you're renting! Lastly, it does rub off onto white sheets and light colored clothing occasionally (and the towels you lay down before application will look ruined), but WILL wash out. The smell is much better than most self-tanners, but it does become obnoxious after several hours. On the bright side, the color looks very natural and streak-free (thanks to the blending mitt and color guide mixed in). After you achieve your desired color, it will last several days before needed to re-apply. To prolong and accentuate your &#34;tan&#34; I would recommend using a gradual tinted moisturizer (like Designer Skin) in conjunction with this.

  2033. So this is my first self tanner I have ever purchased and used. Going into it I was VERY scared of turning really orange, messing up, etc. I looked around on the internet for hours before I finally decided to pick up the Fake Bake Flawless, and I so far really love it! (been using for almost a month now)<br /><br />Reasons I love it<br /><br />1. Easy to use<br />2. Nice color, if I wanted to have a sun kissed look I would not spray much on, if I wanted a bronzed look I would spray more (for example for a sunkissed look I would do maybe about 4 sprays on each arm, if I want a more bronzed look I would do 6 sprays)<br />3. Nice smell while applying, and doesn't smell TOO bad after the 8 hours after it's done processing<br />4. Fades off nicely, doesn't fade off in patches<br />5. Doesn't stain clothes (at least it hasn't yet!)<br /><br />Somethings I don't like<br /><br />1. While the smell isn't too bad, the smell will transfer onto your clothes (alot) Also if you are going to have any skin exposed when you go to bed, sleep on a blanket or a separate sheet. I slept in a strapless short dress the first time I used it, when I woke up my sheets smelt like the fake tan pretty badly<br /><br />2. Not a huge fan of the mitt<br /><br />Overall I think if you are wanting to try self tanner, then this would be a good start! I have gotten alot of complements on how I look like I have been getting out in the sun (which I have not), and my color looks nice (everyone thinks it's from being out in the sun! No one has asked if I use fake tan, yay!) If you are like me and are worried about trying fake tan and then it looking horrible or you messing up, just remember it's not permanent! ALSO if you are REALLY worried, just buy some fake tan remover along with the fake tan! So then if you hate the color on you, you can remove it (or just scrub it off) I am so glad I finally tried this stuff! Will continue to use it (:
  2034. This was so much better than I expected having never used a self tanner. I don't like anything that feels greasy so I was unsure when I ordered it but it was not greasy at all. The application is very easy. Make sure you don't use lotions or oils before applying. This helps the product to soak into the skin and for me it last about a week and is just the right color without looking fake. When it rinses off in the shower the next morning, a little of the excess washes off but doesn't affect the color. Great Product!!!!
  2035. Love this product, goes on great, smells like coconuts. Hint; cut off about 3/4 inch of spray tube so that it fits better in the bottle and you will not have any leaking! Also, this is not meant to be used upside down to spray, if you do that it will come out &#34;spitting&#34;, which you will instantly have to rub in or you will get splotches. I do the usual shower, exfoliate, dry, wait at least an hour after shower so you are really dry. Remember to use a small amount of lotion, (not like you would normally moisturize) on heels, ankle bones, knees and elbows so that these areas do not get overly dark!!! Start at feet and work your way up. I spray on the mitt and rub in circles lightly over toes, and then harder on my legs. Apply spray as needed to the mitt and rub in. This product makes you instantly darker so you can see where you would need more spray. Continue rubbing in circles everywhere you want to be tan. Unless you are double-jointed or have long arms, you will need someone to do you back. I also use this on my face, but since there is usually quite a bit of product on the mitt, there is no need to spray more. Girls, if you wear you hair up, make sure to apply this to the sides and back of your neck and outsides of ears! FYI Guys.. I didn't originally buy this thinking my husband would even want to use this product as he was talking about going to a tanning salon...boy was I wrong. My husband is a very fair person, with pasty white skin and especially his legs. He doesn't tan, HE BURNS!. He has tried other products and they always left him orange and any age or darker spots, (he is 57 yrs old) on his legs were made even darker, NOT THIS PRODUCT. I originally bought two 12 oz bottles, (didn't know if I would like it but the reviews were very favorably) and we have both been using it approximately 3-4 times a week since early April and are into the second bottle, but there is about 2/3 left. So I say between the both of us a bottle will last a month or so. ALSO...FYI. I opened the second bottle and it came with a set of the blue gloves, and a mitt but no sprayer so make sure you keep the sprayer. I wash the mitt every 3-4 uses, let dry in the sun, (just put by window not necessarily outside and it drys fast), and then soften the mitt again before use with a soft brush like a toothbrush or a nail scrubbing brush, not real hard just for a bit to make the mitt soft again so that the tanning product goes on smooth. It is now May 13, and I'm getting ready to order again to carry us thru summer. Needless to say, we both love this product, it's easy to use and will keep using it. FYI...I used this in the morning, let dry and then went about my day. Later in the day, while washing dishes and splashing water on my arms, the initial tan color was washing off making my arms splotchy looking. (NOT THE TAN ITSELF). I just took so paper towel and wiped on my arms to get the rest of the initial color dried off and everything was fine. My tan was still there, it was just the initial color that had washed off. Hence the reason the directions say spray at night and take a (VERY LIGHT) shower in the morning and pat, NOT RUB, yourself dry. When you take a shower after applying this product, (WAIT OVERNIGHT OR AT LEAST 12 HOURS) what you see coming off is the initial guide color of the tan, the actual tan product has had a chance to activate and you will still have a tan, maybe somewhat lighter, but still tan. I have had no other problems with this product. Apply two coats initially if you would like, no problem. This product is very flexible and we love it.
  2036. Okay, just started using it, but am VERY PLEASED with the results, AND it's stupid simple to apply. Caution: overspray...........so spray your mitt over a sink or tub. CAUTION: if you have a French manicure, be sure to wear enclosed rubber gloves, it will turn your tips brown! It's so much easier to apply than the lotions or wipes, because you can pretty much see what and where it's going at the time of application, you don't get that next morning wake-up surprise, strips down your legs! I'm not sure how long it lasts, but I really like it, and it looks very natural. I read that the mitt gets kinda stiff and gooy, so I've been washing mine out after every 2 applications. I'm really liking this, and would definitely refer and buy this product again!
  2037. This stuff has to be the best subless tanning product I have ever used. Easy to apply and looks great and smells great too.
  2038. I just applied it this morning and waited 8 hours to shower. I didn't apply it very heavy but so far the color looks ok and pretty natural. I plan to reapply again tomorrow to see if I can make it darker.<br /><br />I did watch some videos on how to apply it which were really helpful for getting even color and to avoid streaks.<br /><br />A lot of reviews say it doesn't have that self tanner smell. For the first 2 hours, it smelled like it's fragrance. After the 2 hours, it definitely has that self tanner smell. I'm glad I did this on a day I was home all day because by the time I was ready to take a shower, I stank. And so did my clothes.<br /><br />I will update on again on the progress of color after a few more applications.<br /><br />UPDATE: So I've tried this a few times now. Here's what I've found -<br /><br />It definitely smells like any other tanner. And even worse, it still smelled more than 24 hours and 2 showers later.<br /><br />The guide color looks better than the tan. Indoors, the final color doesn't look too too bad - but in sunlight it is definitely orangey yellow. My arms don't look as bad because they are naturally darker, but anywhere else has a weird unnatural color.<br /><br />The application is messy. Even if you are careful spraying it, it still sort of &#34;mists&#34; all over the bathroom. I noticed my cleaning cloth was this sort of pinkish brown color when I was cleaning my bathroom. And the mitt is cheap. It fuzzes up and makes a mess.<br /><br />Over all, I'm not happy and will continue my search for a more natural tanner. I returned this one.
  2039. follow directions as written and it works. really like the color and new look it gives me. will buy more.
  2040. I'm a 52 year old with skin that has been weather in Florida for well......52 years. I'm naturally light skinned (European decent) so a little extra tan helps hide the sun spots and imperfections.<br /><br />Let's begin with the good characteristics. This product has a pigment in it that allows you to see where you have applied. I've had no problem getting it evenly distributed. Other products that I have tried leave you guessing until the next day. I've had no problems with this product staining sheets, shirts, or any other clothing. You will get some of the dye rinsing off in the shower though. Because the consistency of this product is like water, they don't have the cost of mixing in a cream or other base material. Meaning that the cost for this product is better than most. It also comes with a pair of rubber gloves, and a mitt to install it. Unlike other mitts that I've used, this one will allow the product to easily seep through so you need to use the rubber gloves as well.<br /><br />Now the bad characteristics. Because the product is like spraying water, it is messy. If you apply this in the shower then rinsing it down (cleaning up) is not a big deal. Another complaint that others have commented, it comes from the manufacture with the tube being too long for the bottle so it causes it to leak at times. I cut about 3/4&#34; off of it and I've had no problems. The rubber gloves typically tear before I finish the bottle so I purchased a back up pair of gloves. I have large hands so this might not be a problem to most people.<br /><br />I get about 6 applications per bottle. each application last a little less than a week (depends on how often your skin exfoliates). To apply this to your back you'll need to purchase a back applicator. I've used one similar to &#34;Body Buddy Non Absorbent Lotion Applicator&#34; that cost about $20. Even with a good applicator, it will make a mess.<br /><br />So I would give the quality of the tanning results and overall cost 5-stars. I would give the easy of application 3-stars. So my overall rating was 4-stars. I plan to purchase more since I like the end results and this product cost less then most.<br /><br />I hope this helps.

  2116. I bought this product because it was the highest rated by users on Amazon, and had some good, in-depth reviews. I was looking for a replacement for the L'Oreal Sublime Bronze products I have used for years. I like the dark tone they provide, but it can be pretty orange and they have to be applied frequently to maintain it. They are also very thick and oily feeling, and remain sticky for quite a while after application. Reviews on Fake Bake Flawless made it sound as though they had solved all of these issues.<br />The spray and mitt work very well for a quick, easy application, and I love the delicate coconut scent. It's also nice that they include latex gloves. The spray goes on very smoothly and evenly, and dries almost immediately for a lightweight, light colored glow. Unfortunately this color is VERY light, and washes off immediately in the shower.<br />I am continuing to use the Fake Bake Flawless spray and mitt to even out the tone of other bronzing lotions, and I like it for difficult areas like ankles, neck, and face. It is definitely not dark or long-lasting enough to use alone.<br /><br />UPDATE:<br />The included mitt disintegrates very quickly, so that it is scratchy on your skin and leaves chunky bits all over you. I still like the spray as a product, so I will not give it a lower rating, but be prepared to find alternative methods of application.
  2117. Looks so natural and NO STREAKS and takes NO TIME! Its do fast and looks amazing every time. I have never had a mess up since I have had it. and I get my legs and stomach done in less than five minutes which is get nice!
  2118.   2129. I never write reviews, but I thought this one deserves a sparkling one. First of all, the package arrived amazingly fast. It goes on as a beautiful bronze gold and doesn't streak at all. Now, of course the user has to take necessary precautions, such as showering and exfoliating. As for the reviews that say the tan washes off the next morning, I would like to debunke that right now. The color that the tan goes on as (a darker bronze) is not what your tan is meant to stay as. That is just an application color to help you not miss any spots. THAT is what washes off the next morning, not the tan. So yes, you are not as dark, but that is how it is supposed to be. It took me a couple applications to get as dark as I wanted, but of course, like everything it just took some time and experimenting with. Overall, I feel like this was more than worth my money, and if you want it to work, you have to be patient and do what it recommends in the directions for the best result!!

Once out of the shower I toweled off thoroughly and put moisturizer on my face, hands, lightly on my knees, elbows, and feet. I put on the cute purple gloves sprayed the product onto the glove and started buffing the product on. It has a guide color so that you can see what your doing and help with even application. Already I was looking good. My husband even helped with my back to make sure I got everything even and non streaky. I was pretty much dry by the time I was done but I waited a extra 15 minutes plucking my eyebrows and cutting my nails etc before I got dressed.   2156. I've tried many and this is by far the best self tanner I've found. I am very pale and this is really the only thing that has worked for me. With that being said, it is not perfect (I doubt if a \\"perfect\\" self tanner exists) which is why I gave it 4 stars. Exfoliate first, use lotion on drier areas such as knees and elbows, spray the mitt a few times, and spread as evenly as you can. I even use on my face without any issues but I recommend doing your face first before too much product soaks into the mitt. The mitt doesn't stay on my hand very well but I believe some reviewers use a rubber band to help keep it in place. It dries pretty quick and I have not had any issues with it rubbing off on my sheets, clothes, etc. It can be a little messy (I would also recommend cutting the spray tube a little and washing the mitt after every use) but the major drawback of this prodcut for me is that it doesn't stay on very long. I have to apply every other day (sometimes every day) to get some color and the darker I go the more orange/streaky it gets. But, it is an affordable product that lasts me quite a few weeks and actually gives me some color so I would highly recommend giving it a try even if you've tried everything else.

  2184. I used this product for the color guide. It was a fast and easy fix for quick color when I needed it and it goes on smoothly. Other than that, the color does not last as long as I would like. Don't get me wrong, I do like the color and it is very realistic, but I would much rather it last longer than my next shower. If you have light skin and you want a glow, this is the product for you. If you prefer a darker color or you have darker skin I would suggest skipping this and using the Flawless Darker version of Fake Bake. The tanning mitt is excellent and should be a necessity for sunless tanning. All in all, this product is worth a shot!

  2237. Okay honest review here! I will say I had high hopes for this product, and I was let down, AT FIRST. On the day I was to receive product, I exfoliated, moisturized and was so excited to put it on after all the wonderful reviews. The first time I put it on, I was horrified to see that I was getting all these dark blotches all over my face. I looked \\"dirty\\" so, to my dismay, I washed, exfoliated it all off and moisturized again thinking I messed up. 2nd try, same thing. Then after some research this is what I found, and after I followed it it was a HUGE HUGE sigh of relief. I was like yayy I can actually use it now! As with any new product, you have to get used to it. Follow these steps EXACTLY, no matter what you may have read, and I promise it will turn out \\"flawless\\" (gave 4 stars because contrary to most comments, after a day or two, it does have a tinge of orange. NOTHING BAD THOUGH like most other self tanners. Looks natural.)<br /><br />Step 1- cut 1 inch off the bottom of sprayer tube (helps with the leaking most people report. Stem is too long!<br />step 2- make sure you are showered, exfoliated, BUT NOT MOISTURIZED. I REPEAT, NOT MOISTURIZED.<br />step 3- Wait until before bed when you aren't running around. Sweating will take product off.<br />step 4- put on rubber glove, and tanning mit<br />step 5- spray directly on arms, legs, body and rub in one section at a time. (DO NOT SPRAY ON FACE.)<br />step 6- spray onto glove and lightly apply to face.<br />step 7- go to sleep. DO NOT MOISTURIZE if skin looks blotchy/dirty Don't worry!<br />step 8- wake up, shower, the color guide to see where you applied product will wash off, (blotchiness will go away.)<br />step 9- dry off lightly, moisturize entire body. Keep moisturized to keep tan up<br />Repeat steps the same night if you want to go darker. I did because the first layer didn't show that big of a difference, but I read you're supposed to apply thin layers. If you follow this I promise it will come out better. I guess moisturizing before applying blocks the product from allowing to stain your skin, so that could be another reason why people complain of color washing off.<br /><br />Tip: don't go overboard on face. It takes 6 hours to fully develop. A little goes a long way. I went overboard my first time and it looked not so good lol.
  2238. I buy these in groups of 8-10 bottles at a time.<br />My girls and I like this because the color is good, not so orangey and fake.<br />Also it's dark, which we like because we're so pale naturally.<br />I like how the guide color makes it look like you just got home from Cabo, and it dries super quick unlike the creams.<br />Just be aware that it will discolor your sheets and white clothes.<br />For the price, it's the best self-tan value.<br />I wish they had gallon containers of it :)

I did did what she said, trimmed the straw on the spray bottle and I didn't have any leaks like some others had stated. I also exfoliated with a loofa sponge and shaved as to not get the &#34;fuzzies&#34; on me from the mitt (all Glynis' advice!), and I rinsed my mitt when I was done. I used a combination of Skin-So-Soft and some body lotion on my knees, elbows, feet, and hands before applying the Fake Bake and I didn't rub the mitt on myself too hard. Another user stated she would rub the Fake Bake on a large area such as her leg, and then use what was leftover from that to wipe on her face as to not risk using too much there. Really good advice ladies! I could tell a difference in my skin color right away. It was a mild change, but I didn't want to do anything drastic in one day. I will apply more tomorrow. This product also didn't leave streaks, I wasn't orange, and it didn't smell bad like other self-tanners.   2261. I have been using sunless tanner for years and this is the one product I always come back to. It has a slight smell to it before you shower for the first time (like all sunless tanners) but this one is actually quite pleasant (especially compared to other products). I have moderately pale skin, I can tan in the summers but never get extremely dark, and this color comes out perfectly on me. I imagine you could apply more often or thicker to get a deeper color, but I usually stick with re-applying every 3-5 days and it looks very natural.
  2262. This stuff is amazing!! I have very pale legs, so needless to say they don't see the sun too often. I've tried various other self tanning products (Jergens, L'oreal sublime glow...) This BY FAR has been my favorite. Super easy to use (especially with the provided glove), pleasant scent and dry time is instant. I apply this 3-4 times a week, in the evening. When you shower you do see some of the product rinse off, but my legs still have a nice 'bake' on them. Also, product has not discolored my bedding or clothes. I will def purchase this again when I run out.

  2267. This is only my second self-tanner I have used but color wise this is the best of the two I have used and this is more of a brown versus orange so the color is very nice... I think all self-tanners can be a pain to use but this one dries quick which I really like. The smell is okay not terrible but not necessarily good either.... I apply at night after bathing and exfoliating my skin really good and rub into my skin. You don't have to be perfect when applying this one and I haven't seen many streaks. I wear overnight and then bathe which some drops off in the shower and of course my white pillow case is stained from the overnight wear. I have dry eczema patches on my elbows and my lower legs so I apply lotion in those areas before I apply this. At first especially on your face after application you will be a little worried that it will streak or not look even but after the shower in the morning every time I have used it I have been pleasantly surprised that every time it has come out even on my skin. The only thing I dislike is that this doesn't last long and I have to apply about every other day or every three days.

Downside to this is that it comes off all over your pillow and sheets.. not sure what to do about that.<br /><br />Once I showered in the morning all of the bronzer washed off and left me with a great looking color!<br /><br />I think that the comments saying it looked like dirt or that it washed away after the first shower can safely be ignored. The \\"dirt look\\" goes away once you shower and all the bronzer washes off. The tan itself remains.   2293. I purchased the Fake Bake Flawless self tanning product. I have used other products of this nature and found this to be the best. The tan is natural looking and the product is easy to apply. I did have a problem with the bottle leaking when using the spray applicator. I tried cutting the tube that goes into the applicator, shorter, as it was to long, but this did not help. I went to Walmart and bought a travel, 8 oz. spray bottle and poured the product into that. It worked great. I later read an idea from another product user. She didn't remove the protective seal that is on the bottle..she just pierced a hole in the center and inserted the tube through the hole and hers worked fine doing it that way. The kit comes with 2 protective latex gloves, to protect your hands from absorbing to much color, and it also includes an application mitt. The only problem I had with the Mitt is that it is hard to keep on your hand. If they would attach elastic around the bottom, it would stay on your wrist better, instead of slipping off. I have seen other product mitts, however, and they are all made the same way.<br /> I love the product and have already ordered 2 more bottles. The product does go a long way, but I do want to keep it on hand. I have been unable to buy it in any store, so mail order seems to be the only option, which takes time.
  2294. I have used tons of self-tanners because I am a pale redhead that burns easily. This goes on evenly, activates and dries fast, and has NO SMELL. My only complaint about this product is that it starts to fade after 24 hours and you have to reapply every day to every other day. I have also tried Sun Labs self-tanner which lasts longer and gets you darker quicker, however, the smell is so bad that I can only put it on before bed. I also find with Sun Labs self-tanner that even after showering in the morning, I can still smell the tanner on me throughout the day. Fake Bake however, is the only self-tanner I can wear during the day and apply whenever I want without fear of giving off that funky self-tanner odor. Also, this product being a spray (as opposed to a lotion) will last you through the summer without repurchasing. Lotions get used up much more quickly AND are more expensive! My advice for this product is to get the mitt slightly damp before rubbing on skin. This will help the mitt from absorbing a lot of product (another downside to lotions) and it will go on more evenly. I am repurchasing today!

It's more brown than orange, so it looks more like a suntan than a self-tan. Now, to the one big negative I have to mention...that darn mitt they include to apply the tanner with. It's too big; it's awkward to use, and it is constantly sliding off my hand. I've tried keeping it in place by putting a rubber band around my wrist, but that really doesn't work all that well, and it's an inconvenience when it's time to switch everything over to using the other hand. A possible suggestion...why not design the mitt so that it fits snugly around the wrist like a regular glove? It certainly couldn't hurt. Also, just so you always have everything at hand , make sure you have extra latex gloves. The ones they include are flimsy and tear easily.

  2339. This product is better than most, however it is not very dark once you wash the bronzer off, the bottle only lasts me about a month, and places like me knee-pits (back of knees) and elbow-pits (inside of elbow) fade much quicker than anywhere else. This fading has only happened to me with this self tanner. It's fairly fixable though, just put more around the inside of your knees/elbows and then wet a paper towel or some TP and wipe off the tanner from any still tan parts (so it only covers white areas you're trying to fill in). Overall, it's still one of the best self tanners I've ever tried, especially for this price ($12.94 when I bought it). I'll be ordering a refill bottle soon!

But you HAVE TO take a shower before going out because if anything should splash on you, even if you wash your hands, it leaves major splash marks and streaks. I love the color before you wash it off, but could hardly tell I applied anything after showering...and that's after leaving it on overnight and applying it several times. The mitt wore off extremely quickly, but you have to use it to apply because if you just try to use your hands with the gloves the solution won't rub in. Another downside with the mitt is even if you exfoliate really well it can be a little abrasive so it will rub skin off as you apply to color, which leads to it being uneven. I bought two bottles trusting in the reviews and am not sure I'll even finish the first one. To say I'm disappointed is a major understatement.

  2375. I bought this in hopes of finding an alternative to going to a tanning bed. This stuff is amazing! However, a couple of things that worked for me that you may want to consider. Also, the mitten that comes with it works very well, but make sure you have a rubber glove on your hand under the mitten as the liquid absorbs into the glove well and WILL turn your palms orange. And, DO NOT USE THIS ON YOUR FACE! If you do, you are guaranteed to look like an oompa-loompa. I just use a normal bronzer powder and I match just fine. This stuff works very well and lasts for quite some time. :)

However, it may seem like the application is easy enough, but it isn't. if you miss a tiny patch of skin and just need that one part sprayed, it is very hard to get an even tone. Application of the entire body takes me about 15 minutes. I do love that it dries so fast and that I can get a good tan without risking cancer in tanning beds. I will continue to use this product because for the most part I am very pleased with it. Just make sure you don'd do anything with water right after your application (like washing your face, brushing your teeth, etc). If even one drop of water goes on your skin within about 5 minutes of your application, it will wash away the product where it landed.

  2408. I am a pasty white girl with freckles. The sun turns me red and then i peel. I spent my younger years in the tanning beds and with the proper tanning lotions, i'd get an adequate color but mostly i turned red and more freckled. Once I hit my 30s, I stopped laying in the tanning bed for the sake of wrinkles and started doing the stand up Mystic Tans but I was often disappointed that my $30 went to waste on the orange tan that was streaky in areas and couldn't wait for it to wash off. About a year ago I decided to have an airbrushed tan done hoping for better results...the results were better as far as streaks go but it faded soooo incredibly fast that my $25 was wasted. This year before vacation, I decided that I'd try a self tanner. I did tons of research and fake bake flawless seemed to be the most feasible for the effort I wanted to put in to getting some color on my skin. I ordered it and the morning it came in, i put it on and was very pleased with the initial smell (kinda coconutty...my 10 year old asked what smelled like sunblock so...). I wore it all night. I could tell the sunless tanner smell was on me when I awoke but it wasn't very strong (which is what i was going for). I showered and then reapplied and went to work (again, a faint sunless tan smell but not offensive at work) when i got home, i showered again. I applied a total of 3 times and when we were on the plane headed to Mexico, my boyfriend asked if I'd been tanning in the tanning bed and I told him no, it was fake bake and then he was disappointed that he didn't let me spray him down. I'm pleased with the natural tone this fake bake gives my skin. I do not have an orange hue, but a natural bronze...without the hassel of going to the tanning bed or making an appointment to get a mystic or airbrush. It goes on with a tint so you know where it's going. I use it right after showering and lotioning and I haven't noticed any streaking or clumps of color. Going this route is much cheaper than getting spray on tans and much more convenient. I'm excited to use this time and time again throughout the winter when I need a little burst of warm color! You may want to place a towel down when you spray it because it does get on floors and walls but wipes right up. I did not notice the color coming off of my skin on to my sheets but I did spray it one time and then went running a few hours later--i do not recommend this! I do, however recommend the product itself!pray on tans and much more convenient. I'm excited to use this time and time again throughout the winter when I need a little burst of warm color! When they got stained, I noticed that the stains were more red than orange, which is why it doesn't make you look like a carrot, in my opinion at least. So from then on, I exfoliate int he shower, put it on, and sleep in black pants and black shirt on a brown blanket on top of my bed. It may seem like a hassle to some, but I only tan for special occasions, so I don't mind. I've tried AT LEAST 5 other self tanners, this is the best one BY FAR!!!
  2413. wonderful product. Tans like when you go get a spreay tan from a salon but It doesn't have the stinky after smell. Smells tropical. I love it. Only problem was after it starts to wear off, you must exfoliate and start over eventually.. maybe after a week or so. Overall, it's one of the best self tanners for the price and results and there's no reason to spend hours laying out and damaging your skin by the sun when you can get an awesome tan really quickly

I`m pretty surprised on the reviews and the scale of the emotions some users express.<br />This is a cosmetic product.It works for some,and doesn`t for others.<br />The success of using depends on so many factors.<br />First read a lot about the product before you use it.Find out if it worth to try and you want to spend the time, money effort to experiment with it.It takes time to find out for your skin and match that to your expectations.<br />I definitely wouldn`t use it first time before some important event - to be shocked or be surprised on the results ( good or bad way).<br />Like with any product it can have short comings and it takes time to learn how to use/apply successfully and adjust the practice to your liking.I have very light skin tone with natural blonde hair,blue eyes, and it takes very long time to tan naturally.<br />I have sensitive dry skin, and gave up on using tanning beds long time ago because of the drying effect, what I couldn`t tolerate and/or counter with any level of moisturizing.<br />That`s being said here are some of my thoughts about this product:<br />- try it when you have the time, and when you do not have any important appearances;<br />-try it with a friend or partner( easier to apply, more eyes can see more, and correct more)Make sure the partner is honest :);<br />-exfoliate a day before and do not use creams or body lotions before( except a light layer on palms,knees,elbows;<br />-DON`T USE THE GIVEN MITT, purchase a separate one from Beautisol ( Amazon sells it)- the difference is significant,Fake Bake`s is just a sponge with no barrier layer, that`s why they provide the rubber gloves, Beautisol`s have an extra waterproof layer in the sponge side of the mitt, protecting your hands from any unwanted layers of color;<br />- apply small amounts at a time 1-2-3 puffs, so you can control the amount and color-I found it easy to apply, but you have to work fast and have a light hand,with long movements and circular ones too;<br />-have a set of underwear, lounge pants and top,robe,pajama, hoodie etc with earth colors,BROWN!, what you can wear in the next hours, and put on after applying the tanning product- I have brown towels,and sheet set also for these occasion, no reason to<br />mess up anything,and even if staining would happen- you don`t feel sorry,and everything washable( so instead of vining, be prepared);<br />-don`t shower for at least 5-6 hours after applying FB;<br />-don`t wear white or very light /expensive clothing right after applying- or make sure you wipe off the dried excess product with a dry white wash cloth;<br />-I apply make up after using FB -no problem;<br />- FB is significantly changes my skin tone for the better, but it doesn`t last for me for a week - unless you don't use shower regularly every day,<br />so I enhance the results on my legs arms, and chest,neck with Nivea sunkissed legs lotion;<br />-YES the shower will take off a big amount of the color;<br />-I don`t have issues with the scent- I think all of the self tanners have a significant odor,until somebody will find a better chemical what reaches the same effect;<br />-make sure that you have smooth skin when applying- shave and make sure you are careful around the eyebrows, or if you have facial hair take care of it a couple day earlier;<br />Practice and accept the possible results! There`s no perfect product, but everybody can learn if this one works for her or not.<br />It is not bad, but I wish it would last and stay longer on my skin.<br />It is a lot of work, when you don't have naturally tan skin- just to keep up.So I use it for special occasion and try keep it while having my daily routine of hygiene.<br />I wish with face cleaning(I use creams with pads and water) wouldn't wash off most of the tan.<br />And don`t forget- this is not a body lotion, so if you have dry skin you have to hydrate a couple hours later- and that process will rub off some of the tan also.<br />FB doesn``t stay on too long in swimming pools -I wish somebody can offer one for SWIMMERS!<br />FB does not have any SPF properties - so that is your responsibility to apply when showing off around the pool, or on the beach.<br />If you go on a vacation bring all the stuff you need to use it and reapply depending on the activities.<br />Good lucko long in swimming pools -I wish somebody can offer one for SWIMMERS!<br />FB does not have any SPF properties - so that is your responsibility to apply when showing off around the pool, or on the beach.<br />If you go on a vacation bring all the stuff you need to use it and reapply depending on the activities.<br />Good luck
  2441. dude checking in here. can only compare this to loreal sublime bronze and banana boat for light skin and this product is far superior to either . Loreal is for women and has glitter in it, streaking and just looks bad and smells worse. banana boat just didn't really tan very well at all. i have light skin tone, but it was an incredibly ineffective product. i could barely tell the difference. both did not do well with body hair at all and you could tell.<br /><br />now first off guys if your new to this. exfoliate. this is not recommendation but a requirement. if you don't know how to go about it then google it. i use shea suger body stuff in lime as it has the least odor. or just use apricot scrub on the cheap. trust me. otherwise you will be found out immediately as i made that mistake and it comes out totally uneven and almost like a worn out leather kinda look. never again. never again<br /><br />review:<br />i was somewhat nervous as it was a liquid spray and i thought it might be too extreme or leave alot of marks but found that it spread very well over skin and the application mitt is now a mandatory for me regardless of what i end up using down the road. the biggest and easiest give away you self tan is the palms of your hands and streaks on the side of your hands and fingers. regardless of whether you get this product or not, get a mitt as well. i have alot of calluses on my hands from golfing and lifting so it was even more so obvious for me.<br /><br />also what is required is to be moisturized wherever you are applying it. don't apply this to dry skin, but wait maybe 10min after you are moisturized.<br /><br />i use this on my legs arms chest back and face neck and after using it for maybe 3 weeks now i am maintaining the tan i got over the summer and it looks very natural as long as you don't go overboard or do it without a mirror. just do each section of your body at a time in front of a mirror to ensure you miss nothing. rub it in in circular motion and if you have abs you can do little tricks to highlight them a little bit which i do from time to time. also another great thing is that it does well with body/arm/leg hair and even my perma-5 o'clock shadow. I found it best that after i am done rubbing it in, my last swipes i try to make my hair on my arms/legs &#34;stand up&#34; so they dont stick to my body and affect the tanning process in any way. don't know how much that matters, but seems reasonable and i imagine for the haireir guys this would be mandatory to avoid weird streaking patterns. I would be careful about your mustache though. i generally shave it now before i tan cause it is disproportionate to the rest of my face in regards to the shade i end up with. so no big deal really.<br /><br />i have heard good thing about tanning mouse for men and will definitely give that a shot as well as that is known to work great with hair as well and is generally suggested for dudes and may come back and adjust this review if need be after doing so.<br /><br />but as of now, i'm totally satisfied with the product and would suggest it to a friend (who knows how to keep secrets).... kinda don't get the stigma around guys self tanning... tans make people look better/healthier and it reduces chance of skin cancer... it's the most logical manner in which to acquire a tan... models do it. celebrities do it, but it's ok cause they make money off their looks... well i just want to look better and healthier and now i do and will continue to unabashed.<br /><br />so go out there and tan my brothers!

  2459. I will start by saying that this is by far the very best self tanning product I have ever used, and I have used ALOT of different products! I have pretty fair skin and melanoma runs in my family so I avoid tanning beds and excessive sun exposure but a beautiful tan looks so healthy. This tanning product is super quick to apply and when you first put it on it smells very tropical like a coconut kind of scent. After wearing this product for a little while it does get a typical self tanner smell but it is a soft scent and not nearly as overwhelming as other self tanners. I use the fake bake flawless at night right before bed after I have already brushed my teeth and done anything else that I need to do that requires using water. This stuff literally takes 10 mins tops to apply and dries almost instantly, there is absolutely no wait time before you can get dressed. Typically, with other products, I have a hard time getting my whole body tanned evenly, including my hands and feet. With other tanners my face, hands, and feet are usually blotchy and streaked but that does not happen with fake bake flawless. It has a very nice natural brown color and a color guide that allows you to see where you have tanned. Even if you get extra product in one spot it evens out very nicely after you shower. I have not had any blotching or streaking with this formula and it is gradual and buildable! Make sure you exfoliate and moisturize before using and apply to clean skin! For elbows, knees, ankles, feet, and hands I apply a thin layer of lotion as a barrier before tanning so it does not settle in to the dryer parts of my body and come out darker than the rest of my body. This product comes with latex gloves and a tanning mit. The mit is a life saver and makes it so easy to apply the product evenly! I do recommend rinsing the mit after each use so that the tanner does not build up and make it gross. I have my boyfriend rinse it for me so I don't mess up the tan on my hands! I love this product and will never use anything else!

I showered the next morning, and most of it washed off, so I though why not apply million dollar tan and see what happens. Once I did that the next day I had an amazing \\"glow\\", a bronze \\"glow\\". I have been applying fake bake once a week and then tan icon on Fridays to get a little glow for the weekend. Fake bake is a great product, for a simple tan.
  2480. This product was definitely not for me...<br /><br />After reading numerous reviews and watching a half dozen tutorial videos on youtube, I decided to try this for my very fair skin. I had read that people with fair skin had good luck, but not for me.<br /><br />I received it yesterday, showered, exfoliated then applied it. I did apply it directly to the mitt and rubbed in small circular motions doing just one part of my body at a time, upper arm/shoulder, lower arm, upper leg, lower leg, etc.<br /><br />I found that wherever the mitt initially touched my skin after spraying the product on it, it stained my skin, it didn't spread. As I rubbed it on, it went on smoothly, but where it first touched my skin, it left a splotchy mark that I couldn't get evened out. I don't know how some people spray it directly on their skin (watch some of the youtube videos, those girls are brave!), I would be a mess!<br /><br />Most of the reviews that I read stated the scent was Hawaiian or tropical smelling, but I don't think so. It smelled just like all the other self tanners, stinky. It was worse when I got up this morning, I couldn't wait to take a shower.<br /><br />When I got up this morning I was completely yellow (not orange, but yellow. I looked jaundiced!) and splotchy all over, arms, legs, spots that I rubbed several times were practically bare. Could I have rubbed it too much and some of the product rubbed off perhaps??<br /><br />Whatever the reason, this is just not for me.<br /><br />I will say there are a couple of positives....<br /><br />After smoothing it on as evenly as I could, it was dry as most people have stated, so that was a plus. And the mitt applicator was very soft, but I don't know how effective it was if I noticed splotchiness.<br /><br />I will go back to my Designer Skin Tinted Love moisturizer, I've had great luck with it and was just wanting to mix it up a bit. Guess I should just stick with a good thing when I have it! :)

  2493. I wanted to review this after using for a couple weeks to be able to share some pros, cons and some tips! I think the color is great! Super natural, a nice bronze color as if I live on a tropical island and spend all day outside! Im naturally fair skinned, but tan well. This didn't look fake or orange and smells great! Here are some of my cons, which won't make me stop using it. The first is- the smell after it settles isn't pleasant (baked skin smell), but I can get past it. Secondly, when I shave and use it, it tends to color in the pores on the lower portion of my legs. This isn't noticeable from far away and it hasn't been something I've been able to fix. Third, the mitt got scraggly and pilled even after the first use! Some of which came off on my skin, but was easily wiped away. I ended up shaving the mitt to get the stuff off. Here are some tips- EXFOLIATE EXFOLIATE EXFOLIATE! No matter what, you must exfoliate before putting it on- even if it's your second application for the week. I made the mistake of not exfoliating once and had weird blotchy spots from where the tanner applied previously was still on me. My other tip is- don't wear white right afterwards. I've noticed that it does stain the white clothes, sheets, etc. At first this was extremely alarming...my white sheets were ORANGEY PINK! But I used OxiClean today and no trace of a stain to be seen! Yay! So yes, this product isn't perfect but I've never had such nice glowing, bronzed skin like I do now! I love it and it's well worth some of the faux pas that I can overlook. Give it a try! It's worth it!

But no matter how good the product, a fake tan never hides the flaws or glows from deep within the skin like a natural tan does. So don't get your hopes too high. But who needs skin cancer?   2520. This is my favorite self tanner!!! I love it so much and I am so glad I found it. I works brilliantly and does not smell bad. It smells like coconuts which I love. If you are not a fan of that scent, you may not like this. If you follow the directions you will have a believable looking tan. I have light/medium golden skin and it looks just like my skin when it is tan. It is a little bit of a labor of love to apply it correctly. This what I do:<br /><br />1.) Cleanse and Exfoliate: Either use a good sugar scrub or get an exfoliating mitt. I love the kae exfoliating hamman glove.<br /><br />2.) Apply a light moisturizer to elbows, knees, ankles, feet, and wrists.<br /><br />3.) Apply the spray as directed. Do not spray directly on the skin. Spray small amounts of tanner in the glove and swipe in long sweeping motions.<br /><br />4.) Use blending cream or balm on elbows, knees, ankles, feet, and wrists. I like xen tan blending balm. It also has a faint smell of coconut.<br /><br />5.) Wash hands, especially if you run out of the gloves sent with the kit.<br /><br />Another thing I like to do to give my face a glow is to spray a squirt in my face lotion and blend evenly. I mainly use it on my face, neck, arms during the fall and winter. In the spring and summer I will do most of my body.<br /><br />This product lasts and lasts. If you treat your mitt well it last long enough. I wash mine with my shampoo until it runs clear, wring it out gently, and hang dry.<br /><br />As another reviewer noted, cut about one inch off the straw or the bottle will leak. I did that and was able to travel with it. Enjoy! This is the best out there and you can't beat the price on here. It is a lot better for your skin than tanning, and a lot better for your lungs than a spray tan.
  2521. Best self tanner I have ever tried, and I've tried a lot! Only streaks if you aren't paying attention or don't exfoliate first. It smells like coconut and not at all like most self tanners. I tried it out yesterday for the first time, and the results are great. It was easy to apply, and the color guide shows you exactly where the product is so you can avoid streaks. The scent is awesome. All self tanners have the same underlying smell from the active ingredient, but this one is very minimal, and the scent itself is great. The ones that came with it ripped on second use, but that's no biggie.<br /><br />UPDATE: I still do really like this product, but I had to take a star away. The tan does not last as long as it did with the regular Fake Bake lotion I used before, and when it wears away, it gets kind of blotchy looking. Not too noticeable, but I noticed it on myself. I'd guess you'd have to reapply this at least every other day for it to stay fresh and nice looking.
