  2540. I am so incredibly fair that when I roll up my pants in the sunlight, I pull a 'Twilight'. (My stomach just blinds people.)<br /><br />I have been using different tanning products for years, everything from L'Oreal Sublime Bronze (which I was vaguely favorable to), MysticTan, VersaSpa (good in a crunch, but not at the eleventh hour), and Jergens Natural Glow. I came across this product when searching for options knowing I have a wedding to attend. I am extremely tired of being ORANGE. Especially in the traditional places where the lotions sink in too much and create the ever lovely bread-crust effect on the edges of the palms, between the fingers, nail beds, and don't even get me started on the feet! Or streaks for that matter! (UGH!)<br /><br />Enter my discovery of Fake Bake Flawless. I was a bit gun-shy, seeing as there were a few reviews moaning and groaning about trouble with the mitt and trouble with leaking from the bottle... but after reading one absolutely AMAZING review (Shout out to Glynis Ewing!!) I decided to He** with it... I'm buying it! Worst that can happen is another orange week right?<br /><br />Well! I am here to say, that is SO NOT THE CASE!!<br /><br />I FEEL PRETTY!! OH SO PRETTY! hahaha No really though... Glynis is dead on when she recommends that you trim the tube, I measured it by sight looking at how much would need to come off just to screw the cap down tightly. You will know what we mean when you see it.<br /><br />WEAR YOUR GLOVES!! Don't risk having too much on your hands because this is a fast drying product (and trust me, that's a good thing!!)<br /><br />Clean your mitt! I do it every time, and it's been used three times now to equal success each time!<br /><br />Go slowly!! I tend to get a bit antsy and go too fast over my thighs, but that's how you can miss a spot... luckily, touch-ups are not hard with this formula!<br /><br />Start with your feet, do both at the same time. Work your way up from your ankles to your knees, make sure you are working the whole way around your calves and then thighs. I say this because my first time I didn't do this as a total airhead and went up one leg, and then found myself leaning against the leg I had just done to do the other. Which was awkward. I did work around that, but still... not the brightest moment.<br /><br />Also, for ladies with busts that are larger... make sure when you do your chest area, you are careful to have a fan at the ready so that you can dry the area rather quickly. If you let them sit and sweat, you might get lines.<br /><br />After you take off your gloves... WASH THE MITT FIRST!<br /><br />Why you may ask? Because you don't want to wash off all the tanning lotion that you put on your hands, and then try and clean the glove. I did that one too. Very frustrating.<br /><br />As Glynis mentioned, using the blending balm is a must! I thought buying a second product sucked but I was not exceptionally in to the whole idea of lines or splotches. And it was worth it! The balm is like a wax, and you apply it after the tanner to blend the color, or before it to block it completely. It's pretty awesome!<br /><br />http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0079M7VN6/ref=oh_details_o05_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 &lt;--- Link to the Blending Balm<br /><br />I will be adding a picture to show exactly how awesome the final product of the lotion was for me on the first go, and I must say, I really am pleased! I love it! My family has a super high number of people with skin cancer throughout, and I am less and less charmed with the idea of being in a tanning bed three times a week.<br /><br />A total winner!<br /><br />Update 6/15/2013:<br />I've been using the Fake Bake Flawless intermittently for some time now and am still very pleased with it! A few things that I have noticed that are worth mentioning...<br /><br />* When washing your mitt: I use a gentle shampoo to wash it out, and truly scrub it. I have been using a paraben-free shampoo that I didn't likefor my hair and it has been great for truly rinsing out all of the tanner and letting the mitt return to original status. If you don't get it all out, when you use it again it will leave little dark brown specs that are coming off the mitt.<br /><br />* I spray the the Fake Bake on the back of my hands, one or two spritzes on each hand, and then put a deep moisturizer on with it and rub it all in together. That along with the blending balm on my knuckles and side of my palms is really affective for getting the color to my hands without leaving odd markings or shading.<br /><br />* I have the \\"Fair\\" version of this product too, and it's a lotion. Have to admit... it's really not that great. It's not as potent as the Flawless, and the Fair is harder to have saturate the skin. It takes time let it set... and it's easier to scrape part of the color off on something by accident.<br /><br />* Invest in a good wand that can be used to reach your back if you aren't yoga flexible. Mine has a pumice-like stone that is non-porous that I got at walmart... It's specifically marketed for tanning but I loathe it honestly so I plan to replace it with one from Amazon. However, it's useful for reaching the areas that are hard to reach by hand alone.<br /><br />Still 5 stars!! Love this product!!for my hair and it has been great for truly rinsing out all of the tanner and letting the mitt return to original status. If you don't get it all out, when you use it again it will leave little dark brown specs that are coming off the mitt.<br /><br />* I spray the the Fake Bake on the back of my hands, one or two spritzes on each hand, and then put a deep moisturizer on with it and rub it all in together. That along with the blending balm on my knuckles and side of my palms is really affective for getting the color to my hands without leaving odd markings or shading.<br /><br />* I have the \\"Fair\\" version of this product too, and it's a lotion. Have to admit... it's really not that great. It's not as potent as the Flawless, and the Fair is harder to have saturate the skin. It takes time let it set... and it's easier to scrape part of the color off on something by accident.<br /><br />* Invest in a good wand that can be used to reach your back if you aren't yoga flexible. Mine has a pumice-like stone that is non-porous that I got at walmart... It's specifically marketed for tanning but I loathe it honestly so I plan to replace it with one from Amazon. However, it's useful for reaching the areas that are hard to reach by hand alone.<br /><br />Still 5 stars!! Love this product!!

Fake Bake Flawless is awesome, it doesn't streak and lasts for several days if applied properly, I use it twice a week. I don't use the spray top because it goes everywhere around in a fine mist, I noticed it on the bathroom floor later, so I just unscrew the top and dap on the mitt and apply in circular motion, works much better for me that way. Also, I'm sure mostly everyone knows this, but I learned this the hard way, is to use a scrub before the first application and apply a little bit of lotion on feet, knees and elbows to make the product go on smoothly to those areas.<br />Overall I love this product, want to also try the Fake Bake Mouse and see if it's just as good.<br /><br />As far as seller goes, my order came in earlier than expected and everything is packaged well, no complaints at all.   2584. I am about as fair as they come. I am pale, almost sickly pale. Sometimes I get insecure about it, so I've tried a couple other tanning methods. I've tried the sun, but it seems like I either burn or nothing happens. I've done the mystic spray tan and hated it, it lasted a couple days and smelled rank, and I've done banana boat and jergens lotion. Both are streaky and I hated the results (or lack of) I gave up and tried this...<br /><br />It comes with a spray cap, lotion type cap, a mitt and a pair of gloves. The easiest way is to snip off about an inch off the bottom of the spray top and use that instead of the lotion cap to avoid mess. I spray onto my skin everywhere except my hands, feet, and face, I spray onto the mitt for those areas. My favorite part is you can see what areas you've tanned because it has color guard. I didn't use lotion on my problem areas and I didn't have any blotches at all. Make sure to exfoliate before hand.<br /><br />Edit: I've now been using this for a couple weeks and I can give a more detailed review. The tan itself on me lasts about a week. I find my face and chest seems to fade much faster then other parts so I end up re-touching every 2-4 days. Remember, I do not use gradual tanner in between, just this product.<br />I like this because when you apply it and if you accidentally find a blotch, you can still rub it out if you recently applied the tan.<br /><br />FINAL EDIT:<br />I've been on this stuff for over a month and I'm getting to the point where it's too much of a hassle to keep it up. I apply it at night before bed, get up and go to work and come home and shower. Almost 50% of it washes down the drain. I put a sticker on my hip to monitor the tan and I'm already losing a s*** ton of color the next day of washing. To keep my color I'd literally have to be applying every day or every other day. It just washes off. It's not like I'm scrubbing hard either, just a quick sponge off. You could see where I placed the sticker clear as day after I tanned but after showering you have to really look to see it. I am extremely disappointed because it looked like this was going to be a good product, but it does not last.<br /><br />I bought the fake bake lotion and I plan to double team myself with this product and that one in hopes I'll have a more stable tan but if not, I'll probably use up the bottle and never buy it again. I just don't understand how it can fade that much after one wash. They say the color running down the drain is only color guard, thats not true. It's half of your skin tone. :/showering you have to really look to see it. I am extremely disappointed because it looked like this was going to be a good product, but it does not last. I bought the fake bake lotion and I plan to double team myself with this product and that one in hopes I'll have a more stable tan but if not, I'll probably use up the bottle and never buy it again. What I did, because I totally freaked out the first time I seen it, was apply some more baby oil to those areas and blended it with the rest of the surrounding skin. It may still look dark, but once you shower the next day or 6hrs later, it comes off and you look amazing! OH...and make sure to cut the tubing of the sprayer before putting it in the bottle. What I am most afraid of when trying new self tanners is that the color will come off orangey and streaky. Luckily this self tanner produced and very natural color on my skin, very close to a natural tan. Not orange at all.<br /> When applying this product, you have to make sure your spread it out immediately after you spray it cause it sets into the skin very quick. Also make sure to not spray too close to the skin as it will make it more difficult to spread and will leave a small dot stain on the skin. Also don't forget to exfoliate and shave or wax your skin prior to applying the fake bake (very important for an even and long lasting tan).<br /> This product is also pretty long lasting usually lasts about a week so I only use this once a week at night (I only apply self tanner to my legs) and the best part, I only need to apply this once to achieve a nice dark tan. It absorbs and drys very quickly so I can hop into bed right after and wake up with a tan the next morning.

On the way home from my vacation I made sure to tighten the lid (like I did the first time) and use 2 ziplock bags & an additional plastic bag over the two ziplock, but yet somehow it leaked again, but I placed the bottle away from clothing, but if I wouldn't have done that I would've ruined more clothes. Bottom line DO NOT TRAVEL WITH THIS ITEM WHEN FLYING.. Unless the bottle is completely unopened.

  2684. I'm the kind of girl who researches a product in-depth prior to purchasing and I pay special attention to negative reviews. While researching Fake Bake Flawless, I noticed that most of the negative reviews were from fair-skinned women like myself. Well, I am very, very fair-skinned, so I ordered this product with a bit of hesitation. I'm glad that I did.<br /><br />I decided that I would first tan only my legs, in case it became streaky or orange on my white skin with red undertones. If it turned out badly, I could always wear pants until it faded. Well, I exfoliated like crazy, paying attention to my knees and ankles. After I exited the shower and dried off completely, I added a dab of baby oil gel to my knees to lessen the amount of self-tanner that was deposited there. I then applied the self-tanner per the directions.<br /><br />I noticed color right away, but since many pale reviewers claim that ALL of the color washed away after their shower the next morning, I did a second very thin layer after the first layer dried, just to be safe.<br /><br />I left the tanner on for 9 hours and then rinsed it off, using my hands---NOT a loofah or wash cloth. Once the water ran clear, I exited the shower and used a towel to pat-dry my legs. Next, it was the moment of truth. I examined my former milky white legs and couldn't help but stare with a cheesy grin on my face. I was amazed with the results.<br /><br />My once pale legs are now a sun-kissed brown with absolutely no streaks. I seriously cannot stop staring at them and I can't wait to tan the rest of my body.<br /><br />I absolutely recommend this product for all complexions. I also advise everyone to read as many tips as possible on application, trim the stem of the spray-bottle head about 1 1/2 inches prior to use to avoid leakage (it is way too long for the bottle), and wash the mitt after every application.<br /><br />If you pay very close attention to what you're doing and exfoliate beforehand, add a dab of oil to knees, ankles, and elbows, buff lightly, let it sit for at LEAST 6 hours, and use your hands to rinse, you'll be satisfied.<br /><br />Fake Bake Flawless is now my favorite product.o knees, ankles, and elbows, buff lightly, let it sit for at LEAST 6 hours, and use your hands to rinse, you'll be satisfied.<br /><br />Fake Bake Flawless is now my favorite product.

  2700. I have used hundreds of self tanners I'm a red head so self tanning is a necessary evil for me. This product is comparable to Clarins body bronzer, but alot less expensive. It has a dark color guard it is messy and you spray it and rub the product into your skin. (it will drip everywhere) I didn't use the mitt it comes with I feel like those things only absorb the product and you end up using more, but anyways. You'll need rubber gloves to apply it to keep it off your hands. The color pay off is good with this one, just make sure you moisturize after it develops because it really drys out your skin. One application gives you a nice color also make sure you don't sweat or go out in the rain after you use it that color guard is messy and will get everywhere. I'll probably keep a bottle of this on hand from now on as my backup product. Happy Tanning!
  2701. I bought this product for my girlfriend and she uses it quite often. It blends in nicely and looks very natural. It has a strong sweet smell which may turn some off but compared to the horrible smell of other tanning sprays it is welcome.
  2702. Wife writing this review: works well if you follow the directions and don't overdo it. I am fair skinned (one step up from a red head, basically) and this works pretty well, better than I thought it would. It didn't end up looking too bronze, either, which I appreciated. I used a light coating of massage oil on my hands, elbows, and knees prior to applying. The mitt worked well. My only complaint would be that it's a little messy, make sure and do it somewhere that you can clean up later (I did mine at the bathroom counter/sink and all the brown spray cleaned right off later). The instructions say to apply before bed, but I would advise against that if you sweat at night, I ended up sweating in my sleep and had my arm folded and had a very noticeable brown line down my arm the next day. Other than those avoidable/fixable problems, overall a good product and would recommend. Plus the smell is better than any other tanning product I've experienced.

The instant color it provides is a great application guide, and the smell is the best of any self tanner I've used - light, tropical, almost coconut scented. The bronzer washes off in the shower and you're left with nice, natural-looking color. If you want a little darker color, just use more sprays. I found it a bit hard to use the mit with the gloves on, just cause it kept slipping, but it still blended. [I took off the rubber gloves eventually]<br /><br />It creates a gorgeous tan. No orange at all.<br /><br />Tips:<br /><br />Exfoliate!!<br />Put a moisturizer on your knees & elbows first, then let dry. (I used Neutrogena seasame body oil)<br />Cut the straw before you put it in the bottle to avoid leakage.<br />Blend blend blend using the mit. Then blend some more.<br />Hang out naked for a bit. Let it dry completely.<br /><br />Good luck! Don't over think it cause it really is fail proof if you follow the directions.
  2772.   2774. I love this stuff. I have very fair, sensitive skin, so I have difficulty finding a tanning product that works well for my skin. This stuff gives me a great brown color - NO ORANGE (yay!). I'm on my second bottle (the first lasted over a month I think), and have learned some tricks since I started using it.<br />-A&D Ointment: If you're like me, and you're legs itch like crazy after applying this stuff, make sure to put a thin layer of A & D ointment wherever is sensitive BEFORE you apply the product. Also, put the ointment on your knees, feet, hands, and elbows. It keeps it from absorbing too much into your skin and making it look dirty.<br />-Spray straight on the skin: I know it says to spray on the mitt, but I just spray it right on the skin and immediately rub it in with the mitt. The mitt absorbs a lot of the product, and it'll last longer if you spray a few times and then rub it in. I do spray it on the mitt for hard-to-reach spots, knees, feet, hands, and my face.<br />-Exfoliate: I exfoliate about every 4-5 days (anytime I start seeing build-up) with exfoliating gloves. If you don't, the tan will start looking uneven.<br />-Moisturize: I apply the product at night (after a shower), and then shower again in the morning to rinse it off. After it's rinsed off, I moisturize with Australian Gold Moisture Lock Tan Extender. I'm sure you can use whatever kind works for you, just as long as you moisturize.<br />-Warning: It will come off on your sheets and clothes. You'll find that with ANY self-tanner. There's just no way around it. However, since you rinse this kind off after you apply it, I've noticed it comes off on the clothes a lot less than others do. It IS all over my used-to-be-white sheets, though. Small price to pay.<br /><br />Hope this helps anyone thinking about buying this product! It really is all about trial and error. You'll find what works best for you. But this product is definitely great and (after trying TONS of self-tanners) this BY FAR is #1 (and inexpensive!).

If you screw this tanner up, you probably should give up sunless tanning all together. Wear gloves, though. Tanner can bleed through the buffing mitt. And it really stains.<br /><br />Be sure to exfoliate, then shave and of course, lotion up with something light. I spray tanner directly onto my body working small areas at a time. Like, the top of my arm all the way around, then bottom of my arm, etc. Buff lightly onto feet and hands using the buffing mitt only. I use this right before bed and wake up with a gorgeous glow. Shower off in the a.m., and go to work feeling like a beautiful, bronzed goddess. And between you and me, my boss is kinda hot. So little confidence boosts are always welcome. Anywho, if you've never used this stuff, I highly recommend you try it.

It's also finicky--I could not prevent the color from catching in, and darkening, my pores. It's also a fairly dark color, which I did not want, because I just need a little color, not to look like I actually do spend a ton of time in the sun/tanning salon. The most annoying thing about this product is that it literally sweats off (I had brown sweat running down my legs), and the color doesn't last much more than a day. This is definitely going back.

  2789. I bought this product based on reviews, and I am so happy I did. This didn't turn me orange, didn't come off on my clothes, even right after I applied it, it didn't streak, and it looked natural!<br />A few tips:<br />1. Make sure to bend your joints (elbows, knees, knuckles, etc.) when applying. If you don't, you will be able to see lighter lines when you bend them.<br /><br />2. I always spray on the mitt, and then use it to rub on my body. I don't spray directly onto my body. I have found that it's a lot neater this way, and less clean-up afterwards. i have never had a streaking problem.<br /><br />3. Spots that are often missed: Ears, behind the ears, neck, back of the neck, underside of arms, tops of feet/toes, tops of hands/toes, and inner and back of thighs.<br /><br />4. Exfoliate one to two times per week. Don't use the product right before you exfoliate, because it will take off some of your tan. I use it right after, then every 3 days after that. I, personally, only exfoliate once per week and have never had an issue.<br /><br />5. Use it at night. I have let this dry for 5-10 minutes, then have put my pajamas on...White pajamas! And I didn't see any streaks on my body, or any orange streaks on my clothes. I did, however, accidentally spray it on a pair of white pants, and it washed right off in the washing machine. I was kind of reluctant to use it at night before bed, but it didn't effect my tan at all, even if I was laying on the pillow all night. YOU'RE SUPPOSED TO RINSE IT OFF IN THE MORNING. If you leave it on, you will wake up looking dirty, but once you shower and rinse it off, it will look better.<br /><br />One of the best parts about this product is that it doesn't make my face break out! I have very sensitive skin, and was reluctant to try, but I haven't broken out yet and have used this product at least 10 times!

  2792. I have used Fake Bake products off & on for 5 years and I have loved it from the first time I used it. I started using the lotion & this year I decided to get the flawless spray. It is the only product I have ever used that doesn't streak, doesn't come off on my clothes, and looks like a natural tan. I am very pale & always burn so fake bake has been a wonderful product for me. I exfoliate before I use it & after reading other reviews I trimmed the tip off the spray bottle so it has never leaked from the top as have been some reviewers complaints. I also have washed the mitt after each use to prolong the life of it & to keep it soft so the spray continues to go on streak free. To get the tan I want I use Fake Bake about 3 days in a row & then I reapply about every 3 days. I feel like it fades out waiting a whole week to reapply. I also do use it on my face. I just use a make up sponge to apply & have never had a problem with it clogging my pores or streaking. Definitely cheaper than getting spray tanned professionally & I like the results even better than a spray tan.

  2795. I have been a self-tanning semi-pro ever since I started working as a nurse in dermatology practices 5 years ago. Seeing all those patients having skin cancer surgeries and seeing so much prematurely aging skin scared the sense into me, and I am now a dilligent daily sunscreen user. That said, I don't want to look like a cave-dwelling mutant, so I've been experimenting with self-tanners ever since. I was finally able to stop searching for something better after discovering Fake Bake! I have been in love with Fake Bake products for years now, but this new formula is by far their best yet!! The formula dries very quickly, yet allows you just the right amount of time to smooth it on evenly. By the time I am done with my full body application, I can immediately put on my pajamas and not worry about it making my tan streaky.With this product, gone are the days of applying your self-tanner and spending the rest of your evening sticky, afraid to sit down or put clothes on, etc. Additionally, the smell is fantastic, and even in the morning before I wash it off, the self-tanner smell IS there, but it's much more subtle than anything else I've ever used, including the Fake Bake foam and lotion formulas. Best of all, the color is truly realistic and not orange! I LOVE the application mitt and how much easier it makes the tanning process!! It used to feel as if tanning was such a time-consuming task to me, but with this, I am done with my entire body in 10 mins tops, and I never have to worry if I applied it evenly enough or gave it enough time to soak in before dressing. I wake up with a consistently even, believable tan every time. I even had several patients jokingly scold me on my tan, and they were shocked when I confessed it was fake! Lastly, the price on Amazon cannot be beat!! I buy it two bottles at a time, even though one lasts me a long time, just because I NEVER want to be without it! Please tell all your friends about it so they never stop making this stuff! I planto be a lifelong customer!!

  2799. This is the best self tanner I've ever tried!<br /><br />Pros: Smells great! Goes on so quickly and easily. Beautiful brown color, not orange. I've yet to experience it leaving color on my clothes or sheets.<br /><br />Cons: It isn't as dark as I'd like so when I finish this bottle I'm going to try Fake Bake Darker. Also, it wasn't as dummy proof as I'd hoped. I ended up with some streaky/unnatural looking areas around my hands, feet, and ankles after one of my applications. I assume it's just operator error I'm not sure I'd even fault the product for that.<br /><br />Suggestions: Cut the plastic piece attached to the sprayer. Mine was way too long for the bottle and I'd seen another review mention this also. Also, I saw that some reviews complained of the mitt being too large for their hands. I experienced this as well and to solve it, I just spread my fingers out really wide to keep the mitt in place. If you should end up with some areas darker than others, just exfoliate those spots rather heavily and they will blend in fairly well.<br /><br />My experience: I showered, exfoliated, and put on NO moisturizer. I put on the gloves provided and sprayed the product on the mitt. I used it very sparingly since I was afraid I'd goof it up. I removed the gloves and used the leftover residue to apply product to my hands and feet. I went to bed and the next morning I could tell a noticeable difference in my skin color. I got a shower and rinsed (not scrubbed or washed) and the color faded only ever so slightly. However, it still wasn't very dark. I'm of medium skin tone and I'm assuming this happened because I applied the product so sparingly. So, I tried again the next day.This time I used the same regime, only I applied the product quite liberally. The next morning I noticed streaks in areas such as ankles, feet, and hands. I then jumped in the shower and exfoliated those areas extra vigorously and the streakiness blended away. I continue to use this product, usually 2 or3 days in a row to build the tan. It still isn't as dark as I'd like but it's far better than any drug store product I've tried.
